SourceText: Take a moment to check in with yourself.
text: Thatha ithuba ukuzikhangela wena.

SourceText: Wonderful, I am so happy things are going well.
text: Kuhle, ndivuya kakhulu izinto zihamba kakuhle.

SourceText: Great! So good to hear you are in a positive space.
text: Kulungile! Kuhle ukuva ukuba usendaweni elungileyo.

SourceText: Things are not always easy. But that is how we can grow and learn every day!
text: Izinto azisoloko zilula. Kodwa yindlela esingakhula kwaye sifunde ngayo ntsuku zonke!

SourceText: Life can be hard. Whatever you are feeling, you can be proud of yourself for being here!
text: Ubomi bunganzima. Nangayiphi indlela oziva ngayo, unganebhongo ngawe ngokubalapha!

SourceText: You matter! Take a moment to check in with yourself.
text: Ubalulekile! Thatha ithuba ukuzikhangela wena.

SourceText: Great to hear that you are doing well. You are a wonderful parent!
text: Kumnandi ukuva ukuba uqhuba kakuhle. Ungumzali osemagqabini!

SourceText: Sorry that you are not having the best day. Well done for trying to figure everything out. Nobody has all the answers but you really do your best!
text: Uxolo ngoba usuku lwakho alukuhambeli kakuhle. Wenze kakuhle ngokuzama ukubona yonke into. Akakho umntu onazo zonke iimpendulo kodwa eneneni wenza konke okusemandleni akho!

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are not having a good day. Well done for getting up every morning and trying again, even when you are tired. That is real courage and dedication!
text: Uxolo ngokuva ukuba alumnandanga usuku lwakho. Uqhube kakuhle ngokuvuka rhoqo ntsasa nganye uphinde uzame kwakhona naxa sele udiniwe. Yinkalipho nokuzinikela kokwenene!

SourceText: Recognising how you feel helps you care for yourself well. You deserve it.
text: Ukuziqonda indlela oziva ngayo kukunceda wena ukwazi ukuzikhathalela kakuhle. Ikufanele lonto.

SourceText: Wonderful, I am so happy! Keep up the good work.
text: Kuhle, ndivuya kakhulu! Qhubeka nalo msebenzi mhle.

SourceText: Sorry that things are difficult. All families struggle. @global.app_name is here to help!
text: Uxolo ngokuba izinto zisiba nzima. Zonke intsapho ziyasokola. @global.app_name ulapha ukunceda!
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Whatever went ‘wrong’ today, let it go and try again tomorrow. It is okay!
text: Nantonina engahambanga kakuhle namhlanje, yiyeke idlule kwaye zama kwakhona ngomso. Kulungile!

SourceText: Looking after yourself matters. And how you feel matters too!
text: Ukuzihoya kubalulekile. Kwaye ibalulekile indlela oziva ngayo!

SourceText: Sometimes things go great. Sometimes they do not. And sometimes we do not quite know what to think... and that is totally okay! Remember that you are not alone.
text: Maxa wambi izinto zihamba kakuhle. Maxa wambi azihambi kakuhle. Kwaye maxa wambi sivela singayazi ukuba masicinge ntoni... kwaye kulungile ngokupheleleyo! Khumbula into yokuba awukho wedwa.

SourceText: Sorry that things are hard right now. You deserve good things and @global.app_name is here to support you every step of the way.
text: Uxolo ngokuba izinto zinzima okwangoku.Ufanelwe zizinto ezilungileyo kwaye u @global.app_name ukhona ukuxhasa naliphina inyathelo lendlela.
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Caring for yourself is so essential. When you know how you feel, you can see what you need.
text: Ukuzikhathalela kubalulekile. Xa uziva indlela oziva ngayo, uyayibona into oyifunayo.

SourceText: Wonderful, I am so happy things are going well. Keep up the good work.
text: Kuhle, ndivuya kakhulu izinto zihamba kakuhle Qhubeka nalo msebenzi mhle.

SourceText: We all have better and worse days. The fact that you are here shows courage and commitment!
text: Sonke sinemini ezintle nezimbi. Into yokuba lapha kwakho ibonisa ukukhalipha nokuzinikela!

SourceText: Remember that YOU matter! Let’s check in with our emotions first.
text: Khumbula ukuba ubalulekile! Makhe sijonge indlela esiziva ngayo kuqala.

SourceText: Well done for recognising a positive feeling. I am happy to hear you are feeling well today!
text: Wenze kakuhle ekuqondeni imvakalelo ezakhayo. Kuyandivuyisa ukuva ukuba uziva kamandi namhlanje!

SourceText: Well done for recognising that you are not feeling great. Be kind to yourself, you deserve it.
text: Kuhle ukuziqaphela xa ungaziva kakuhle. Yiba nobubele kuwe, ikufanele.

SourceText: Well done for recognising a difficult feeling. It is okay not to be okay sometimes. Remember @global.app_name is here to support you.
text: Kuhle ukuqonda imvakalelo ezinzima. Kulungile ukungazivi kakuhle maxa wambi. Khumbula i @global.app_name ikhona ukukuxhasa.
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Self-care is a key parenting tool. It starts with recognising how we feel.
text: Ukuzikhathalela sisixhobo esiphambili sokukhulisa abantwana. Iqala ngokuziqaphela indlela oziva ngayo.

SourceText: Great. And amazing that you are using this app – it shows your commitment as a parent. Make sure you give yourself credit and praise for what you are doing.
text: Kuhle. Yaye kuyamangalisa ukubona usebenzisa le app – loo nto ibonisa ukuzimisela kwakho njengomzali. Qiniseka ukuba uyazincoma uze uzizukise ngoko ukwenzayo.

SourceText: Every day has its highs and lows. Praise yourself for being here and trying – you are moving forward.
text: Usuku nosuku lunamahla ndenyuka awo. Zincome ngokuba ulapha kwaye uzama- uhambela phambili.

SourceText: Sorry that things are difficult right now. Take a deep breath and know that you are valued.
text: Uxolo ngokuba iimeko zinzima kanye ngoku. Tsala umoya uze uzazi ukuba uyaxatyiswa.

SourceText: Recognising how you feel is key to handling life well. Be real and kind to yourself.
text: Ukuqaphela indlela oziva ngayo ngundoqo ekuphatheni kakuhle ubomi. Nyaniseka kwaye ube nobubele kuwe.

SourceText: You are a star. And you are making a real difference. You can be proud of yourself.
text: Ugqamile. Kwaye wenza oyena umehluko. Unganebhongo ngawe.

SourceText: Everyone has good and bad days. Well done for using this app. It shows you are a committed parent. Remember to praise yourself for it!
text: Wonke umntu unemini ezintle nezimbi. Wenze kakuhle ngokusebenzisa le app. Ibonisa ukuba ungumzali ozinikeleyo. Khumbula ukuzincoma ngalonto!

SourceText: Sorry that things are not easy today. All parents have these days. You are trying and moving forward!
text: Uxolo ngokuba izinto zingekho lula namhlanje. Bonke abazali babanazo ezimini. Uyazama kwaye uhambela phambili!

SourceText: Being a great parent also means taking time to care for yourself every day. It starts with recognising how you feel.
text: Ukuba ngumzali olungileyo kukwathetha ukuthi yibanexesha lakho lokuzikhathalela ntsukuzonke. Lonto iqala ekuziqapheleni indlela oziva ngayo.

SourceText: So good to hear you are feeling well today. You are incredible!
text: Kuyavuyisa ukuva ukuba uziva kamnandi namhlanje. Uyamangalisa!

SourceText: We all have days where we just don’t know. That is okay! You are here and that is what matters.
text: Sonke sibanentsuku apho sivele singayazi nje. Ilungile lonto! Ulapha kwaye lonto ibalulekile.

SourceText: Being a parent can be hard. But you are here and that shows you want to keep improving things. That is a big accomplishment already!
text: Ukuba ngumzali kunganzima. Kodwa ulapha kwaye lonto ibonisa ukuba ufuna ukuphucula izinto. Sele iyimpumelelo enkulu leyo!

SourceText: Taking a moment for YOU makes a big difference for everyone!
text: Ukuthatha ixesha lakho kwenza umehluko omkhulu kumntu wonke!

SourceText: Great that today is going well! What is one thing that has gone well today? Remember to praise yourself for it.
text: Kuhle kuba namhlanje izinto zihamba kakuhle! Yintoni into enye ehambe kakuhle namhlanje? Khumbula ukuzincoma ngaloo nto.

SourceText: Every day has its good and hard parts. Praise yourself for everything you have done so far – you are amazing.
text: Zonke intsuku zibanako okuhle kwaye nenxalenye ezinzima. Zincome ngako konke osele ukwenzile ngoku - uyamangalisa.

SourceText: Sorry to hear you are feeling difficult feelings today. Well done for recognising those emotions and trying to be calm and kind to yourself. You are setting a great example for your family.
text: Uxolo ngokuziva unemvakalelelo ezinzima namhlanje. Wenze kakuhle ngokuqaphela ezomvakalelo kwaye wazama ukuzola wanobubele kuwe. Ubonisa umzekelo omhle kusapho lwakho.

SourceText: Looking after yourself well starts with noticing how you feel.
text: Ukuzijonga kakuhle kuqala ngokuqonda indlela oziva ngayo.

SourceText: Fantastic! And well done for investing in yourself and your family – you have accomplished a lot.
text: Uyamangalisa. Wenze kakuhle ngokuzinikela kunye nosapho lwakho - uzuze lukhulu.

SourceText: Sorry that you are not having the best day. Well done for trying to figure everything out. @global.app_name is here to help.
text: Uxolo ngokuba ungenasuku luhle. Wenze kakuhle ngokuzama ukufumana i@global.app_name ikhona ukunceda.
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Being a parent can be challenging. Take a deep breath and recognise all you have done for your family – you deserve praise!
text: Ukuba ngumzali kungaba ngumceli mngeni. Tsala umoya kwaye qaphela konke okwenzileyo kusapho lwakho - kukufanele ukunconywa!

SourceText: Take a moment for yourself first.
text: Thatha ithuba lakho kuqala.

SourceText: It is great to hear you are feeling positive today. You make a real difference for your family!
text: Kuhle ukuva ukuba uziva ulungile namhlanje. Wenza umehluko nyhani kusapho lwakho!

SourceText: Life has its great and hard moments – that is okay. You are on the right track.
text: Ubomi bunamaxesha anzima namnandi - kulungile. Usendleleni elungileyo.

SourceText: It is normal to have hard days as a parent. Take a deep breath and know you are not alone!
text: Kuqhelekile ukuba nentsuku ezinzima njengomzali. Tsala umoya kwaye wazi ukuba awuwedwa!

SourceText: Take a moment to notice how you are doing.
text: Thatha ithuba uqaphele ukuba unjani.

SourceText: Great! So good to hear that you are in a good space today. What a wonderful feeling!
text: Kulunge kakhulu! Kuhle kakhulu ukuva ukuba ukwimeko entle namhlanje. Enjani ukumangalisa imvakalelo!

SourceText: Some days will have their challenges. That is okay. You are on the right path!
text: Ezinye intsuku zizakuba nemiceli mingeni yazo. Kulungile. Usendleleni elungileyo!

SourceText: Sorry that things are difficult now. It is completely normal to struggle sometimes. Remember that you are not alone!
text: Uxolo ngokuba iimeko zinzima ngoku. Kuyinto eqhelekileyo ukuba usokole maxa wambi. Khumbula ukuba awukho wedwa!

SourceText: There is no right or wrong way to feel. However you are feeling, it is okay.
text: Akukho ndlela ilungileyo nengalunganga omawuzive ngayo. Noba uziva njani, kulungile.

SourceText: Well done for recognising how you feel. Good to hear that you are feeling well today!
text: Wenze kakuhle ngokuqonda indlela oziva ngayo. Kuhle ukuva ukuba uziva kamandi namhlanje!

SourceText: We all have good and hard days. Remember, you are the best parent for your teen and you deserve praise!
text: Sonke sinemini ezilungileyo nezinzima. Khumbula, ungumzali ongcono kubantwana bakho abafikisayo kwaye ufanelwe kukunconywa!

SourceText: It can be hard to cope with everything happening in our lives. Remember, you are stronger than you may think!
text: Kunganzima ukumelana nezinto zonke eziqhubekayo ebomini bethu. Khumbula, womelele kunokuba ucinga!

SourceText: Let’s take a moment for YOU. Looking after yourself well starts with noticing how you feel.
text: Masithathe ithuba nawe. Ukuzijongsa kakuhle kuqala ngokuziqaphela indlela oziva ngayo.

SourceText: Amazing, life is the best when you're feeling good.
text: Kuyamangalisa, ubomi bulungile xa uziva kamandi.

SourceText: Everyone has times when they are not feeling good. This is completely normal. Hopefully you feel better soon.
text: Sonke sinamaxesha ogazivi kamandi. Oku kuqhelekile. Ngethemba uzoziva ungcono kwamsinya.

SourceText: It is part of life to have bad days. Always remember, tough times never last and tomorrow is another day!
text: Yinxalenye yobomi ukuba neentsuku ezimbi, hlala ukhumbula, amaxesha anzima awapheli kwaye ngomso lolunye usuku!

SourceText: How are you feeling today?
text: Uziva njani namhlanje?

SourceText: Happy
text: Uyavuya

SourceText: Okay
text: Kulungile

SourceText: Sad
text: Ulusizi

SourceText: My child chose a competitive activity. I won and then they got angry
text: Umntwana wam ukhetha izinto ezinokhuphiswano. Ndiphumelele kwaye waba nomsindo

SourceText: My child did not like it
text: Khange ayithande umntwana wam

SourceText: Remember, it takes some time for your teen to get used to seeing you praise them. The more time you spend with them, the better it will go!
text: Khumbula ukuba kuthatha ixesha ngomntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba akuve umncoma. Okukhona uchitha ixesha kunye naye, kokukhona kuza kuya kusiba ngcono!

SourceText: My teen did not like it
text: Umntwana wam ofikisayo khange ayithande

SourceText: I forgot to follow through with the consequence
text: Ndilibele ukusilandela isohlwayo

SourceText: We all make mistakes! The more consistent we are with our consequences, the more likely our children will choose to behave positively in the future.
text: Sonke siyazenza iimpazamo! Okukhona singatshintshiyo ngezohlwayo zethu, kokukhona kunokwenzeka ukuba bakhethe ukuziphatha kakuhle kwixa elizayo abantwana bethu.

SourceText: When a problem comes up, we all get angry or stressed sometimes. Remember, when you feel angry or stressed, you can take a pause to help you stay calm and then solve the problem you are facing.
text: Xa kuvela ingxaki, ngamanye amaxesha sonke siye sibe nomsindo okanye sibe noxinezeleko. Khumbula, ukuba xa uziva unomsindo okanye ucaphukile, ungathatha ikhefu ukuze likuncede uhlale uzolile uze usombulule ingxaki onayo.

SourceText: I gave a negative instead of a positive instruction
text: Ndiye ndamnika umyalelo ombi endaweni yomyalelo omhle

SourceText: When we establish rules together with our teens, that helps the family to understand each other better. The rules will be more realistic, and our teens will be more willing and able to follow the rules.
text: Xa sibeka imithetho sisebenzisana kunye nabantwana bethu abafikisayo, loo nto inceda ukuba abantu abakwintsapho baqondane. Imithetho iza kulungela wonke umntu kwaye abantwana bethu abafikisayo baza kufuna ngakumbi baze bakwazi ukuyithobela.

SourceText: Was your teen in a good mood when you tried to set the rule? It is best to set rules when the situation is calm. If you or your teen are tired or hungry, it is better to talk about rules at a later time.
text: Ngaba ebekwimeko entle umntwana wakho ofikisayo xa benibeka umthetho? Kuhle ukubeka imithetho xa imeko izolile. Ukuba wena okanye umntwana wakho nidiniwe okanye nilambile, kungcono ukuthetha ngemithetho ngelinye ixesha.

SourceText: Our teenagers may know things about our communities and technology that we are not aware of. When we actively involve our teens in the mapping activity and really listen to them, they feel heard and valued, and it can be easier to come up with a plan that everyone agrees on.
text: Abantwana bethu basenokwazi izinto ngeendawo esihlala kuzo kunye neteknoloji ekusenokwenzeka asizazi thina. Xa sibabandakanya ngokupheleleyo abantwana bethu abafikisayo ekucebeni izinto size sibamamele nyhani, baziva bemanyelwa kwaye bexatyiswa, ibe kungalula ukuza necebo elamkelwa nguye wonke umntu.

SourceText: It is difficult to know every detail about our communities. Involve another family member or friend in your mapping activity. You can even visit some of the services available and ask what they do. The more we know, the better we can keep our families safe!
text: Kunzima ukwazi zonke iinkcukacha ngeendawo esihlala kuzo. Xa uyila umsetyenzana wakho, bandakanya elinye ilungu losapho okanye umhlobo. Usenokude undwendwele ezinye zeenkonzo ezifumanekayo kwaye ubuze ukuba benza ntoni. Okukhona sisazi, kokukhona sinokugcina iintsapho zethu zikhuselekile!

SourceText: My teen told me that something serious happened to them and I did not know how to handle it
text: Umntwana wam ofikisayo undixelele ukuba behlelwe yinto enobungozi kwaye khange ndazi ukuba ndijongane njani nayo

SourceText: When we are reminded of such experiences, it is normal to feel upset or angry. It is important to find a time when you are calm, so that you can think of what support you need. You may need to talk to someone.
text: Xa sikhumbula lomava, kuqhelekile ukuziva ucaphukile okanye unomsindo. Kubalulekile ukuba ufumane ixesha laxa uzolile ukuze ukwazi ukucinga ngenkxaso oyifunayo. Kusenokufuneka ube nomntu othetha naye.

SourceText: I did not want to tell my family how much I earn
text: Bendingafuni ukuxelela usapho lwam ukuba ndamkela malini

SourceText: When budgeting, we could not agree on what should fall under needs and what should fall under wants
text: Xa sisenza uhlahlo lwabiwo-mali, khange sivumelane ngokuba yintoni ekufuneka iwele phantsi kweemfuno kunye nokuba yintoni ekufuneka iwele kwizinto ekumnandi ukuba nazo

SourceText: I did not understand what to do
text: Khange ndiyiqonde ukuba ndeze ntoni

SourceText: I was afraid my teen would think I was weak.
text: Bendisoyikela ukuba umntwana wam uza kucinga ndibuthathaka.

SourceText: Sharing feelings, especially the difficult ones, sets an important example for your teen! It actually makes everyone in the family stronger, because you can understand and support each other better.
text: Ukuthetha ngeemvakalelo, ingakumbi ezo zingathandekiyo kubekela umntwana wakho ofikisayo umzekelo obalulekileyo! Kwenza wonke umntu osentsatsheni omelele ngenxa yokuba niyakwazi ukuqondana nize nixhasane ngcono.

SourceText: Starting a new thing is always difficult at first. Give yourselves some time to get used to it and keep showing a good example by observing and sharing your feelings. Over time, your teen will learn to do the same, and they will feel even more loved and cared for!
text: Ukuqala into entsha akusoloko kulula ekuqaleni. Zinikeni ixesha lokuqhelana nokuthetha ngeemvakalelo zenu nize niqhubeke ngokuba ngumzekelo omhle ngokunikela ingqalelo kwaye nithethe ngeemvakalelo zenu. Ekuhambeni kwexesha, umntwana wakho ofikisayo naye uza kwenza into efanayo kwaye uza kuziva ethandwa ibe ekhathalelwe kakhulu!

SourceText: Your goal was to spend one-on-one time with your teen.
text: Injongo yakho ibikukuchitha ixesha ukunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo.

SourceText: That’s wonderful! Well done for spending time together. It lays the foundation for a great relationship with your teen!
text: Isemagqabini! Wenze kakuhle ngokuchitha ixesha kunye. Ibeka isiseko solwalamano olusemagqabini nomntwana wakho ofikisayo!

SourceText: Great to hear it went well! When your teen learns how to solve problems, they can use that skill their whole life. What a gift!
text: Ndiyavuya ukuva ukuba kuhambe kakuhle! Xa umntwana wakho ofikisayo efunda ukusombulula iingxaki, unokusebenzisa eso sakhono ubomi bakhe bonke. Sisipho sokwenene!

SourceText: Sorry that this was hard. Sometimes we just have to keep trying. Find a time when you and your teen are calm and try again to talk through a problem using the four steps of problem-solving. Together, you can do so much!
text: Uxolo ukuba oko kube nzima. Maxa wambi kufuneka siqhubeke sizama. Fumana ixesha xa wena nomntwana wakho ofikisayo nizolileyo nize nizame ukuthetha ngengxaki kwakhona nisebenzisa amanyathelo amane okucombulula iingxaki. Nikunye ningafeza lukhulu!

SourceText: Sorry to hear it was difficult for you. Well done for trying!
text: Siyaxolisa ngokuba oko kube nzima kuwe. Usebenzile ngokuzama!

SourceText: Wonderful! You deserve all the happy times!
text: Kuhle gqitha! Uyawafanelekela onke amaxesha okonwaba!

SourceText: Sorry that this was difficult for you. You are a star for trying!
text: Siyaxolisa ngokuba oko kube nzima kuwe. Ungungqa phambili ngokuzama!

SourceText: Great to hear it went well! Getting consequences right helps teens behave better and makes family life calmer.
text: Kuyavuyisa ukuva ukuba izinto zihambe kakuhle! Ukunika imiphumo ngendlela efanelekileyo kunceda abantwana abafikisayo baziphathe kakuhle kuze kwenze ubomi bentsapho buzole.

SourceText: Great to hear it went well! Talking about risks and support options prevents problems and really helps to keep your teen safe.
text: Ndiyavuya ukuva ukuba kuhambe kakuhle! Ukuthetha ngemingcipheko nokhetho lwenkxaso kuthintela iingxaki kwaye kunceda ngokwenene ekugcineni umntwana wakho ofikisayo ekhuselekile.

SourceText: Sorry that this was hard. Mapping risks and places to get support can be challenging and emotional. It really does help to keep your teen safe!
text: Uxolo ukuba oko kube nzima. Ukuceba imingcipheko kunye neendawo zokufumana inkxaso kungalucelomngeni kunye neemvakalelo. Kunceda ngokwenene ukugcina umntwana wakho ofikisayo ekhuselekile!

SourceText: Great to hear it went well!
text: Kuyavuyisa ukuva ukuba izinto zihambe kakuhle!

SourceText: Great to hear it went well. Talking about your finances together really makes your family stronger!
text: Kuyavuyisa ukuva ukuba izinto zihambe kakuhle. Ukuthetha ngezimali zenu kunye eneneni kwenza intsapho yenu yomelele!

SourceText: You're doing well! Even small moments of fun and conversation can help your teen feel valued and motivated. Keep it up!
text: Wenza kakuhle!! Namaxesha amancinci okonwaba nokuncokola kungamnceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo azive ebalulekile kwaye ekhuthazekile. Qhubeka!

SourceText: How did it go?
text: Luhambe njani?

SourceText: What is the main challenge you are experiencing right now?
text: Loluphi ucelomngeni oluyintloko ojongene nalo ngalo mzuzu?

SourceText: My relationship with my teen is not good
text: Ulwalamano lwam nomntwana wam ofikisayo aluluhlanga

SourceText: My teen’s behaviour is difficult
text: Isimilo somntwana wam ofikisayo sixakile

SourceText: I feel stressed, lonely, angry
text: Ndiziva ndinoxinezelelo, ndindodwa, ndinomsindo

SourceText: I have money worries
text: Ndinamaxhala emali

SourceText: I worry about my teen’s safety
text: Luyandixhalabisa ukhuseleko lomntwana wam ofikisayo

SourceText: We often fight in our family
text: Sisoloko sisilwa kusapho lwethu

SourceText: Building a better relationship starts with spending time together - even 5 minutes a day makes a difference! At first, it can be hard to spend time together, as we are all busy and our teens can be in a bad mood sometimes. But spending even 5 minutes a day of focused time with your teen helps to build trust. Try asking your teen what they would like to do together. It can be fun and relaxing for you too!
text: Ukwakha ulwalamano olungcono kuqala ngokuchitha ixesha kunye - noba yimizuzu emi-5 ngosuku kwenza umahluko! Okokuqala, kunokuba nzima ukuchitha ixesha kunye, njengoko sonke sixakekile kwaye ulutsha lwethu lunokuba kwimudi engentle ngamanye amaxesha. Kodwa ukuchitha noba yimizuzu emi-5 ngosuku lwexesha olijolise kumntwana wakho ofikisayo kuyanceda ekwakheni ukuthembana. Zama ukubuza umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba yintoni angathanda niyenze kunye. Inokuba mnandi kwaye ikuphumze nawe ngokunjalo!

SourceText: You can get more support on how to spend one-on-one time with your teen here:
text: Unokufumana inkxaso engakumbi ngendlela yokuchitha ixesha ninodwa kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo apha:

SourceText: All teenagers sometimes behave just horribly! One thing that can help with teenage behaviour is to praise them any time that they do something good – however small. Teens may not look like they want or seek your praise but they still really, really do.
text: Bonke abantwana abafikisayo bayageza ngamanye amaxesha! Eyona nto inokunceda kwisimilo sabantwana abafikisayo kukubancoma nanini na besenza into entle - nokuba incinci kangakanani na. Abantwana abafikisayo basenokungabonakali ngathi bafuna okanye bakhangela ukunconywa nguwe kodwa eneneni, bayafuna.

SourceText: You can get more support here on how to encourage good behaviour through praising:
text: Unokufumana inkxaso engakumbi apha malunga nendlela yokukhuthaza isimilo esihle ngokuncoma:

SourceText: Parenting stress is really high right now. We know exactly how overwhelming life can be. Doing something for yourself can reduce your stress. You deserve it! And when you feel overwhelmed, take back control over your body by taking five slow, deep breaths before responding. Lots of parents found this helpful.
text: Uxinezelelo lokuba ngumzali luphezulu ngeyona ndlela ngoku. Sazi kakuhle ukuba ubomi bunokuba nzima kangakanani. Ukuzenzela okuthile kungalunciphisa uxinezelelo lwakho. Ukufanelekele oku! Xa uziva ukhathazekile, lawula umzimba wakho ngokuwutsala ngamandla umoya ngokucotha, kahlanu ngaphambi kokuphendula. Abazali abaninzi bakufumanisa kuluncedo oku.

SourceText: You can get more support on how to take care of yourself here:
text: Unokufumana inkxaso engakumbi malunga nendlela yokuzikhathalela apha:

SourceText: You are not alone. Money stress is so hard for parents. Try talking to your teen about how much money comes in and what you need to spend money on as a family each month. This can help them to understand why you cannot afford something they want. And when everyone understands where the money goes, it is easier to agree on where you can save together too!
text: Awuwedwa. Uxinezelelo lwemali lunzima kakhulu kubazali. Zama ukuthetha nomntwana wakho ofikisayo malunga nokuba yimalini engenayo nezinto enidinga ukuyisebenzisa kuzo njengosapho nyanga nganye. Oku kunokubanceda baqonde ukuba kutheni ungakwazi ukubathengela into abayifunayo. Yaye xa wonke umntu ekuqonda ukuba iyaphi imali, kulula ukuvumelana ngokuba yimalini eninokuyonga kunye!

SourceText: You can get more support on how to budget and save here:
text: Unokufumana inkxaso engakumbi ngendlela yokwenza ibhajethi uze wonge apha:

SourceText: Teens spend a lot of time outside the house or online, where it is harder for us to keep them safe - many parents worry about this. Try to start a conversation with your teen about safe and unsafe places in your community and online (you might need to try a few times). They may even know some you do not. This can start to help you make a plan together about how to stay safe.
text: Abantwana abafikisayo bachitha ixesha elininzi bengaphandle kwekhaya okanye besebenzisa i-intanethi, apho kunzima nangakumbi ukuba sibagcine bekhuselekile - abazali abaninzi kuyabakhathaza oku. Zama ukuqala incoko nomntwana wakho ofikisayo malunga neendawo ezikhuselekileyo nezingakhuselekanga kwindawo ohlala kuyo naxa kusetyenziswa i-intanethi (kungafuneka ukuzame amatyeli ambalwa). Banokude bazi nezo wena ungazaziyo. Oku kuza kuqalisa ukukunceda nenze isicwangciso kunye sokuba uhlala njani ekhuselekile.

SourceText: You can get more support on how to keep your teen safe here:
text: Unokufumana inkxaso engakumbi ngendlela yokugcina umntwana wakho ofikisayo ekhuselekile apha:

SourceText: When a problem comes up, try to talk about it together. What is the problem exactly? What different solutions are there and what are the consequences of one? That way, you can find a solution that can be OK for everyone.
text: Xa kuvela ingxaki, zamani ukuthetha ngayo kunye. Yintoni kanye kanye ingxaki? Zeziphi izisombululo ezohlukeneyo ezikhoyo kwaye zeziphi iziphumo zaso ngasinye? Ngaloo ndlela, ungafumana isisombululo esinokuba SILUNGELE umntu wonke.

SourceText: You can get more support on how to solve problems together here:
text: Unokufumana inkxaso engakumbi malunga nokusombulula iingxaki kunye apha:

SourceText: Often we know what we want in our head, but we don’t say it clearly enough. Say exactly what you want your teen to do. Try ‘please come home by 7pm’ instead of ‘come home in time’.
text: Ngokufuthi siyakwazi oko sikufunayo ezingqondweni zethu, kodwa asikuchazi ngokucace ngokwaneleyo. Kuchaze ngokuthe ngqo oko ufuna umntwana wakho ofikisayo akwenze. Zama ‘nceda goduka ngo-7pm’ kunokuba ‘ufike ekhaya ngexesha’.

SourceText: I feel stressed, lonely, angry

SourceText: I worry about my teen’s safety

SourceText: We often fight in our family

SourceText: I have a different problem…
text: Ndinengxaki eyahlukileyo…

SourceText: Building a better relationship starts with spending time together - even 5 minutes a day makes a difference! At first, it can be hard to spend time together, as we are all busy and our teens can be in a bad mood sometimes. But spending even 5 minutes a day of focused time with your teen helps to build trust. Try asking your teen what they would like to do together. It can be fun and relaxing for you too!
text: Ukwakha ulwalamano olungcono kuqala ngokuchitha ixesha kunye - noba yimizuzu emi-5 ngosuku kwenza umahluko! Okokuqala, kunokuba nzima ukuchitha ixesha kunye, njengoko sonke sixakekile kwaye ulutsha lwethu lunokuba kwimudi engentle ngamanye amaxesha. Kodwa ukuchitha noba yimizuzu emi-5 ngosuku lwexesha olijolise kumntwana wakho ofikisayo kuyanceda ekwakheni ukuthembana. Zama ukubuza umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba yintoni angathanda niyenze kunye. Inokuba mnandi kwaye ikuphumze nawe ngokunjalo!

SourceText: You can get more support on how to spend one-on-one time with your teen here:
text: Unokufumana inkxaso engakumbi ngendlela yokuchitha ixesha ninodwa kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo apha:

SourceText: All teenagers sometimes behave just horribly! One thing that can help with teenage behaviour is to praise them any time that they do something good – however small. Teens may not look like they want or seek your praise but they still really, really do.
text: Bonke abantwana abafikisayo bayageza ngamanye amaxesha! Eyona nto inokunceda kwisimilo sabantwana abafikisayo kukubancoma nanini na besenza into entle - nokuba incinci kangakanani na. Abantwana abafikisayo basenokungabonakali ngathi bafuna okanye bakhangela ukunconywa nguwe kodwa eneneni, bayafuna.

SourceText: You can get more support here on how to encourage good behaviour through praising:
text: Unokufumana inkxaso engakumbi apha malunga nendlela yokukhuthaza isimilo esihle ngokuncoma:

SourceText: Parenting stress is really high right now. We know exactly how overwhelming life can be. Doing something for yourself can reduce your stress. You deserve it! And when you feel overwhelmed, take back control over your body by taking five slow, deep breaths before responding. Lots of parents found this helpful.
text: Uxinezelelo lokuba ngumzali luphezulu ngeyona ndlela ngoku. Sazi kakuhle ukuba ubomi bunokuba nzima kangakanani. Ukuzenzela okuthile kungalunciphisa uxinezelelo lwakho. Ukufanelekele oku! Xa uziva ukhathazekile, lawula umzimba wakho ngokuwutsala ngamandla umoya ngokucotha, kahlanu ngaphambi kokuphendula. Abazali abaninzi bakufumanisa kuluncedo oku.

SourceText: You can get more support on how to take care of yourself here:
text: Unokufumana inkxaso engakumbi malunga nendlela yokuzikhathalela apha:

SourceText: You are not alone. Money stress is so hard for parents. Try talking to your teen about how much money comes in and what you need to spend money on as a family each month. This can help them to understand why you cannot afford something they want. And when everyone understands where the money goes, it is easier to agree on where you can save together too!
text: Awuwedwa. Uxinezelelo lwemali lunzima kakhulu kubazali. Zama ukuthetha nomntwana wakho ofikisayo malunga nokuba yimalini engenayo nezinto enidinga ukuyisebenzisa kuzo njengosapho nyanga nganye. Oku kunokubanceda baqonde ukuba kutheni ungakwazi ukubathengela into abayifunayo. Yaye xa wonke umntu ekuqonda ukuba iyaphi imali, kulula ukuvumelana ngokuba yimalini eninokuyonga kunye!

SourceText: You can get more support on how to budget and save here:
text: Unokufumana inkxaso engakumbi ngendlela yokwenza ibhajethi uze wonge apha:

SourceText: Teens spend a lot of time outside the house or online, where it is harder for us to keep them safe - many parents worry about this. Try to start a conversation with your teen about safe and unsafe places in your community and online (you might need to try a few times). They may even know some you do not. This can start to help you make a plan together about how to stay safe.
text: Abantwana abafikisayo bachitha ixesha elininzi bengaphandle kwekhaya okanye besebenzisa i-intanethi, apho kunzima nangakumbi ukuba sibagcine bekhuselekile - abazali abaninzi kuyabakhathaza oku. Zama ukuqala incoko nomntwana wakho ofikisayo malunga neendawo ezikhuselekileyo nezingakhuselekanga kwindawo ohlala kuyo naxa kusetyenziswa i-intanethi (kungafuneka ukuzame amatyeli ambalwa). Banokude bazi nezo wena ungazaziyo. Oku kuza kuqalisa ukukunceda nenze isicwangciso kunye sokuba uhlala njani ekhuselekile.

SourceText: You can get more support on how to keep your teen safe here:
text: Unokufumana inkxaso engakumbi ngendlela yokugcina umntwana wakho ofikisayo ekhuselekile apha:

SourceText: When a problem comes up, try to talk about it together. What is the problem exactly? What different solutions are there and what are the consequences of one? That way, you can find a solution that can be OK for everyone.
text: Xa kuvela ingxaki, zamani ukuthetha ngayo kunye. Yintoni kanye kanye ingxaki? Zeziphi izisombululo ezohlukeneyo ezikhoyo kwaye zeziphi iziphumo zaso ngasinye? Ngaloo ndlela, ungafumana isisombululo esinokuba SILUNGELE umntu wonke.

SourceText: You can get more support on how to solve problems together here:
text: Unokufumana inkxaso engakumbi malunga nokusombulula iingxaki kunye apha:

Let’s celebrate you and plan your future @global.app_name support.

SourceText:
Greetings everyone.

Today’s topic is celebration and next steps.

It has been amazing, it has been wonderful having you on this journey. Today we are celebrating our journey together.

Today we are celebrating all the learnings that we have learnt throughout this time together.

Now, let's think of the next steps. What could be the next steps after this? Maybe we are planning to continue all the learnings that we have learnt here. We don't know, we are hoping that for the next steps, the skills, the learnings will continue. We wish you a pleasant, happy, family time. 

Thank you.
text:
Molweni nonke.

Umxholo wanamhlanje ngumbhiyozo namanyathelo alandelayo.

Bekumnandi, kukuhle ukuba nawe koluhambo. Namhlanje sibhiyozela uhambo lwethu kunye.

Namhlanje sibhiyozela zonke iimfundiso esizifundileyo kulo lonke elixesha sikunye.

Ngoku, masicinge ngamanyathelo alandelayo. Ingangawaphi amanyathelo alandelayo emva koku? Mhalwumbi silungiselela ukuqhubeka nazo zonke iimfundiso esiye sazifunda apha. Asiyazi, siyathemba ukuba kwinyathelo elilandelayo, izakhono, nezifundo zizakulandela. Sikunqwenelela okumnandi, ulonwabo, kwixesha losapho.

Enkosi.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about calm consequences.

Our actions have consequences. Some consequences happen naturally (“if you break something, you can’t use it anymore”). Other consequences we set as a family to motivate us to follow the rules (“if you come home late, you can’t go out with friends tomorrow”).

HOW you set and use consequences together matters.

Getting consequences right helps teens behave better and makes family life calmer.
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje singeziphumo zokuzola.


Izenzo zethu zineziphumo. Ezinye iziphumo zenzeka ngokwendalo. ("xa usophula into, awuphindi uyisebenzise nanini na "). Ezinye iziphumo sizihlela silusapho ukukhuthazana ukulandela imigaqo ("ukuba ubuyela ekhaya emva kwexesha, awuzuphuma nezihlobo ngomso").

Indlela obeka kunye nosebenzisa ngayo iziphumo zombini zibalulekile.

Ukufumana imiphumela ngendlela eyiyo, kuncedisa umntana ofikisayo aziphathe ngcono kwaye kwenza nobomi bosapho buzole.

SourceText: How will introducing calm consequences help you and your family? Play to learn more
text: Ingaba ukwazisa imiphumela yokuzola kuzakuncedisa njani wena nosapho lwakho? Dlala ukuze ufunde ngakumbi

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is calm consequences.

It is important that when we introduce consequences to our teenagers we involve them, but also important that we are calm when we introduce consequences.

That will assist us to agree on introducing calm consequences to our teenagers, and our teenagers will easily remember them when they are involved and that will make them responsible.
text:
Molweni, nonke. 

Umxholo wanamhlanje ungemiphumela ezolileyo.

Kubalulekile ukuba sibabandakanye abantwana bethu abafikisayo xa sisazisa ngemiphumela, kodwa kukwabalulekile ukuzola xa sibazisa iziphumo.

Oku kuza kusinceda sivumelane ekwaziseni imiphumela ezolileyo ebantwaneni bethu abafikisayo, kwaye abantwana bethu abafikisayo bayakukhumbula lula xa bebandakanywa kwaye lonto iza kwenza babe noxanduva.

SourceText: Calm consequences work best when they are fair, agreed on together, and followed through consistently - not in anger.
text: Iziphumo zomoya ophantsi zisebenza ngcono xa zinobulungisa, nivumelene nonke, zilandelwe ngokungajikajikiyo - kungekho msindo.

SourceText: Agreeing on consequences together works! Tap play to hear @data.characters.media_female_13.name tell her story
text: Ukuvumelana ngemiphumela ninonke kuyasebenza! Cofa udlala ukuva @data.characters.media_female_13.name exela ibali lakhe
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_13.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
When my teenagers did something to make me angry, I would shout at them and punish them right away. But the next time they did it again! I could not understand why they did not hear me even when I shouted.

@global.app_name helped me understand that my teenagers will listen to me more when I am calm. So, when something happens, I take a deep breath and say “we will talk about this later when we are both calm.”

We even agree on the consequences together now before something goes wrong. This has worked wonders – I have seen a huge change in my teen’s behaviour now that they are more involved, and I have less stress.

I wish I knew this long ago, but it is never too late to start!
text:
Xa abantwana bam abafikisayo benze into endenza ndibe nomsindo,bendibangxolisa, ndibohlwaye kwangoko. Kodwa xa bephinda ukuyenza! bendingayiqondi ukuba kutheni bengandiva noba sendibangxolisile.
@global.app_name indincedile ndaqonda ukuba abantwana bam abafikisayo bangamamela kakhulu xa ndinomoya ophantsi. Ngoko, xa kusenzeka into nditsala umoya ndithi "sakuthetha ngayo ngelinye ixesha xa sinomoya ophantsi."

Siye sivumelane kunye ngemiphumela ngoku ngaphambi ngokuba kwenzeke into engalunganga. Oku kwenze umangaliso-Ndibone umehluko omkhulu kwindlela yokuziphatha komntwana wam ofikisayo ngoba beyinxalenye, kwaye lwatsho lwehla uxinzelelo.

Akwaba bendiyazile kwangaphambili, kodwa akuphelanga xesha lakuyiqala!

SourceText:
Teens often break rules. This is normal - growing up is a difficult time when they are learning about who they are.

Luckily, there are ways to discipline without getting angry or using violence… and they work well!

Giving calm consequences is important because it helps teens learn from their actions and take responsibility for their choices.
text:
Abantwana abafikisayo bahlala beyaphula imigaqo. Oku kuqhelekile - ukukhula lixesha elinzima xa bezifunda ukuba bangoobani. 

Ngethamsanqa, zikhona iindlela zokohlwaya ngaphandle kokuba nomsindo okanye ukusebenzisa ubundlobongela… yaye zisebenza kakuhle!

Ukunika imiphumela ezolileyo kubalulekile kuba kunceda abantwana abafikisayo bafunde kwizenzo zabo kwaye bathathe uxanduva ngezinto abazikhethela zona.

SourceText:
Imagine you are the parent and @data.characters.f1_son_18.name came home late. 
What consequence would help here?
text:
Khawube nombono ukuba ubungumzali kwaye @data.characters.f1_son_18.name afike ekhaya emva kwexesha.
Yeyiphi imiphumela enokunceda apha?
note: The string @data.characters.f1_son_18.name should not be translated.

SourceText: Cannot play with phone the next day
text: Akanakudlala ngomnxeba kusuku olulandelayo

SourceText:
That's right!

And remember, consequences are not quite the same as punishment: they give our teens a chance to learn responsibility for their actions.

And they are more controlled AND effective than hitting or shouting!
text:
Kulungile!

Kwaye khumbula, imiphumela ayiye ifane ncam nesohlwayo: inika abantwana bethu abafikisayo ithuba lokuba bafunde uxanduva ngezenzo zabo.

Kwaye bayalawuleka ngakumbi KWAYE isebenza ngakumbi kunokubetha okanye ukubangxolisa!

SourceText: Take 5 minutes' pause in a separate part of the room

SourceText: Great idea! Calm consequences work best when they are fair, happen soon after the behaviour, and are used the same way each time. This helps your teen understand what to expect and gives them a clear chance to learn from their actions.

SourceText: Wonderful! Positive consequences like this build trust and show your teen that helpful behaviour is noticed and appreciated. When rewards are fair, timely, and consistent, they motivate teens to keep making good choices and strengthen your bond too.

SourceText: Here are some tips to help you with calm consequences:
text: Nazi ezinye zeengcebiso ezinokunceda kwimiphumela ezolileyo:

SourceText: EXPLAIN
text: CACISA

SourceText:
Check you are both calm. Take a few breaths. Explain to your teen why you are concerned about their behaviour.

Explain the reasons why the rule mattered. You can share your feelings – it is okay to say you are disappointed.
text:
Qiniseka ukuba nobabini nizolile. Tsala umoya izihlandlo ezimbalwa. Cacisela umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba kutheni ukhathazwe sisimilo sakhe.

Cacisa izizathu zokuba kutheni lo mgaqo ubalulekile. Ningabelana ngemvakalelo zenu - kulungile ukutsho ukuba uphoxekile.

SourceText: How you introduce calm consequences is important. When you involve your teen, things usually go better!
text: Indlela owazisa ngayo imiphumela ezolileyo ibalulekile. Xa ubandakanya umntwana wakho ofikisayo, izinto zibangcono!

SourceText: AGREE
text: VUMA

SourceText:
Plan consequences with your teen for following and not following the rule.

Ask for their ideas. Talk until you agree on something realistic.

Make a consequence for NOT following the rule and a privilege when they DO follow the rule.
text:
Ceba imiphumo nomntwana wakho ofikisayo yokuwulandela nokungawulandeli umgaqo.

Cela ezakhe izimvo. Thethani de nivumelane ngento esengqiqweni.

Yenza umphumo WOKUNGAWULANDELI umgaqo nengenelo yaxa eye WAWULANDELA umgaqo.

SourceText: Remember, consequences are more successful if you discuss and agree in advance with teens before you apply them.
text: Khumbula, imiphumela iyimpumelelo enkulu xa nibonisana nivumelane kwangethuba nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ngaphambi kokuba uyibeke.

SourceText: ACT
text: YENZA OKUTHILE

SourceText:
**When your teen follows the rule, give praise and privileges!** 
They will feel respected and valued. Remember: The more we praise them, the more they will show that good behaviour!


**When your teen does not follow the rule, follow through with the consequence.** 
When your teen breaks the rule, calmly give the consequence. This should be FAIR (not too harsh), IMMEDIATE (do it straight away), CONSISTENT (same every time).
text:
**Xa umtwana wakho ofikisayo elandela imigaqo, mncome umnike namalungelo.**
Bayakuziva behloniphekile kwaye bexabisekile. Khumbula: Xa siqubeka sibancoma, kuxa beqhubeka nokubonisa indlela elungileyo yokuziphatha.

**Xa umntwana wakho engalandeli umgaqo, landela ngokwemiphumela**
Xa umntwana wakho esophula umgaqo, ngokuzolileyo mnike imiphumela. Kufanele ibenobulungisa (ungabiqatha),
NGOKONANGOKO (yenze ngokonangoko), INGAJIKAJIKI (ngohlobo olunye ngalo lonke ixesha).

SourceText:
My mom and dad would always punish me when they were angry with me. They would shout at me and I would also get angry. I often did not follow the rules, because they were too harsh, I did not understand what they were saying, or I would not even bother listening to them, because we were all angry.

One day, they asked me: Let's think together what the consequence should be for not coming home in time. It was great to give my view – before something happens that makes us all angry. We are all calm and agree first. It is easier for me to follow the rules now because I know I agreed on the rule and on the consequence if I do not follow the rule.
text:
Umama notata basoloko bendohlwaya xa ndibacaphukisile. Bayandingxolisa ndibenomsindo. Bendingasoloko ndiyilandela imigaqo, kuba basoloko bengqwabalala, ndingakuqondi oko bakuthethayo, okanye ndingazisokolisi nangokubamamela kuba bonke bacaphukile.

Ngenye imini bandibuza: Makhe sicinge ngokuba zeziphi iziphumo esinokuzenza malunga nokungabuyi ekhaya ngexesha.
Bekukuhle ukuveza izimvo zam-ngaphambi kokuba kwenzeke into esenza sibe nomsindo sonke. Besinomoya ozolileyo sonke sagqiba kuqala. Kube lula kum ukulandela umgaqo ngoku kuba ndiyayazi ndivumile kumgaqo nakwiziphumo ukuba andiwulandeli umgaqo.

SourceText: ⚠️ Sensitive Content Notice
text: ⚠️ Isaziso esiqulathe uvakalelo

SourceText:
This module includes content that may be sensitive. You can check it out by yourself first. This will prepare you well for sharing the content with your teen and others afterwards.

If you need support, see the “Support Contacts” section in your Library for help.
text: Le modyuli ibandakanya umxholo onokuba novakalelo. Ungayijonga ngokwakho kuqala. Oku kuya kulungiselela ukwabelana kakuhle nomntwana wakho ofikisayo, kunye nabanye emva koko.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about dealing with crises.

All families experience crises. When we prepare together and know where to get help BEFORE something bad happens, we can overcome any crisis.
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje singokujongana nentlekele.

Zonke intsapho zichaphazeleke kwintlakele. Xa silungiselela kunye kwaye sisazi ukuba singalufumana phi uncedo PHAMBI kokuba kwenzeke into embi, singayoyisa nayiphi na intlekele.

SourceText: Can skills to handle crises help your family? Click play to find out
text: Ingaba izakhono zokumelana nentlekele zungalunceda usapho lwakho? Cofa udlala ukuze ufumanise

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is dealing with crises.

Crisis may occur anywhere. Crisis may occur anytime. Therefore, it is important as a family to have plans in place should any family member find themselves in a crisis situation.

It is important to have plans so that every family member may feel protected.

When we are dealing with crises, remember to take a pause, breathe and keep yourself calm. That will help you to deal with crises better.
text:
Molweni, nonke.

Isihloko sanamhlanje sesokumelana nentlekele.

Intlekele ingavela naphi. Intlekele ingavela nanini na. Ngoko, kubalulekile ukuba njengosaphpo nibe nezicwangciso ukuba naliphi na ilungu losapho lizibona likwimeko yentlekele. 

Kubalulekile ukuba nezicwangciso ukuze ilungu ngalinye losapho lizive likhuselekile. 

Xa sijongene neengxaki, khumbula ukuthi ukuma kancinci, utsale umoya, uze uhlale uzolile. Oko kuya kukunceda ukumelana bhetele nentlekele.

SourceText: Every crisis is a challenge, but it is also a chance to grow stronger as a family and show your teen that together, you can get through anything.
text: Yonke ingxaki ingumceli mngeni kodwa ke ikwalithuba lokomelela njengosapho ukubonisa umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba nikunye, kwaye ningandlula kuyo nantonina.

SourceText: @data.characters.media_female_9.name and her teen learned to handle crises together. Hear their story

SourceText:
My teen used to be so angry all the time. He would never listen and we would get into big arguments every day. Through @global.app_name, I started spending more time with my teen and strengthening our relationship. One day he shared with me that he was part of a gang but he wanted to get out.

We made short-term and long-term plans together on how we could do that. Our life looks so different now!
text:
Umntwana wam ofikisayo ebedla ngokubanomsindo ngalolonke ixesha. Ebengasoze aphulaphule kwaye besixabana kakhulu yonke imihla. Ngokusebenzisa i@global.app_name, ndaqalisa ukuchitha ixesha ngakumbi kunye nomntwana wam ofikisayo ukuqinisa ubudlelwana bethu.
Ngenye imin wandixelela ukuba wayeyinxalenye yeqela lemigulukudu kodwa waye wafuna ukuphuma.

Senze izicwangciso zexesha elifutshane nezexesha elide kunye nendlela esinokuyenza ngayo loonto. Ubomi bethu bujongenga bohlukile ngoku!
note: The string @global.app_name, should not be translated.

SourceText: It’s my Uncle, he… he… he touched me.

SourceText: (🤔_thinking_) Take a deep breath... What does my child need? She needs me to be calm and listen.

SourceText: It is true, he… he… made me do it! He made me have sex with him! I did not want to, I swear, and I even said NO, but he told me I would be in trouble.

SourceText: Thank you for sharing this with me. You are not in trouble. This is not your fault.

SourceText: Yesterday when you went to see your friend. He just came and that’s when it happened.

SourceText: It is okay, I believe you my child. This is a big thing and we will find a way to get the help we need. Where could we go for help?

SourceText: Another problem that many parents are worried about is violence and crime. Let’s look at an example together.

SourceText: Yesterday, my friends and I went to a soccer match. Some guys who were drunk started a fight with my friend.
text: Izolo, mna nabahlobo bam besiye kumdlalo webhola ekhatywayo. Abanye abafana bebenxilile baqalisa umlo nomhlobo wam.

SourceText: Continue, I am listening. I hope you did not fight?

SourceText: I did not want to, but I could not just stand there and let them beat up my friend, so…
text: Ndandingafuni, kodwa andizange ndikwazi ukuma apho kwaye ndibavumele babethe umhlobo wam, ngoko…

SourceText: So, did you fight in order to help defend your friend?

SourceText: Everyone was fighting. I saw someone lying on the field in a pool of blood. He looked… dead.

SourceText:
Crisis can make us feel angry or helpless. But this is when our teens really need us to breathe, listen and think. 

Here are some tips to help you deal with a crisis!
text:
Intlekele ingasenza sizive sinomsindo okanye singenancedo. Kodwa kulapho abantwana bethu abafikisayo basidinga ngokwenene sitsale umoya, simamele kwaye sicinge.

Nanga amanye amacebiso anokunceda xa uhlangabezana nentlekele!

SourceText: BREATHE
text: PHEFUMLA

SourceText: Stay calm. Ask yourself, "What does my teen need right now?"
text: Hlala uzolile, Zibuze, "umntwana wam ofikisayo udinga ntoni ngoku?"

SourceText: LISTEN
text: MAMELA

SourceText: Tell them you are there for them and love them.
text: Mxelele ukuba ukunye nabo yaye uyabathanda.

SourceText: THINK
text: CINGA

SourceText: Talk with your teen. What might help the situation? You might need to make immediate plans now and then long-term plans later.
text: Thetha nomntwana wakho ofikisayo. Yintoni enokunceda le meko? Kusenokufuneka wenze izicwangciso ezingxamisekileyo ngoku, uze wenze izicwangciso zexesha elide kamva.

SourceText: More tips
text: Iingcebiso ezingakumbi

SourceText: You can be proud of yourself for exploring ways to get help!
text: Ungazingca ngesiqu sakho ngokukhangela iindlela zokufumana uncedo!

SourceText:
It is helpful to practise dealing with crises before something happens.

Let's look at five family crisis examples together. Imagine you are the parent: What would you do?

Remember: BREATHE - LISTEN - THINK
text:
Kuluncedo ukuziqhelanisa nokuhlangabezana nentlekele phambi kokuba kwenzeke into.

Makhe sijonge le mizekelo minlanu yentlekele zosapho sisonke. Khawuzibone ungumzali: Ungenza ntoni?

SourceText: This week's home activity is to look back at the five crisis examples and discuss what you would do together if this happened to a friend or in your family.

**Choose one example to discuss with your teen:** 

- Crisis 1: @data.characters.f2_son_15.name fights at school
- Crisis 2: @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name gets pregnant

**And remember:**

SourceText: @data.characters.media_daughter_12.name overcame a difficult crisis with the help of her mother. Tap play to learn how
text: U@data.characters.media_daughter_12.name woyisa intlekele enzima ngoncedo luka mama wakhe. Cofa udlala ukufunda ukuba njani
note: The string @data.characters.media_daughter_12.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Two years ago, I was raped by my uncle who stayed in our yard. I did not tell my mother, because I was afraid she would hit me, shout at me, or even throw me out of the house. I did not have anywhere else to go.

When my mother started with @global.app_name, we started spending more time together. I was still afraid, but in the end I shared it with my mother. My mom did not shout, but she listened and told me it is not my fault. We went to the police and the clinic together. I am so grateful I do not have to carry this secret anymore.
text:
Kwiminyaka emibini edlulileyo, ndandlwengulwa ngumalume owayehlala nathi eyadini. Azange ndimxelele umama wam, kuba ndandisoyika ukuba andibethe, andingxolise okanye andilahlele ngaphandle endlini. Andibanga nayo enye indawo yokuya.

Xa mama wam wayeqala i@global.app_name, saqalisa ukuchitha ixesha elininzi kunye. Ndandisoyika, kodwa ekugqibeleni ndaphela ndisabelana naye umama wam. Umama wam zange andingxolise, 
 kodwa wandimamela wandixelela ukuba ayongxaki yam.
Saya emapoliseni nasekliniki sonke. Ndinombulelo ongazenzisiyo kuba andisenayo lemfihlo.
note: The string @global.app_name, should not be translated.

SourceText: ⚠️ Sensitive Content
text: ⚠️Umxholo obuthathaka

SourceText:
This module includes content that may be sensitive. You can check it out by yourself first. This will prepare you well for sharing the content with your teen and others afterwards.

If you need support, see the “Support Contacts” section in your Library for help.
text:
Le modyuli iqulathe umxholo onokuba nobuthathaka. Unakho ukuyijonga ngokwakho kuqala. Izokunceda ukuzilungiselela kakuhle ukuba wabelane ngomxholo kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kunye nabanye emvakoko.

Ukuba udinga inkxaso, jonga " uqhagamshelwano lweNkxaso" icandelo kwithala lwezoncedo.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about coping with grief.

Grief affects us all in different ways.

Whatever you feel, you are grieving in your own way, and that is okay.
text:
Umxholo wanamhlanje ungokumelana nosizi.

Usizi lusichaphazela sonke ngendlela ezohlukeneyo.

Nantoni nayo oyivayo, unosizi ngendlela yakho, kwaye lonto ilungile.

SourceText: What techniques can you use to cope with grief? Tap play to find out
text: Bobuphi ubuchule ongabusebenzisa ukumelana nosizi? Cofa udlala ukufumanisa

SourceText:
Greetings.

Today's topic is coping with grief.

Taking care of ourselves is important, especially when we are facing challenging and difficult times such as coping with grief. We need to stay calm in order to think and act positively whenever we find ourselves overwhelmed. We may use techniques such as taking a pause to calm ourselves down.
text:
Molweni.

Umxholo wanamhlanje kukumelana nosizi.

Ukukhathalela iziqu zethu kubalulekile, ngakumbi xa sijongene nemiceli mngeni kunye namaxesha anzima afana nokumelana nosizi. Kufuneka sihlale sizolile sizokwazi ukucinga kwaye senze ngendlela elungileyo nanini naxa siziva songanyelwe yimeko. Singasebenzisa ubuchule obufana nokuma kancinci sizokuba nomoya ozolileyo.

SourceText:
Taking care of ourselves during grief helps us stay calm and present for our children. 
When we share and name our feelings openly, it can help the whole family feel less alone and more supported.
text:
Ukuzikhathalela ngexesha losizi kuyanceda ukuhlala unomoya ozolileyo kwaye sibekhona ebantwaneni bethu.
Xa sisabelana kwaye siziphe sizichaza imvakalelo zethu ngokuphandle ngendlela esiziva ngayo, inganceda usapho lonke luzive lungekho lodwa kwaye lukhathalelekile ngakumbi.

SourceText: Hear how naming feelings helped @data.characters.media_female_12.name feel closer to family while grieving
text: Mamela ukuba ukuchaza indlela aziva ngayo imncede njani u@data.characters.media_female_12.name azive esondele kusapho lwakhe ngethuba eselusizini
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_12.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
After I lost my husband, the parenting tips that I learnt were so helpful to me: I began breathing calmly whenever I was feeling so sad or angry, and my kids really felt the difference because I was learning to keep calm.

Naming our feelings and being open about how we are feeling has helped me feel closer to my child. Before, I felt like I was the only one who was going through these emotions, but now I know that my child is feeling the same things. We can talk about it and help each other. We don’t feel alone anymore.
text:
Emveni kokuba ndilahlekelwe kumyeni, Iingcebiso zabazali endizifundileyo ziye zaluncedo kakhulu kum: Bendiqa nditsale umoya zolileyo nanini na xa ndiziva ndikhathazekile okanye ndinomsindo, kwaye abantwana bam bebewuva kakhulu umehluko kuba bendifunda ukuba nomoya ozolileyo.

Ukuchaza imvakalelo zethu kwaye sithethe phandle ukuba siziva njani kundincedile ndizive ndisondele emntwaneni wam. Ngaphambili, bendiziva ingathi ndim ndodwa ebephantsi kwazimvakalelo, kodwa ngoku ndiyayazi ukuba umntwana wam uziva ngohlobo olufanayo izinto. Singathetha ngayo kwaye sincedisane. Asisaziva sisodwa ngoku.

SourceText:
Difficult emotions can lead to difficult behaviour – especially with children. Losing a caregiver or a loved one can make your teen feel worried, insecure, or angry, and can often make them act out.

Let’s see what happened with @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name who lost her mother 6 months ago:
text:
Imvakalelo ezinzima zingakhokelela kwimpatho enzima - ngakumbi ebantwaneni. Ukulahlekelwa ngumntu okukhathalelayo okanye umntu omthandayo kungenza umntwana wakho ofikisayo azive ekhathazekile, engakhuselekanga, okanye enomsindo, kwaye ingabenza besoloko besenza izinto.

Masijonge kwenzeka ntoni ngo @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name owalahlekelwa ngumama wakhe kwinyanga eziy 6 ezidlulileyo:

SourceText:
All these options are correct.

Everyone copes with grief differently. We can help each other by accepting each other’s feelings and coming up with ideas together to support each other.
text:
Lonke olukhetho luchanekile.

Wonke umntu uhlangabezana nosizi ngokwahlukileyo. Singancedisana kunye ngokwamkela imvakalelo zabanye kwaye size nezimvo sisonke ukuxhasa omnye nomnye.

SourceText: Here are some tips to help you and your family through times of grief:
text: Nazi iingcebiso ezinokunceda wena kunye nosapho lwakho ngamaxesha osizi:

SourceText: ACCEPT
text: YAMNKELA

SourceText:
Losing someone we love can affect us for weeks, months or years. There’s no right way to feel, and no need to feel better quickly.

Your teen may feel sad, angry, confused, or unwell. They may have nightmares, pain, or school problems. Even if they seem happy, they might still feel sad. This is all normal.
text:
Ukushiywa ngumntu esimthandayo kungasichaphazela kangangeveki, inyanga okanye unyaka. Akhondlela ichanekileyo yokuziva, kwaye akukho mfuneko yokuziva ngcono ngokukhawuleza.

Umntana wakho ofikisayo angaziva ekhathazekile, enomsindo, ebhidekile, okanye engaphilanga. Mhlawumbi banganamaphupha amabi, ubuhlungu, okanye ingxaki zesikolo. Nditsho noba babonakala bonwabile, mhlawumbi basaziva bekhathazekile. Yonke lento iqhelekile.

SourceText: SAY GOODBYE
text: YITHI SALA KAKUHLE

SourceText:
Find a way to say goodbye that feels right for you and your family. Some people hold a ceremony or have a special meal to celebrate the person.

Ask your teen what they would want to do to say goodbye.
text:
Fumana indlela yokuthi sala kakuhle oyiva ilungile kuwe kunye nosapho lwakho. Abanye abantu babamba umsitho okanye babenesidlo esikhethekileyo ukubhiyozela lomntu.

Mbuze umntana wakho ofikisayo bafuna ukwenzantoni ukuthi sala kakuhle.

SourceText: TALK
text: THETHA

SourceText:
Talking or writing about the person can help bring comfort. Gently share your memories—both the happy ones and the hard ones.

Teens may sometimes feel the death was their fault. Kindly remind them it was not. Let them know they can always talk to you about their feelings, and show them it’s okay by sharing yours too.
text:
Ukuthetha okanye ukubhala malunga nomntu kunganceda ukuzisa intuthuzelo. Yabelana ngobunono ngenkumbulo zakho---zombini ezonwabisayo kunye nezinzima.

Abantwana abafikisayo ngamanye amaxesha baye bazive ngathi ukufa yimpazamo yabo. Bakhumbuze ngobubele ayompazamo yabo. Bazise ukuba ngalolonke ixesha bangathetha nawe malunga nemvakalelo zabo, kwaye babonise ukuba kulungile ukwabelana nangezakho.

SourceText:
When we are going through a difficult time, it can help to talk about or write down how we feel.

Let’s practise naming feelings. How do you feel now?
text:
Xa sidlula kwixesha elinzima, lonto inganceda ukuthetha ngayo okanye sibhale phantsi indlela esiziva ngayo.

Masiziqhelanise ukuchaza imvakalelo. Uziva njani ngoku?

SourceText: How could a person feel when someone they love passes away?
text: Angaziva njani umntu xa umntu abamthandayo esweleka?

SourceText: Sad
text: Ulusizi

SourceText: Angry
text: Unomsindo

SourceText: Scared
text: Uyoyika

SourceText: Loved
text: Ethandiwe

SourceText: Relieved
text: Ndakhululeka

SourceText: Brave
text: Ndikhaliphile

SourceText: Someone who is grieving can feel many different emotions. They might also feel lost, shocked, numb, guilty, lonely, or even hopeful — all of these are normal.
text: Umntu oselusizini angeva imvakalelo ezohlukeneyo. Kwakhona bangaziva belahlekile, bothukile, bendindisholo, enetyala, eyedwa, okanye enethemba elikhulu - zonke ezizinto ziqhelekile.

SourceText:
This week's home activity is to share with your teen how you feel, and ask them to also name their feelings.

You can remind your teen of some emotions they might feel - like happy, sad, scared, hopeful, angry, or lonely. There is no right or wrong feeling. Sharing emotions helps you both feel less alone.
text:
Umsebenzi wasekhaya waleveki kukwabelana nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba uziva njani, kwaye ubacele ukuba bachaze iimvakalelo zabo.

Ungamkhumbuza umntwana wakho ofikisayo ngemvakalelo anokuziva - njengoku vuya, ukukhathazeka, ukoyika, ukubanethemba, ukubanomsindo, okanye ukubawedwa. Akukho mvakalelo ilungileyo okanye engalunganga. Ukwabelana ngemvakalelo kunceda nina nobabini nizive ningekhekho nedwa.

SourceText: Can you share how you are feeling with your teen this week and invite them to name their feelings too?
text: Ungakwazi ukwabelana ukuba uziva njani wena nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kuleveki kwaye ubameme bachaze imvakalelo zabo?

SourceText: Yes
text: Ewe

SourceText: That’s wonderful. Talking about emotions helps you and your teen cope and connect during difficult times.
text: Kwakuhle. Ukuthetha ngemvakelelo kunceda wena nomntwana wakho ofikisayo nimelane kwaye niqhagamshelane ngexesha lobunzima.

SourceText: I think so
text: Ndicinga njalo

SourceText: That’s a good start. Even trying to open a conversation about feelings can help your teen feel supported. Keep going - you are doing something very important.
text: Sisiqalo esihle eso. Nokuzama ukuqala incoko ngemvakalelo kunganceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo azive exhaswa. Qhubekeka - wenza into ebaluleke kakhulu.

SourceText: No
text: Hayi

SourceText: That's okay. Talking about feelings can be hard, especially during grief. Try again when the time feels right - every small step towards openness helps.
text: Kulungile. Ukuthetha ngemvakalelo kunganzima, ngakumbi xa usesizini. Zama kwakhona xa ixesha livakala lilungile - onke amanyathelo abheka ekukhululekeni ayanceda.

SourceText: Grief can make both parents and teens feel alone - but talking about your feelings can help you cope together. Even small steps like checking in and sharing emotions can rebuild trust and connection.
text: Usizi lungenza bobabini abazali kunye nabantwana abafikisayo bazive bebodwa - kodwa ukuthetha ngemvakalelo zenu kunganinceda nimelane nazo kunye. Kwaye namanyathelo amancinane afana nokukrobana nokwabelana ngemvakalelo kungakwazi ukwakha kwakhona ukuthembana noqhagamshelwano.

SourceText: Hear how @data.characters.media_daughter_10.name and her father learned to support each other
text: Mamela ukuba kunjani ku@data.characters.media_daughter_10.name notata wakhe bafunde njani ukuxhasana bobabini
note: The string @data.characters.media_daughter_10.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
When I lost my mom, everything changed. I was so sad, but it felt like my dad couldn't understand. Our relationship suffered. We did our own things and we stopped talking to each other. But then something incredible happened.

My dad learnt all these things from the app about what to do when you lose someone. He asked me how I was doing and we started to talk again. He explained that he was sad too, and he even said he was sorry for not talking to me after my mom died. We can now see that it is hard for both of us, and we can help each other. He is supporting me and we are a lot closer.
text:
Mhla ndalahlekelwa ngumama wam, yonke into yatshintsha. Ndandikhazekile kakkhulu, kodwa ndaziva ingathi utata wam akayiqondi. Ubudlelwane bethu babandezeleka. Besisenza izinto zethu kwaye sayeka ukuthetha sobabini. Kodwa kwaye kwenzeka into engakholelekiyo.

Utata wam wafunda zonke ezizinto kwi-app ngokuba wenza njani xa ulahlekelwe ngumntu. Uye wandibuza ukuba ndiziva njani kwaye saqhubeka nokuthetha kwakhona. Uye wandicacisela ukuba naye ebekhathazekile, kwaye uye wathi ucela uxolo ngokungathethi nam emveni kokuba umama wam eswelekile. Ngoku siyabona ukuba kunzima kuthi sobabini, kwaye singancedana. Uyandixhasa kwaye sisondelelene kakhulu.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about giving positive instructions!

Telling our teens what we DO want them to do works better than telling them to STOP doing something.

You will see the difference.
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje simalunga nokunika imiyalelo elungileyo!

Ukuxelela abantwana bethu abafikisayo ukuba BENZE ntoni kusebenza ngcono kunokuba sibaxelele ukuba MABAYEKE ukwenza into.

Uzakuwubona umehluko.

SourceText: Giving positive instructions really works! Tap play to learn more
text: Ukunika imiyalelo elungileyo kuyasebenza ngokwenene! Cofa udlala ufunde ngakumbi

SourceText:
Greetings, greetings everyone.

Today our topic is positive instructions.

It is important to give positive instructions to our children, because when we give them positive instructions they know and understand what we are expecting them to do and they do it the way we want them to do it.

So, at the end it keeps everyone happy.
text:
Molweni, Molweni nonke. 

Isihloko sanamhlanje yimiyalelo elungileyo.

Kubalulekile ukunika imiyalelo elungileyo kubantwana bethu, kuba xa sibanika imiyalelo elungileyo bayakwazi kwaye bayayiqonda into esiyilindeleyo ukuba bayenze kwaye bayenze ngehlobo esifuna bayenze ngalo.

Oko, kwenza wonke umntu ekugqibeleni onwabe.

SourceText:
When you give positive instructions, your teen is more likely to listen! 

And remember to praise your teen for any good behaviour - the big and small things.
text:
Xa unika imiyalelo elungileyo, umntwana wakho ofikisayo uvame ukumamela ngakumbi!

Kwaye khumbula ukuncoma umntwana wakho ofikisayo namgayiphi na indlela yokuziphatha entle - izinto ezinkulu nezincinci.

SourceText: Press play to hear how positive instructions worked for @data.characters.media_female_3.name and her teens
text: Cofa udlala ukuze umamele imiyalelo elungileyo esebenzela u@data.characters.media_female_3.name kunye nabantwana bakhe abafikisayo
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_3.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Before, I used to raise my teens the way I was raised: I would tell them “don’t do this, don’t do that.” We used to fight a lot, but things have really changed when I learnt about giving positive instructions.

Now I focus on the behaviour I want to see, and give clear and simple instructions to my teens. It took time to learn to say “please do this” instead of “don’t do this.”

My teens and even my husband tell me that they love this way of doing things, because now they know what needs to be done. My teen said one day “I really love this new mom,” and my own stress levels have come down a lot.
text:
Ngaphambili, ndandiqhele ukukhulisa abantwana bam abafikisayo ngendlela endakhula ngayo: Ndandibaxelela ukuba ''sanukuyenza lento, sanukuyenza naleya". Sasiqhele ukuxabana kakhulu, kodwa izinto okunene zitshintshile ekufundeni malunga nokunika imiyalelo elungileyo.

Ngoku ndigxile kwisimile endifuna ukusibona, kwaye ndinike imiyalelo ecacile kwaye elula kubantwana bam abafikisayo. Kuthathe ixesha ukuthi "ndicela wenze lento" endaweni yokuba "yenza lento."

Abantwana bam abafikisayo kunye nomyeni wam bayandixelela ukuba bayayithanda le indlela yokwenza izinto, kuba ngoku bayayazi into ekufuneka yenziwe. Umntwana wam ofikisayo wathi ngenye imini ''Ndiyamthanda ngokwenene lo mama wam mtsha,'' kwaye nowam umthamo woxinzelelo usezantsi kakhulu.

SourceText:
Let’s do a thought experiment!

DO NOT THINK ABOUT AN ELEPHANT.
text:
Makhe senze umfuniselo wokucinga!

SUKUCINGA NGENDLOVU.

SourceText:
What are you thinking about? 

You probably DID think about an elephant...
text:
Ucinga ngantoni?

Mhlawumbi UYE wacinga ngendlovu...

SourceText:
In the same way, when we tell our teens “don’t do that,” they often focus only on the thing we told them not to do.
They may not understand what we *DO* want.
And like most of us, they don’t enjoy being told what not to do.
text:
Ngendlela efanayo, xa sixelela abantwana bethu abafikisayo ''suyenza lonto'' amaxesha amanintsi bagxila kuphela kulento besibaxelele ukuba bangayenzi. 
Bangangayi qondi eyonanto esifuna *BAYENZE* 
Kwaye ngokufana nathi sonke, abakonwabeli ukuxelelwa into amabangayenzi.

SourceText:
NOW, THINK ABOUT A CHEETAH!

What are you thinking about?
text:
NGOKU, CINGA NGE NGWE!

Ngoku ucinga ngantoni?

SourceText:
That’s right! Positive, clear instructions help teens focus on what they should be doing.

Teens will also feel more respected this way and are more likely to listen.

Abantwana abafikisayo baye bazive behloniphekile ngakumbi ngale ndlela kwaye baye bamamele ngakumbi.

SourceText: Here are some tips to help you give your teen clear and positive instructions!
text: Nanga amanye amacebiso okunceda unike umntwana wakho ofikisayo imiyalelo ecacileyo nelungileyo!

SourceText: GET REAL
text: YIBA SENGQIQWENI

SourceText: Can your teen actually do what you are about to ask? It may be impossible for them to read quietly all day, but half an hour when you really need it is realistic.
text: Ngaba umntwana wakho ofikisayo angakwazi ukuyenza le nto uza kuyicela? Kusenokuba nzima kubo ukufunda ngelizwi eliphantsi imini yonke, kodwa isiqingatha seyure xa ufuna njalo kusengqiqweni.

SourceText: GET POSITIVE
text: YIBA NGOWAKHAYO

SourceText: Smile, look them in the eye and use positive words. Praise them as soon as they start to do what you ask!
text: Ncuma, ubajonge emehlweni kwaye usebenzise amagama alungileyo. Bancome ngokukhawuleza nje ukuba beqalisa ukwenza into oyicelayo!

SourceText: GET CLEAR
text: CACISA

SourceText: Often we know what we want in our head, but we don’t say it clearly enough. Say exactly what you want your teen to do. Try ‘please come home by 7pm’ instead of ‘come home on time’.
text: Rhoqo siyayazi into esiyifunayo ezintlokweni zethu, kodwa asiyithethi ngokucacileyo. Thetha kanye oko ufuna ukuba umntwana wakho ofikisayo akwenze. Zama 'unceda ubuye ngo 7pm ekhaya' endaweni yokuba 'buyela ekhaya ngexesha'.

SourceText: This week's home activity is to give your teen positive instructions.

Let’s do a quick practice to help you prepare for your home activity! 
Turn each of these instructions into positive ones:

SourceText: More positive instructions means less frustrations. And that is something we all want, right?

SourceText: Hear how positive instructions helped @data.characters.media_daughter_3.name and her mother
text: Yiva imiyalelo elungileyo indlela emncede ngayo u@data.characters.media_daughter_3.name kunye nomama wakhe
note: The string @data.characters.media_daughter_3.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
At first, I did not care much that my mother was doing with @global.app_name. But then I started to see my mother change how she communicated with us.

One day, when I was going out with my friends, she said I must be home by 6pm. I was like “Hmmm okay,” because she normally did not give clear instructions on what she wanted – she would just say nothing and then shout at me for being late when I got home.

When I got home around 5pm, my mother gave me a hug and said “Thank you for being on time.” It was strange, but I liked it.

Since then, we have much clearer communication in the house.
text:
Kuqala ndandingakhathali nokuba umama wayesenza ntoni nge@global.app_name. Kodwa emva koko ndaqala ndabona utshintsho ngendlela anxulumana ngalo nathi.

Ngenye imini xa ndandiphuma nabahlobo bam,wathi kufuneka ndifike ekhaya ngo 6pm. Ndandi "Hmmm kulungile', ngokuba uqhele ukungandiniki myalelo ucacileyo ngento ayifunayo - wayengathethi nto Kwaye asuke andingxolise ngokufika ekhaya emva kwexesha.

Ukufika kwam ekhaya malunga no 5pm, umama wam wandiwola ngobubele wathi "Enkosi ngokufika ngethuba".Yaba ngumnqa, kodwa ndayithanda.

Ukusukela ngoko, saba nemvisiswano entle ekhaya.
note: The string @global.app_name. should not be translated.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about helping your teen learn.

Did you know that spending one-on-one time with your teen can help them do better at school? Today we will share some ideas to help you make the most of your time together.
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje singokuncedisa umntana wakho ofikisayo afunde.

Ubuyazi ukuba ukuchitha ixesha nomntana wakho ofikisayo ninodwa ukuba ingamnceda enze ngcono esikolweni? Namhlanje sizakwabelana ngemibono ezakunincedisa nisebenzise ixesha lenu nobabini libeyimpumelelo.

SourceText: Can having fun help teens learn? Yes! Tap play to learn how
text: Ingaba ukonwaba kuyabanceda abantwana abafikisayo bafunde? Ewe! Cofa udlala ukufunda njani

SourceText:
Greetings everyone!

Today's topic is helping your teen to learn.

There are different fun ways and activities that we can use as parents to help our teens learn. Some of those activities could be playing games together or doing house chores together. Remember, our teens learn better when they are having fun!
text:
Molweni nonke!

Isihloko sanamhlanje kukunceda umntana wakho ofikisayo afunde.

Kukho iindlela ezahlukene zemidlalo nezokonwaba esinokuzi sebenzisa nje ngabazali ukunceda abantwana bethu abafikisayo bafunde. Eminye yalemisebenzi ingakukudlala imidlalo kunye okanye nenze imisebenzi yasekhayeni kunye. Khumbula, abantwana bethu abafikisayo bafunda ngcono xa bonwabile!

SourceText:
Learning does not only happen in school - it happens through fun activities, teamwork, and everyday moments. 
When we involve our teens and share decisions, we help them feel capable, confident, and connected to us.
text:
Ukufunda akwenzeki esikolweni kuphela - kwenzeka ngemidlalo eyonwabisayo, ukubambisana, kwaye nangamathuba emihla ngemihla.
Xa sibandakanya abantwana bethu abafikisayo kwaye sabelane ngezigqibo, sibanceda bazive babenokwazi, bezithemba, kwaye beqhagamshelene nathi.

SourceText: Hear how one-on-one time helped @data.characters.media_female_14.name and her teen bond and learn

SourceText:
Since we started spending more one-on-one time together, we have a better bond, a better understanding between us. I feel better about how I am parenting. I am doing a better job as a parent, not just being a parent, but showing love and working with him.

I like that the app encourages you to work with your children, and not just you are the parent up there and they are down there as the children, but they are involved a lot in the decisions you make that impact on them.
text:
Ukususela siqalile ukuchitha ixesha elininzi sisodwa, sinosondelelwano olungcono, ukuqondana okungcono phakathi kwethu. Ndiziva ngcono ngendlela endingumzali ngayo. Ndenza umsebenzi oncomekayo njengo mzali, ngaphandle koba ngumzali, kodwa ndibonakalisa uthando nokusebenzisana naye.


Ndiyayithanda lento yokuba le app ikukhuthaza uba usebenzisane nabantwana bakho, ungabi ngumzali qha pha phezulu, kwaye abantwana babe pha ezantsi, kodwa baya bandakanyeka kwizigqibo ezininzi ozenzanyo ezibachaphazelayo.
