SourceText:
Yes, talking while doing chores helped them both!

When you do a chore with your teen, take time for yourself, and give them space to talk, you help them feel safe to learn with you.

This is an easy way to build a good relationship and teach them things they won’t learn at school.
text:
Ewe, ukuthetha ngethuba besenza umsebenzi wasekhaya kubancedile bobabini! 

Xa usenza imisebenzi yasekhaya nomntwana wakho ofikisayo, ziphe ixesha lakho, ubanike ithuba lokuthetha, ubanceda bazive bekhuselekile ukufunda nawe.

Olu luhlobo olulula lokwakha ubudlelwana obuhle nokubafundisa izinto abangazifundiswayo esikolweni.

SourceText:
Let’s think of activities you can do with your teen to help them learn.

Remember, teens are better at remembering what they learnt when it is fun.
text:
Masicinge ngomsebenzi onowenza nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ukubanceda ukuze bafunde.

Khumbula, abantwana abafikisayo bayikhumbula ngcono into abayifunda bonwabile.

SourceText:
**Here are some ideas you could try today:**

💬 Storytelling: Share a story from your childhood or culture—or let your teen share one with you. It’s a fun way to connect and learn.
🚶🏾‍♀️‍➡️Walking: Take a walk together. It’s healthy and gives you both time to talk and share feelings.
👩🏾‍🍳 Cooking or cleaning: Ask your teen to help with cooking or cleaning. It’s a good time to talk and teach them why these things matter.
text:
** Nazi ezinye iimbono ongazizama namhlanje:**

💬Lixesha lebali: Balisa ibali ukusukela ebuncinaneni bakho okanye kwinkcubeko yakho - okanye vumela umntwana wakho ofikisayo abalise enye yazo nawe. Luhlobo olonwabisayo lokufunda.

🚶🏾‍♀️‍➡️Ukuhamba: Thathani uhambo kunye. Lusempilweni kwaye lunika ixesha lokuncokola nelokwabelana ngemvakalelo.

👩🏾‍🍳 Ukupheka kunye nokucoca: Cela umntwana wakho ofikisayo ancede nokupheka okanye ukucoca. Lixesha elihle lokuthetha nelokubafundisa ngokubaluleka kwezizinto.

SourceText: Here are some skills you can use to help your teen learn!
text: Nazi ezinye izakhono onokuzisebenzisa ukunceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo afunde!

SourceText: GET TOGETHER
text: INDIBANO

SourceText: People learn better when they learn with others. Spend time with your teen and let them learn with you. When you do activities together, you give them space to learn, to make mistakes and to ask you questions.
text: Abantu bafunda ngcono xa befunda nabanye. Chitha ixesha nomntwana wakho ofikisayo wenze ukuba nifunde kunye. Xa nisenza imisebenzi kunye, banike umtyhi wokufunda, benze iimpazamo kwaye babuze imibuzo.

SourceText: SUPPORT
text: INGXASO

SourceText: Your teen will learn from you if they know you support them. Let them try things and be patient with them. This helps them “learn how to learn”, because they feel safe with you.
text:
Umntwana wakho ofikisayo uzakufunda kuwe xa eyazi ukuba uyabaxhasa. Bayeke bazame kwaye ubenomonde ngabo.
Oku kubanceda "ukufunda ukufunda", kuba baziva bekhuselekile kuwe.

SourceText: PRAISE
text: NCOMA

SourceText: Praising your teen is a powerful way to help them try again. Teens do not get things right the first time and should learn how to try again. Praise them for trying to do things, so they can learn from their mistakes.
text: Ukuncoma umntwana wakho ofikisayo yindlela enamandla yokubanceda bazame kwakhona. Abantwana abafikisayo abazenzi kakhuhle izinto xa beqala kwaye kufuneka bafunde ukuzama kwakhona. Bancome ngokuzama ukwenza izinto, ukuze bafunde kwiimpazamo zabo.

SourceText:
Helping your teen learn can feel stressful, but doing fun daily activities together supports their growth and learning.

This week’s home practice is to try a few activities with your teen!
text:
Ukunceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo afunde kungenza uzive unoxinzelelo, kodwa ukwenza imisebenzi eyonwabisayo kunye kuxhasa ukukhula nokufunda kwabo.

Owaleveki umsebenzi wasekhaya wokuziqhelanisa kukuzama imisebenzi embalwa nomntwana wakho ofikisayo!

SourceText:
It’s not always easy to find things to do with your teen.

Try dancing to your teen’s music or having a simple check-in chat, like asking, “What made you happy today?” or “How can I help you?”
text:
Akubikho lula ngamaxesha onke ukufumana into yokwenza nomntwana wakho ofikisayo.

Zama ukudanisela umculo womntwana wakho ofikisayo okanye incoko yokumkhangela, njengokubuza, "Wonwatyiswe yintoni?" okanye "Ndingakunceda ngantoni?"

SourceText: Can you try one fun activity this week with your teen, like dancing together or having a daily check-in chat?
text: Ungakwazi ukuzama umsebenzi omnye owonwabisayo nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kuleveki, njengokudanisa kunye okanye incoko yokumkhangela?

SourceText: Yes
text: Ewe

SourceText: That's great! Making time for fun and connection is a powerful way to support your teen’s learning and development.
text: Kwakuhle! Ukwenza ixesha lokonwaba nelokuqhagamshelana yindlela enamandla yokuxhasa ukufunda nokukhula komntwana wakho ofikisayo.

SourceText: I think so
text: Ndicinga njalo

SourceText: You're doing well! Even small moments of fun and conversation can help your teen feel valued and motivated. Keep it up!
text: Wenza kakuhle!! Namaxesha amancinci okonwaba nokuncokola kungamnceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo azive ebalulekile kwaye ekhuthazekile. Qhubeka!

SourceText: No
text: Hayi

SourceText: That's okay. It is not always easy to find time, but even one fun moment together can make a big difference. Try again when you are ready.
text: Kulungile. Akululanga ukufumana ithuba, kodwa nexesha elincinci lokonwaba kunye lingenza umehluko omkhulu. Zama kwakhona xa ukulungele.

SourceText: Spending fun, relaxed time with your teen helps them learn important life skills - and it strengthens your bond. Even small changes, like listening more and playing together, can make a big difference.
text: Ukuchitha ixesha lokonwaba, nelokuphola nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kunceda ukufunda izakhono ezibalulekileyo zobomi - kwaye yomeleza ubudlelwana benu. Notshintsho oluncinci, njengokumamela ngakumbi nokudlala kunye, kungenza umehluko omkhulu.

SourceText: Spending quality time together helped @data.characters.media_daughter_11.name and her mother connect and learn. Listen to their story
text: Ukuchitha ixesha elibalulekileyo kunye kuncede u@data.characters.media_daughter_11.name nomama wakhe baqhagamshelana kwaye bafunda. Mamela ibali labo
note: The string @data.characters.media_daughter_11.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
In the past there were times my mom got angry and she would shout at me before beating me. But since my mom started using @global.app_name, she tries to create time for us to interact and for us to have fun discussions.

We play games, we sing together and other stuff… She takes time to listen before jumping to conclusions, like she listens and then she calms down and takes her time to explain, and then be like “what you did is not good” and such.
text:
Kwixesha elidlulileyo kwakunamaxesha apho umama wam wayedla ngokucaphuka kwaye wayedla ngokundingxolisa phambi kokuba andibethe. Kodwa oko umama waqala ukusebenzisa i@global.app_name, uyazama ukwenza ixesha lokusebenzisana nelokuthetha ngezinto ezonwabisayo.

Sidlala imidlalo, sicula kunye kwaye nezinye izinto... Uthatha ixesha ukumamela phambi kokuba atsibelo isigqibo, uyamamela kwaye azole athathe ixesha ecacisa, emva koko athi "into oyenzileyo ayilunganga" kwaye njalo.
note: The string @global.app_name, should not be translated.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about family budgets.

Many families are stressed about money, especially if teens keep asking for things!

When we make a budget together, we can agree how to spend AND save to prevent stress and work towards our family’s goals.
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje singohlahlo lwabiwo mali lwentsapho

Iintsapho ezininzi zinoxinzelelo ngenxa yemali, ingakumbi ukuba abantwana abafikisayo baqhubeka becela izinto! 

Xa sisenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali kunye, singavumelana ngendlela yokwenza inkcitho KUNYE nokonga ukuthintela uxinzeleko nokusebenzela amaphupha osapho.

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is family budgeting.

It is important to create a budget, but it is even more important to create a budget involving the entire family.

Doing it together helps increase the level of understanding of how you spend money as a family and how much you save for the family and you can even come up with plans of how you can save as a family.
text:
Molweni, nonke. 

Isihloko sanamhlanje luhlahlo lwabiwo mali losapho.

Kubalulekile ukwenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali, kodwa kubaluleke nangakumbi ukwenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali olubandakanya usapho lonke. 

Ukuyenza kunye kunceda ekwandiseni umlinganiselo wokuqonda indlela yokuchitha imali nilusapho nokuba longa kanganani usapho, yaye ningeza nendlela yokonga imali nilusapho.

SourceText: When we involve our teens in budgeting, they learn to be responsible with money and work towards goals. That is something we all want for our teens, right?
text:
Xa siba bandakanya abantwana bethu abafikisayo kuhlahlo lwabiwo mali, bafunda ukuthatha uxanduva ngemali kwaye basebenzele amaphupha.
Yinto leyo esiyifuna sonke ngabantwana bethu abafikisayo, akunjalo??

SourceText: Hear how @data.characters.media_female_6.name involved her teens in budgeting
text: Yiva indlela u@data.characters.media_female_6.name abandakanye ngayo abantwana bakhe abafikisayo kuhlahlo lwabiwo mali
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_6.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Saving and budgeting helps me as a parent, and it helps my teens as well to understand where the money goes.

My teens always asked for a lot of things and they did not understand when I said “I do not have money.” They would say “but you have a job!”

I sat down with them and showed them all the things we pay for and how much is left. They understand now and even give ideas on how we can save to work towards our goals like new shoes or a birthday and bigger goals like their school fees. For the older one, I even opened a savings account.
text:
Ukonga nokucwangcisa kuyandinceda njengomzali, kwaye iyabanceda nabantwana bam abafikisayo baqonde ukuba imali iyephi. 

Abantwana bam abafikisayo basoloko befuna izinto ezininzi kwaye abaqondi xa ndisithi "andinamali"
Basoloko besithi "kodwa unawo umsebenzi!"

Ndihleli phantsi nabo ndababonisa zonke izinto esizibhatalayo nemali eshekileyo. Bayaqonda ngoku kwaye banika nezimvo ukuba singonga njani ukuze sisebenzele injongo zethu njengezihlangu ezitsha okanye usuku lokuzalwa nenjongo ezinkulu ezinjengokubhatala imirhumo yesikolo. Komdala, ndiye ndamvulela uvimba wokonga imali.

SourceText:
It can be hard to make ends meet every month. Many families have this problem!

Including @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name – let's have a look:
text:
Kunganzima ukuziphilisa nyanga zonke. Iintsapho ezininzi zinale ngxaki! 

Kuquka u@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name - makhe sijonge:
note: The string @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name should not be translated.

SourceText: I have been taking care of my grandchildren, @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name and @data.characters.f2_son_15.name, since their parents died when they were young. We often struggle with money, as I only receive a small grant.
text: Bendikhathalela abazukulwana bam, u@data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name kunye no@data.characters.f2_son_15.name, kususela ukusweleka kwabazali babo beselula. Sihlala sisokola ngemali, njengoba ndifumana isibonelelo esincinci.

SourceText: I am so stressed. I don’t have any money left. And now I am fighting with my teens over things they want – again.
text: Ndinoxinzelelo olukhulu. Andinamali eshekileyo. Yaye ngoku ndilwa nabantwana bam abafikisayo ngezinto abazifunayo– kwakhona.

SourceText:
Dealing with money challenges, like @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name's situation, is stressful. 

A family budget can help @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name - and YOU!
text:
Ukujongana nemiceli mingeni yemali,njengemeko ka@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name, yenza uxinzelelo..

Uhlahlo labiwo mali losapho lunganceda u@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name-kunye NAWE!

SourceText:
**There are four steps for doing a family budget:**

💭 Step 1: THINK 
🎯 Step 2: CHOOSE 
⚒️  Step 3: BUILD 
📋 Step 4: PLAN
text:
**Sinamanyathelo amane okwenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali lwentsapho.** 

💭 Inyathelo 1: CINGA
🎯 Inyathelo 2: KHETHA 
⚒️  Inyathelo 3: YAKHA 
📋 Inyathelo 4: CWANGCISA

SourceText: Can you complete these steps together with your family now?
text: Ningawagqibezela lamanyathelo nosapho lwakho ngoku?

SourceText: My family can join in now
text: Usapho lwam lungangenelela ngoku

SourceText: Let me try it out by myself
text: Makhe ndiyizame ngoku ngokwam

SourceText:
You need:

- 📓Papers (or old newspaper or a cardboard box) and pens
- 🫘 Stones or beans or anything with lots of bits to represent money

Take a minute to get these things before we start with the first step.
text:
Udinga: 

- 📓Amaphepha (okanye iphephandaba elidala okanye ibhokisi yekhadbhodi) neepeni 
- 🫘Amatye okanye iimbotyi okanye nantoni na enamasuntswana amaninzi amela imali. 

Thatha ithuba ukuze ufumane ezi zinto ngaphambi kokuba siqalise inyathelo lokuqala.

SourceText:
**Step 1: THINK**
Think about what you spend money on each month.
text:
**Inyathelo 1: CINGA**
Cinga ngento oyichitha kuyo imali nyanga nganye.

SourceText:
- Draw pictures of all the things that you and your family spend money on each month.
- Write next to each picture how much each thing costs each month (there is no need to share the numbers if you don’t want to).
- Add up how much money you have to spend each month.
text:
- Zoba imifanekiso yezinto zonke enichitha kuzo imali nosapho lwakho nyanga nganye.
- Bhala ecaleni komfanekiso ngamye ukuba into nganye yimalini ngenyanga (akukho mfuneko yokuba wabelane ngamanani ukuba awufuni).
- Dibanisa yimalini oyichithayo ngenyanga.

SourceText:
**Step 2: CHOOSE**
Think about your needs and wants.
- WANT is something you can live without. 
- NEED is something you cannot live without.
text:
**Inyathelo 2: KHETHA**
Cinga ngezidingo neemfuno zakho.
-IMFUNO yinto onokuphila ngaphandle kwayo.
-ISIDINGO yinto onokungaphili ngaphandle kwayo.

SourceText:
Look at your list of things you spend money on and choose:

- Which are NEEDS that you cannot live without? Why?
- Which are WANTS which are nice to have but not essential? Why?
- Which things could you try to spend less money on?
text:
Jongani kuluhlu lwenu lwezinto enisebenzisa imali kuzo nize nikhethe:

- Zeziphi IZIDINGO eningenakuphila ngaphandle kwazo? Kutheni?
- Zeziphi IIMFUNO eningathanda nje ukuba nazo kodwa ezingabalulekanga? Kutheni? 
- Zeziphi izinto eninokuzama ukungachithi mali eninzi kuzo?

SourceText:
**Step 3: BUILD**
Make a budget!
text:
**Inyathelo 3: YAKHA**
Yenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali!

SourceText:
- Write down what your income is for the month.
- Take some stones or beans or anything with lots of bits - this is your income for the month. For example: If your income is R2000 and you have 20 beans, each bean is R100.
- Decide what you will spend on, and put the stones/objects on that image.

Not sure about your decisions? Having trouble deciding between "needs" and "wants"? That’s totally fine! This exercise will get easier with practice.
text:
- Bhala phantsi ukuba uyimalini umvuzo wakho wenyanga.
- Thathani amanye amatye okanye iimbotyi okanye nantoni na enamasuntswana amaninzi - lo ngumvuzo wakho wenyanga. 
umzekelo: Ukuba umvuzo wakho yi-R2000, yaye uneembotyi ezingama-20, mbotyi nganye yi-R100. 
- Gqibani ukuba niza kuthenga ntoni ngemali, uze ubeke amatye/ izinto kuloo mfanekiso. 

Aniqinisekanga ngezigqibo zenu? Ninengxaki ukwahlula phakathi “kwezidingo” “neemfuno”? Akukho ngxaki konke konke! Lomsebenzi uyakuba lula ngokuziqhelanisa.

SourceText:
**Step 4: PLAN**
Plan how you can save money, so you can deal with emergencies and realise your family goals!
text:
**Inyathelo 4: CWANGCISA**
Cwangcisa indlela onokonga ngayo imali, ukuze uhlangabezane neemeko ezingxamisekileyo ukuze ufikelele ekuwaqondeni amaphupho osapho lwakho!

SourceText:
If you can save even a tiny amount for the future or emergency - it can make a big difference over time.

- Add a circle called “emergencies”.
- Add a circle called “family goals”.
- Now try to move your money around so you can save a bit every month for goals and emergencies.
text:
Ukuba unokonga neyona mali incinci ukwenzela ikamva okanye imeko engxamisekileyo - ingenza umahluko omkhulu ngokuhamba kwexesha. 

- Yongeza isangqa esibizwa ngokuba “iimeko ezingxamisekileyo”.
- Yongeza isangqa esithi “amaphupho osapho.”
- Ngoku zama ukudlulisela imali yakho ukuze wonge intwana nyanga nganye ukwenzela amaphupha kunye neemeko ezingxamisekileyo.

SourceText:
CONGRATULATIONS!!! 🎉 

You have made your budget! Remember to do this exercise again with your other family members - if you agree on a plan together it will make a huge difference!

Now, let's see how @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name made a plan with her money, just like you are doing:
text:
SIYAVUYISANA!!! 🎉

Ulwenzile uhlahlo lwabiwo mali yakho! Khumbula ukwenza lo msebenzi kwakhona namanye amalungu osapho lwakho - ukuba niyavumelana ekucwangciseni ninonke ingenza umehluko omkhulu!

Ngoku, makhe sibone ukuba u@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name ulwenze njani ucwangciso ngemali yakhe, njengokuba usenza:
note: The string @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
I want the best future for my grandchildren, but I do not know where to get the money. Loan sharks are dangerous and paying them back is so expensive.

I should save, but that feels impossible!
text:
"Ndibafunela ikamva eliqaqambileyo abazukulwana bam, kodwa andazi ukuba ndingayifumana phi imali. Oomatshonisa bayingozi yaye imali yabo uyibuyisa seyininzi kakhulu. 

Ndimele ndonge imali, kodwa loo nto ibonakala ingenakwenzeka!

SourceText: My goal is to make sure my grandson can go to high school and my granddaughter can reach her dream of university. How can I save a lot of money with the little money I have?
text: "Iphupha lam kukuqinisekisa ukuba umzukulwana wam ongumfana uyakwazi ukuya kwisikolo samabanga aphezulu kwaye umzukulwana wam oyintombazana akwazi ukufezekisa iphupha lakhe lokuya edyunivesithi. Ndingakwazi njani ukugcina imali eninzi ngale malana ndinayo?

SourceText: I know – let’s start with a plan! First, let me make a budget – a plan for how I can save my money. Then I will save just a little bit of money at a time – I will even join a stokvel.
text: "Ndiyazi - masiqale ngesicwangciso! Okokuqala, mandenze uhlahlo lwabiwo mali – isicwangciso sendlela endinokonga ngayo imali yam. Emva koko ndiza konga intwana yemali ngexesha – ndingade ndijoyine namaqela okonga mali."

SourceText: I should also speak with my grandchildren to choose things that we can spend just a little bit less on each week. They will help me think of things we want but do not need.
text: Kufanele ndithethe nabazukulwana bam ukuze sikhethe izinto esinokunciphisa inkcitho kuzo veki nganye. Baza kundincedisa ndicinge ngezinto esizifuna nje kodwa esingazidingiyo.

SourceText: *(A few years later)*
text: *(Emva kweminyaka embalwa)*

SourceText: Look, we reached our dreams! I did not borrow any money from friends or loan sharks. By saving a tiny bit each week, I managed to pay for @data.characters.f2_son_15.name’s high school and save some money for @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name’s university. I am so proud of this.
text: Jonga, siwafezekisile amaphupha ethu! Andikhange ndiboleke mali kwizihlobo okanye koomatshonisa. Ngokubeka imali encinci veki nganye, ndikwazile ukuhlawula imali ka@data.characters.f2_son_15.name yamabanga aphakamileyo ndaza ndabeka imali ethile ka@data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name yasedyunivesithi. Ndiyazidla ngale nto.

SourceText: Saving is important for one more reason - emergencies! @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name also learnt this along the way:
text: Ukonga kubalulekile nangesinye isizathu: iimeko ezingxamisekile! U@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name uye wayifunda le nto apha ekuhambeni:
note: The string @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name should not be translated.

SourceText: One night there was a horrible storm that broke my roof. Everything was flooded. I suddenly had to find money to fix the roof. I just felt defeated.
text: Ngobunye ubusuku kwabakho isichotho esibi esonakalisa uphahla lwam. Yonke into yayikhukhulisekile. Ngesaquphe kwafuneka ndizame imali yokulungisa uphahla. Ndaziva ndoyisakele.

SourceText:
Having a savings plan could have helped @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name to be prepared for this kind of emergency! 

There are different ways we can save: at home, by buying things we can sell for profit, at a bank, or in a stokvel.

Think of the advantages and disadvantages of each savings option.
text:
Ukuba nendlela yokonga imali bekunomncedisa u@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name alungele izimo ezingxamisekileyo ezifana nezi!

Kukho indlela ezahlukeneyo zokonga: ekhayeni, nokuthenga izinto esinokuzithengisa sifumane ingeniso, ebhankini, okanye emgalelweni.

Cinga ngezinto eziluncedo nezingeloncedo kukhetho ngalunye lokonga.
note: The string @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name should not be translated.

SourceText: What is the best way your family can save?
text: Yeyiphi eyona ndlela ilungileyo usapho lwakho olunokonga ngayo?

SourceText: Save money at home
text: Yonga imali ekhayeni

SourceText: Buy things you can sell for profit
text: Thenga izinto onokuzithengisa ufumane inzuzo

SourceText: Save money at a bank
text: Yonga imali ebhankini

SourceText: Save in a stokvel/savings group
text: Yonga imali emigalelweni okanye kwiqela labantu lokonga

SourceText: Whatever savings plan you choose, it will really help your family move forward!
text: Enoba sisiphi isicwangciso sokonga osikhethayo, siya kuyinceda ngokwenene intsapho yakho iqhubele phambili!

SourceText:
We all have dreams for our family, just like @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name. By setting aside a bit of money every month, you can realise them too!

Let’s come up with some ideas for savings goals for you to make a budget plan.
text:
Sonke sinamaphupha ngentsapho zethu, njengo @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name. Ngokubeka ecaleni imalana qho ngenyanga,nawe ungabaqonda!

Makhe size nezimvo zogcino lweenjongo zokuba wenze isicwangciso sohlahlo lwabiwo mali.
note: The string @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name. should not be translated.

SourceText: What are your family savings goals?
text: Luthini usukelo lwentsapho yakho lokonga?

SourceText: Teens completing school/university
text: Abantwana abafikisayo abagqibezela isikolo/idyunivesithi

SourceText: Building / expanding a house for my family
text: Ukwakha/ukwandisa indlu yosapho lwam

SourceText: Starting a business
text: Ukuqalisa ishishini

SourceText: Buying a car for my family
text: Ukuthengela usapho lwam imoto

SourceText:
Such a great goal!

By making a good budget and saving plan, you can achieve it and feel proud of yourself!
text:
Liphupha elihle kakhulu elo! 

Xa sisenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali oluhle nesicwangciso sokonga, ningaphumelela nize nizidle ngeziqu zenu!

SourceText: Here are this week’s takeaway skills to help you budget and save!
text: Nazi izakhono zaleveki ohamba nazo zikuncede kuhlahlo labiwo mali uphinde wonge!

SourceText: STEP 1: THINK
text: Inyathelo 1: CINGA

SourceText: What do we spend on now?
text: Imali siyichitha entwenini ngoku?

SourceText:
Write down or draw what you spend money on as a family each month. 

How much does each item cost? 
How much money do you need in total?
text:
Bhala phantsi okanye uzobe ukuba nichitha malini ngenyanga njengosapho.

Into nganye iyimalini?
Yimalini oyifunayo iyonke?

SourceText: STEP 2: CHOOSE
text: INYATHELO 2: KHETHA

SourceText: Talk together about needs and wants.
text: Thethani kunye ngezidingo neemfuno.

SourceText:
Which expenses are a ‘need’ that you cannot live without? 
Which expenses are a ‘want’ that is nice to have but not essential? 
Which things could you try to spend less on? 

When we explain and listen to each other carefully, we can make good money choices together as a family.
text:
Zeziphi indleko "ezisisidingo" ongenakuphila ngaphandle kwazo?
Zeziphi indleko "eziyimfuneko" kumnandi ukuba nazo kodwa akubalulekanga?
Zeziphi izinto onokuzama ukuchitha kancinci kuzo?

Xa sicacisa siphinde simamelane kakuhle, singenza ukhetho oluhle sisonke silusapho.

SourceText: STEP 3: BUILD
text: INYATHELO 3: YAKHA

SourceText: Make your own budget.
text: Yenza uhlahlo labiwo mali lwakho.

SourceText:
Write down your income for the month. 
Take stones, beans, or anything with lots of bits - this is your income. 
Agree how much you will spend on each item, and put the objects on that image/word.
text:
Bhala ingeniso yakho yenyanga.
Thatha amatye, imbotyi, okanye nantoni eninzi enamasuntswana - le yingeniso yakho.
Vumelanani ukuba niza kuchitha malini kwinto nganye, kwaye ubeke into kuloo mfanekiso/igama.

SourceText: STEP 4: PLAN
text: INYATHELO 4: Cwangcisa

SourceText: Plan for emergencies and family goals.
text: Cwangcisela iimeko ezingxamisekileyo namaphupha osapho.

SourceText: More tips
text: Iingcebiso ezingakumbi

SourceText:
Draw a circle ‘emergencies’.
Draw a circle ‘saving’.
Move your ‘money’ around so you can save a bit every month for both.
text:
Zoba isangqa ' iimeko ezingxamisekileyo'
Zoba isangqa 'ukonga'
Susa 'imali' yakho ngeenxa zonke ukuze ukwazi ukugcina isuntswana rhoqo ngenyanga kuzo zombini.

SourceText:
This week's home practice is to make a budget again - this time WITH your teen and family!

This is an important and fun thing to do with your family - it takes about 30 minutes.
text:
Kuleveki umsebenzi wasekhaya wokuziqhelanisa kukwenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali kwakhona - kwelixesha nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kunye nosapho lwakho!
Yinto ebalulekileyo neyonwabisayo ukuyenza nosapho lwakho - ithatha malunga nemizuzu eyi 30.

SourceText:
**Remember to use the four steps for doing a family budget:**

💭 Step 1: THINK (what do we spend on now?)
🎯 Step 2: CHOOSE (what are our needs and wants?)
⚒️ Step 3: BUILD (make your budget) 
📋 Step 4: PLAN (plan for emergencies and family goals)
text:
**Khumbula ukusebenzisa amanyathelo amane ngokwenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali losapho.**

💭 Inyathelo 1: CINGA (sichitha entweni ngoku?)
🎯 Inyathelo 2: KHETHA (zeziphi izidingo nemfuno zethu?)
⚒️ Inyathelo 3: YAKHA (yenza uhlahlo labiwo mali lwakho) 
📋 Inyathelo 4: CWANGCISA (cwangcisela iimeko ezingxamisekileyo namaphupha osapho)

SourceText: Can you make a budget with your family this week?
text: Ungalenza uhlahlo labiwo mali nosapho lwakho kuleveki?

SourceText: Yes
text: Ewe

SourceText: Wonderful! Making a family budget is a powerful way to set goals and reduce stress together. Keep it simple and celebrate every small success
text: Uyamangalisa! Ukwenza uhlahlo labiwo mali losapho yindlela enamandla ukuzibekela amaphupha kwaye kunciphise uxinzelelo ninonke. Yigcine ilula kwaye ubhiyozele yonke impumelelo encinci

SourceText: I think so
text: Ndicinga njalo

SourceText: That’s a great start! Even talking about money as a family is a big step. Take it one conversation at a time - you are building important skills together.
text: Sisiqalo esihle eso! Nokuthetha ngemali njengosapho linyathelo elikhulu. Thatha incoko ibenye ngexesha- nakha izakhono ezibalulekileyo kunye.

SourceText: No
text: Hayi

SourceText: That's okay. Budgeting can feel difficult at first. Try starting with one small thing, like planning how to spend this week’s food money, and build from there.
text: Kulungile. Uhlahlo labiwo mali lungavakala lunzima ekuqaleni. Zama ukuqala ngento enye encinci, njengokucwangcisa indlela yokuchitha imali yokutya kuleveki, uphinde wakhe ukusukela apho.

SourceText:
When we involve teens in budgeting, they learn important life skills, like understanding the difference between needs and wants.

Making a budget together also helps teens see that we all need to make hard choices sometimes, but that it helps us to have enough money at the end of the month - and to realise our goals!
text:
Xa sibandakanya abantwana bethu abafikisayo kuhlahlo lwabiwo mali, bafunda izakhono zobomi ezibalulekileyo, njengokuqonda umehluko phakathi kwemfuno nezidingo.

Ukwenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali nabantwana bakho kuyanceda sibone ukuba sonke sidinga ukwenza ukhetho olunzima ngamanye amaxesha, kodwa lonto iyasinceda sibe nemali eyaneleyo ekupheleni kwenyanga - kunye nokuqonda amaphupha wethu!

SourceText: Can creating family budgets help your family? Tap play to learn more
text: Ingaba ukwenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali kungalunceda usapho lwakho? Cofa dlala ufunde nangaphezulu

SourceText:
I used to ask my mom to buy me nice clothes all the time. Each time, she would say “I do not have money,” but I knew that she was getting money from my uncle. I did not understand why she refused to buy me clothes. I thought at some point “she does not love me.”

But one day, she called me to sit down with her and asked “what are the needs and wants in our house.” I started to list all my needs and wants. Then my mother helped me to also think about the family needs. Now I understand where our money is going, towards the things we need as a family.

From that day, I understand I cannot come in and ask any time. Now, when I want something, I wait till the month-end when we all discuss the budget together to see if it fits. We understand each other better now.
text:
Bendidla ngokumcela umama wam andithengele impahla ezintle maxa onke. Ngalo lonke ixesha, ebesithi "andinamali," kodwa bendiyazi ufumana imali kumalume wam. Bendingaqondi ukuba kutheni engavumi ukundithengela impahla. Bendikhe ndacinga ngelinye xesha "akandithandi."

Kodwa ngenye imini wandibiza wandihlalisa phantsi wandibuza "zeziphi iimfuno nezidingo apha ekhayeni." Ndaqala ndadwelisa zonke iimfuno nezidingo zam. Waze umama wandincedisa ukuba ndisele ndicinga ngeemfuno zosapho. Ngoku ndiyayiqonda ukuba imali yethu iyaphi, ukuya kwizinto esizifunayo njengo sapho.

Ukususela ngalamini, ndiyayiqonda andinokungena ndicele nangaliphi ixesha. Ngoku, xa ndifuna into, ndilinda kuphele inyanga xa sele sixoxile ngohlahlo lwabiwo mali sibone ukuba iyangena. Siqondana ngcono ngoku.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about spending one-on-one time with our teens. 

Being a parent can be so hard. Sometimes it feels like our teens never listen to us.

But science shows that spending just a few minutes each day of focused one-on-one time with your teen helps build trust and love.
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje simalunga nokuchitha ixesha ninodwa kunye nabantwana bethu abafikisayo sisodwa. Ukuba ngumzali kukhe kubenzima. Ngamanye amaxesha siziva ngathi abantwana bethu abasimameli. 

Kodwa ingcali zisibonisa ukuchitha imizuzwana embalwa ngosuku nigxile kwixesha lenu ninodwa nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kungancedisa ukwakha ukuthembana kunye no thando.

SourceText: Why is spending one-on-one time with your teens important? Click play to learn
text: Kutheni kubalulekile ukuchitha ixesha kunye nabantwana bakho abafikisayo ninodwa? Cofa udlala ukuze ufunde

SourceText:
Hello.

Our topic today is one-on-one time with our children.

It is important to spend time with our children so that they can get to understand us, and for us to get an opportunity to understand them.

Remember, a family with good understanding lives in harmony.
text:
Molo. 

Isihloko sanamhlanje singokuchitha ixesha kunye nabantwana bethu sisodwa. 

Kubalulekile ukuchitha ixesha kunye nabantwana bethu ukuze basazi, ukwenzela nathi sifumane ithuba lokuba sibazi.

Khumbula, usapho olwazanayo luphila ngoxolo.

SourceText:
Let's discuss, what is one-on-one time?

One-on-one time is when you focus on your teens, without distractions like TVs or phones. Let your teens take lead in choosing what you do or talk about.

It is great if you can spend fifteen minutes a day together, but even five minutes a day is really good.
text:
Makhe sixoxe, kukuthini ukuba nexesha lenu ninodwa? 

Ukuba nexesha lenu ninodwa kulapho ugxila kubantwana bakho abafikisayo, ngaphandle kokuphazanyiswa yi TV okanye umnxeba. Yeka abantwana bakho bakhokhele ekukhetheni into eninokuyenza okanye eninokuthetha ngayo.

Kungakuhle ukuchitha imizuzu eyi-15 ngosuku ninodwa, kodwa nemizuzu emihlanu ngosuku nayo ilungile.

SourceText: Hear how one-on-one time helped @data.characters.media_female_1.name and her teen
text: Mamela ibancede njani ukuchitha ixesha bebodwa @data.characters.media_female_1.name and her teen
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_1.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
When I first heard I had to spend One-on-One Time with my teen, it was hard for me. I did not know when to do it or what to say. I did not want to spoil my teen so that he thinks we have to do everything together.

But I really wanted to build my relationship with my teen and I wanted him to open up about what was troubling him. So we tried the One-on-One Time.

First, it felt weird, but it turned out to be fun! Now we watch his TV programme together and we chat about it. And we can even talk about how my son is changing into adolescence and even about girlfriends and those things!
text:
Ukuqala kwam ukuva ukuba kufuneka sichithe ixesha sisodwa kunye nomntwana wam ofikisayo, kwaye kwanzima kum. Ndandingayazi ukuba ndiqale nini okanye ndithini. Ndandingafuni ukumosha umntwana wam ofikisayo acinge ukuba kumele senze yonke into sisobabini. 

Kodwa enyanisweni bendifuna ukwakha ubudlelwane nomtwana wam ofikisayo kwaye athethe ngokukhululekileyo malunga nento emhluphayo. Siye sazama ukuchitha ixesha sisodwa. 

Ekuqaleni ibingaqhelekanga kodwa yaphela inikisa umdla! Ngoku sibukela imidlalo ye TV kunye kwaye siyancokola ngayo. Kwaye siyakwazi ukuncokola ngohlobo unyana wam atshintsha ngalo njengokuba efikisa kunye nangamantombi nezinye zezozinto!

SourceText:
Let's think of ways to spend time with your teen.

It may take some time to get used to one-on-one time, but the more you do it, the better it gets!

You are an amazing parent for trying this.
text:
Masicinge ngendlela zokuchitha ixesha kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo.

Kungathatha ixesha ukuqhelana nokuchitha ixesha ninodwa, kodwa njengokuba uyenza uye uyiqhela!

Ungumzali oncomekayo ngokuzama uyenza lento.

SourceText: What could you do to spend one-on-one time with your teen?
text: Yitoni onokuyenza ngethuba lokuchitha ixesha ndawonye kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo?

SourceText: Walk to the shops
text: Ukolula iinyawo niye ezivenkileni

SourceText: Play a game/sport
text: Dlalani umdlalo

SourceText: Have tea after school
text: Phungani iti ukuphuma kwesikolo

SourceText: Prepare dinner
text: Lungisani isidlo

SourceText: Eat breakfast/lunch/dinner
text: Yityani isidlo sakusasa/esasemini/idinala

SourceText:
Great idea! 

Feel like you have NO TIME and you are exhausted? Remember to also think of ways that do not take up extra time, like doing a chore together while chatting.
text:
Ngumbono Omhle!

Uziva ingathi awunaxesha kwaye udiniwe? Khumbula ngendlela ezingenakuthatha ixesha lakho elithe xhaxhe, njengokusebenza nobabini nincokola.

SourceText: Here are some skills to help guide you in spending one-on-one time with your teen!
text: Nazi ezinye izakhono ezinokunceda ukukukhokhela ekuchitheni ixesha ninodwa kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo!

SourceText: DAY
text: IXESHA

SourceText:
Try to do it every day. 

Find 5 minutes (or more!) each day when your teen does not have something else they want to do.
text:
Zama ukuyenza ntsuku zonke.

Fumana imizuzu emihlanu (okanye ngaphezulu) suku ngalunye xa umntwana wakho ofikisayo engenanto iyenye yokwenza.

SourceText: PLAY
text: DLALA

SourceText:
Let your teen choose.

Tell your teen that you would like to spend some time with them and that they can choose what to do or talk about. They might think this is weird at first, but they will come to enjoy this time with you!
text:
Yeka umntwana wakho ofikisayo akhethe.

Mxelele umntana wakho ofikisayo ukuba ungathanda ukuchitha ixesha kunye naye. Kwaye angakwazi ukukhetha into eninokuyenza okanye emanithethe ngayo. Angacinga ukuba ayiqhelekanga ekuqaleni, kodwa uzakubuya alonwabele ixesha nawe!

SourceText: STAY
text: HLALA

SourceText:
Focus on your teen.

Switch off the TV and put phones aside. Look at your teen. Nod or say “I see” to show that you are really paying attention. Accept what they say without judging them.
text:
Gxila kumntwana wakho ofikisayo.

Cima i-TV ubeke ifowuni ecaleni ujonge emntwaneni wakho ofikisayo. Nqwala okanye uthi ndiyabona ukubonakalisa ukuba umhoyile. Kwamnkele abakuthethayo ngaphandle kokubagxeka.

SourceText: Spending one-on-one time with your teen can be hard to plan. Here are some easy ideas that worked for other parents.
text: Ukuchitha ixesha ninodwa nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kunganzima ukulungiselela. Nazi ezinye indlela ezilula ezibasebenzeleyo abanye abazali.

SourceText:
**Ideas for one-on-one time with your teen:**
- Walk to the shops
- Play a game/sport
- Do a chore together
- Prepare dinner
- Eat breakfast/lunch/dinner
- Have tea after school
- Watch a TV show
- Review homework
- Chat before bedtime


**Remember to use your new skills:**
📅 **DAY**: try to do it every day,
⚽ **PLAY**: let your teen choose how to spend one-on-one time, and 
🎯 **STAY**: be focused on your teen!
text:
Indlela zokuchitha ixesha nomntwana wakho:
-	Ukuhamba ngenyawo ukuya ezivenkileni
-	Ukudlala imidlalo
-	Yenzani imisebenzi yasekhaya kunye
-	Lungisani isidlo sangokuhlwa
-	Yidlani isidlo sakusasa/esasemini/nesangokuhlwa
-	Phungani emva kwixesha lesikolo
-	Bukelani inkqubo ye TV
-	Jongani imisebenzi yesikolo
-	Ncokolani phambi kokuba nilale

Khumbula ukusebenzisa izakhono zakho ezintsha:**
📅 **USUKU**: zama ukuyenza ntsuku zonke
⚽ **DLALA**: yeka umntwana wakho ofikisayo akhethe indlela eninokuchitha ixesha ninodwa, kwaye
🎯 **HLALA**: Gxila emntwaneni wakho ofikisayo!

SourceText: This week's home activity is to spend 5-15 minutes of one-on-one time with your teen, every day that you can.

Listening closely and sharing small moments helps teens feel loved and supported.

Ukumamela ngenyameko kunye nokwabelana ngamaxesha amancinci kunganceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo azive ethandwa kwaye exhaswa.

SourceText: Here's what @data.characters.media_daughter_1.name has to say about one-on-one time with her mother
text: Nantsi enye @data.characters.media_daughter_1.name Anokuyithetha ngexesha ninodwa
note: The string @data.characters.media_daughter_1.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
When my mother asked to spend time with me, I thought “Maybe something is wrong, maybe she is sick.” But she said “No, I just want to spend time.” I was sceptical, but I accepted.

She asked me what I like doing. It was strange and I was not comfortable, because she never ever spent time with me on my own.

The more she kept on trying and we spent this time together, it felt really nice. She got to share her own childhood with me, things I never heard before. That helped me to also share what is going on in my life. We even talk about boyfriends and about problems I have. I know I can talk to my mother now.
text:
Xa umama wam ecela ukuba achithe ixesha kunye nam, Bendicinga ‘Mhlawumbi ikhona into embi, mhlawumbi uyagula.’’ Kodwa wathi "Hayi, ndifuna nje ukuchitha ixesha.’’ Ndandithabuza, kodwa ndayamnkela.

Wandibuza ukuba ndithanda ukwenza ntoni na. Yayingaqhelekanga kwaye ndingakhululekanga, kuba akazange achithe ixesha kunye nam ndisisiqu. 

Rhoqo emana ezama kwaye sichithe ixesha sobabini, bekuvala kamnandi. Uye wandibalisela ngokukhula kwakhe, kunye nezinto endingazange ndaziva ngaphambili. Ziye zandinceda nam ndibalise ngokuqhubekayo ebomini bam. Siye sathetha nangamakhwenkwe kwakunye nezinye ingxaki endinazo. Ndiyayazi ukuba ndingathetha nomama wam ngoku.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about praise.

Praise is a powerful parenting skill.

If we praise our teens when they do something well, we will see them do more and more positive things!
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje simalunga nokuncoma.

Ukuncoma sisakhono esinamandla kumzali.

Ukuba siyabancoma abantwana abafikisayo bethu xa besenza kakuhle, sizakubabona besenza izinto entle ngakumbi nangakumbi!

SourceText: How will praise help you and your family? Tap play to find out!
text: Ukunconywa kungakunceda njani wena nosapho lwakho? Cofa udlala ukuze ufumanise!

SourceText:
Greetings everyone.

Our topic today is about praise.

It is good to praise our children when they've done good because when we do that, they will do more of that good behavior we want to see.

And let's not forget to praise ourselves when we do good!
text:
Molweni nonke.

Isihloko sethu sanamahlanje singokuncoma.

Kulungile kakhulu ukuncoma abantwana bethu xa besenza kakuhle kuba xa sisenza njalo, bayakwenza ngakumbi kwindlela yokuziphatha elungileyo esifuna ukuyibona.

Kwaye nathi masingalibali ukuzincoma xa sisenza kakuhle!

SourceText: Praise is an easy way to build your teen’s confidence and strengthen your connection. It really works!
text: Ukuncoma yindlela elula yokwakha ukuzithemba komntwana wakho ofikisayo kunye nokuqinisa unxibelelwano. Iyasebenza manyani!

SourceText: Praise works, but it’s not always easy. Hear how @data.characters.media_female_2.name started using it at home
text: Ukuncoma kuyasebenza, kodwa akuhlale kulula.Yiva ukuba u @data.characters.media_female_2.name waqala njani ukuyisebenzisa ekhaya
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_2.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
When we learnt about this praising thing I thought, “We were never praised for things as teenagers, so why should we start now?” But I got interested when I learnt what the benefits of praising could be.

Right after the weekly workshop, I noticed my teen doing what they do every day: washing the dishes. And I said “Thank you for washing the dishes, my girl, it really makes me happy that you are helping out.” My teen was smiling and she even came to give me a hug, which she never does.

This praising business is hard. I still forget sometimes or give praise at the same time as criticism. But praising really makes a difference. I never thought that a simple praise could make such a change in a person!When we learnt about this praising thing I thought, “We were never praised for things as teenagers, so why should we start now?” But I got interested when I learnt what the benefits of praising could be.

Right after the weekly workshop, I noticed my teen doing what they do every day: washing the dishes. And I said “Thank you for washing the dishes, my girl, it really makes me happy that you are helping out.” My teen was smiling and she even came to give me a hug, which she never does.

This praising business is hard. I still forget sometimes or give praise at the same time as criticism. But praising really makes a difference. I never thought that a simple praise could make such a change in a person!

Kanye emva kwemfundiso zeeveki,ndaqaphela ukuba umntwana wam ofikisayo wenza oko bakwenzayo ntsuku zonke: ukuvasa izitya. Ndathi " Enkosi ngokuhlamba izitya, ntombiyam, iyandonwabisa nyhani into yokuncedisa kwakho."Umntwana wam ofikisayo wancuma kwaye weza ezokundiwola,into angazange ayenze.

Lento yokuncoma inzima. Ndisalibala ngamanye amaxesha okanye ndincome ngaxeshanye ndibe ndigxeka. Kodwa ukuncoma kwenza umehluko nyhani. Andizange ndicinge ukuba ukuncoma okulula kungenza utshintsho emntwini! SourceText: Let’s reflect on our own experience with praise.
text: Masibonise ngokwamava ethe okuncoma.

SourceText:
Think about the last time someone thanked you, or said you did something great.

How did it make you feel?
text:
Cinga ngexesha lokugqibela umntu ekubulela, okanye athi wenze kakuhle kakhulu.

Waziva njani?

SourceText: We sometimes have to get used to being praised and praising others. That’s okay.

How does it make you feel when nobody says "thank you"?

text: Ngethuba u@data.characters.f1_mother.name exakekile, iintombi zakhe ezimbini ziyalwa amaxesha amaninzi. Kodwa namhlanje, intombi yakhe endala incedisa udade wabo ngomsebenzi wesikolo!

SourceText: Thank you for doing your schoolwork, @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name, and thank you for helping your sister, @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name. I'm so proud of you!
text: Enkosi ngokwenza umsebenzi wakho wesikolo, @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name, sikwabulela nokuncedisa kwakho udade wenu, @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name. Ndiyazingca ngawe!

SourceText: It is time for some questions!
text: Lixesha lemibuzo!

SourceText: How did praise make @data.characters.f1_mother.name's teens feel?
text: Ukuncoma kubenze baziva njani abantwana abafikisayo baka@data.characters.f1_mother.name's?
note: The string @data.characters.f1_mother.name's should not be translated.

SourceText: Okay
text: Kulungile

SourceText: Try again! Praise often creates positive feelings, like feeling happy or proud.
text: Zama kwakhona! Ukuncoma amaxesha amaninzi kubangela uzive kamnandi, njengokuziva wonwabile okanye unebhongo.

SourceText: Happy
text: Uyavuya

SourceText: Proud
text: Ibhongo

SourceText: That’s right. Praise made them feel happy and proud!
text: Kulungile. Ukuncoma kubenze baziva bonwabile kwaye benebhongo!

SourceText: Why did she praise them?
text: Kutheni eye wabancoma?

SourceText: To get them to do it more often
text: Ukuze abenze bayenze rhoqo

SourceText: To help her finish her work
text: Ukumnceda awugqibe umsebenzi wakhe

SourceText: To make them feel good
text: Ukubenza bazive kamnandi

SourceText: To make herself feel good
text: Ukumenza lo mntwana azive kamnandi

SourceText:
All of those things are true!

When her teens are happy, @data.characters.f1_mother.name feels happy. And she got her work done.
text:
Zonke ezi zinto ziyinyani!

Xa abantwana bakhe abafikisayo bonwabile, u@data.characters.f1_mother.name uziva onwabile. Kwaye umsebenzi wakhe ugqibekile.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_mother.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Here are some skills to help you praise your teens.
You can also praise other adults in your household, too. Notice how they respond!
text:
Nazi izakhono zokunceda ukuncoma abantwana bakho abafikisayo.
Ungabancoma nabanye abantu abadala kwindlu yakho, Qaphela ihlobo abasabela ngalo!

SourceText: SEE IT
text: YIBONE

SourceText: Look for anything your teen does that is helpful or good and praise them for it. They may not show it, but you will see them doing that good thing again. It will also reassure them that you notice and care.
text: Jonga nayiphi na into umntwana wakho ofikisayo ayenzayo eluncedo okanye elungileyo ubancome ngayo. Bangangayibonakalisi, kodwa ungababona besenza into elungileyo kwakhona. Izakubabonakalisa ukuba uyaqaphela kwaye uyakhathala.

SourceText: SAY IT
text: YITHETHE

SourceText: Be enthusiastic – really mean it when you say it!
text: Yiba nentshiseko – nyaniseka xa uyitsho!

SourceText: REPEAT IT
text: YIPHINDE

SourceText: Try to find something to thank them for every day. Even something really small.
text: Zama ukufumanisa into oza kubabulela ngayo suku ngalunye. Nditsho nento encinci kakhulu.

SourceText: It can be hard to think of reasons to praise your teen! Here are some ideas from other parents:
text: Kunganzima ukucinga ngezizathu zokuncoma umntwana wakho ofikisayo! Nazi ezinye iimbono zabanye abazali:

SourceText:
**Thank you for...**
- Being kind to someone
- Cleaning your room
- Joining a family meal
- Greeting other family members
- Looking after your siblings
- Coming home on time
- Showing thoughtfulness
- Saying 'please' or 'thank you'
- Going to school on time
- Doing chores or schoolwork
text:
**Enkosi ngo**
- Ngokuba nobuntu komnye umntu
-Ukucoca igumbi lakho
-Ukuhlala nosapho kwisidlo
-Ukubulisa amanye amalungu osapho
-Ukujonga abantwana bakowenu
-Ukubuya ngexesha
-Ukubonisa ukucinga
-Ukuthi 'ndiyacela ' okanye 'ndiyabulela'
-Ukuya esikolweni kwangexesha
-Ukwenza imisebenzi yasekhaya okanye umsebenzi wesikolo

SourceText: This week's home activity is to praise your teen once a day. It will only take 10 seconds!
text: Kuleveki umsebenzi wasekhaya kukuncoma umntwana wakho ofikisayo kanye ngosuku. Iyakuthatha imizuzwana elishumi!

SourceText: Can you praise your teen once a day this week?
text: Ungakwazi ukumncoma umntwana wakho ofikisayo kanye ngosuku kule veki?

SourceText: Yes
text: Ewe

SourceText: That's great! Parents who practise praise at home get better results!
text: Kuhle kakhulu! Abazali abaziqhelanisa nokuncoma ekhaya bafumana iziphumo ezingcono!

SourceText: I think so
text: Ndicinga njalo

SourceText: You can do it! Try praising your teen for something simple at first, like looking after their siblings or going to school.
text: Ungayenza! Zama ukuncoma umntwana wakho oselula ngento elula kuqala, njengokujonga abantwana bakowabo okanye ukuya esikolweni.

SourceText: No
text: Hayi

SourceText: That's okay. With time, giving praise will become easier. Try to praise yourself for something first, like "Good job using @global.app_name. It shows you care."
text: Kulungile. Ngexesha, ukuncoma kuzakuya kusiba lula. Zama ukuzincoma ngento kuqala, njengo "Umsebenzi omhle" usebenzisa @global.app_name. Ibonakalisa ukuba uyakhathala".
note: The string @global.app_name. should not be translated.

SourceText: Remember, praise is a powerful tool. The more attention you give to positive behaviour, the more positive behaviour you will see.
text: Khumbula, ukuncoma sisixhobo esinamandla. Okukhona uthatha ingqalelo kwindlela yokuziphatha entle, kukona uzakubona indlela yokuziphatha entle ngakumbi.

SourceText: Hear from @data.characters.media_daughter_2.name on how it feels to get praise from her mother
text: Mamela ku@data.characters.media_daughter_2.name ukuba ivakala njani into yokunconywa ngumama wakhe
note: The string @data.characters.media_daughter_2.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
I was grateful that my mother learnt about praise.

My mother always noticed when I was doing something wrong. She would shout at me and hit me.

But when my mother did the workshop, she would praise me for little things. First I thought “What is going on?” but then it continued. I liked it so I did more good things I thought she would like.

It feels great that my mother sees the good things I do, and not just the bad things.

I even said it to her once. During one-on-one time, I said “Thank you, mom, for saying something nice when I do things well, not only when I do things wrong.” This made us both very happy.
text:
Bendinombulelo yinto yokufunda kukamama malunga nombulelo.

Umama wam ebesoloko eqaphela xa ndisenza into engalunganga. Ebedla ngokundingxolisa okanye andibethe.

Kodwa ngethuba umama wam esenza umsebenzi wokuqeqesha, ebendincoma nezinto ezincinci. Kuqala bendicinga "Kuqhubeka ntoni?" kodwa yaqhubekeka. Ndiyithandile kwaye ndenza izinto ezilungileyo endicinga uzakuzithanda.

Ivakala kamnandi into yokuba umama wam eyibona imisebenzi emihle endiyenzayo, hayi imisebenzi emibi kuphela.

Bendikhe ndamxele kanye. Ngexesha lokuchitha ixesha kunye, ndithe " Enkosi, mama, ngokuthetha into entle xa ndisenza kakuhle, hayi xa ndisenza izinto ezingalunganga kuphela." Lento isenze sonwaba xa sisobabini.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about problem solving. 

Every family faces challenges, but when we work together we can deal with problems in an effective and peaceful way.

What a great skill for your teen to learn too!
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje singo kusombulula ingxaki.

Usapho ngalunye lujamelene nemiceli-mngeni, kodwa xa sisebenza sonke singahlangabezana neengxaki ngendlela ephumelelayo nenoxolo. 

Esinjani sona isakhona umntana wakho ofikisayo angasifunda!

SourceText: How can problem solving help you and your family?
text: Ukusombulula ingxaki  kungakunceda njani wena nosapho lwakho.

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is problem solving.

We all know that in life there are times where we face problems, and we all know in a way that when we find ourselves in these situations, it is difficult to think of immediate positive solutions.

Therefore, it is important that when we are facing problems we take a pause, we breathe, keep calm and think of problem-solving skills that we may use.

Remember to include our teenagers when we are solving problems. This will help them to become responsible and learn how to solve their own problems in the future.
text:
Molweni, nonke. 

Isihloko sanamhlanje singokusombulula ingxaki. 

Sonke siyazi ukuba ebomini akhona amaxesha esikhe sijamelane neengxaki, yaye sonke siyazi ngandlel’ athile ukuba xa sizifumana sikwezi meko, kunzima ukucinga ngezisombululo ezikhawulezileyo ezilungileyo. 

Ngenxa yoko, kubalulekile ukuba xa sijamelene neengxaki khe sime, sitsale umoya, sizole size sicinge ngobuchule bokusombulula iingxaki esinokubusebenzisa. 

Khumbula ukuquka abantwana bethu abafikisiayo xa sicombulula iingxaki. Oku kuya kubanceda baqole baze bafunde indlela yokucombulula iingxaki zabo kwixesha elizayo.

SourceText:
As parents, we sometimes think we need to fix every problem by ourselves. And teens can think the same! 

By involving your teen, you strengthen your relationship as well as their confidence. Together you can overcome anything.
text:
Singabazali, ngamanye amaxesha sicinga ukuba kufuneka silungise zonke ingaxaki ngokwethu. Kwaye nabantwana abafikisiyo bacinga ngendlela enye!

Ngokubandakanya umntwana wakho ofikisayo, uqinisa ubudlelwane kwakunye nokuzithemba kwabo. Ninonke ningoyisa yonke into..

SourceText: Can problem solving keep your teens safe? It did for @data.characters.media_female_4.name - tap play to hear her story
text: Ingaba ukusombulula iingxaki kungangcina abantwana bakho abafikisayo bekhuselekile? Yenzekile ku@data.characters.media_female_4.name- cofa dlala uzova ibali lakhe
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_4.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
I did not have a good relationship with my daughter. I was always shouting at her, and she was refusing to go to school.

Only when I started spending One-on-One time with her, I realised that she did not want to go to school because she was being bullied at school. We sat down and used the 6 steps of problem solving. We identified the problem, and figured out solutions together: “What can I do as a parent so you can attend school and feel safe?”

We agreed I would go talk to the teacher to find a way forward. We really found the solutions together, and we are closer now.
text:
Bendingenabo budlelwana obulungileyo nentombi yam. Bendisoloko ndimngxolisa kwaye akafuna ukuya esikolweni.

Xa ndandiqala ukuchitha ixesha naye sisodwa, ndfumanisa ukuba akafuni ukuya eskolweni kuba exhatshazwa eskolweni. Sihleli phantsi sasebenzisa amanyathelo ayi 6 wokusombulula ingxaki. Siyibonile ingxaki, kwaye sakhangela isisombululo sisonke. "Ndingenza ntoni njengomzali ukuze ukwazi ukuya eskolweni kwaye uzive ekhuselekile."

 Siye savumelana ukuba ndizothetha notitshala ukuze sizokufumana indlela yokubheka phambili. Ngokwenene siye safumana izisombululo kunye kwaye sisondelelene ngoku.

SourceText: Let’s look at what happened to @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name and her mother when @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name got a phone from a boy… Can you believe it!
text: Makhe sijonge oko kwenzekileyo ku@data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name nomama wakhe xa u@data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name eye wafumana ifowuni kwinkwenkwe… ungakholelwa!

SourceText: @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name, where did you get that thing?
text: @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name, uyifumenephi lonto?
note: The string @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name, should not be translated.

SourceText: @data.characters.man_threat.name bought it for me. It’s a nice phone, @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name. It takes great photos!
text: @data.characters.man_threat.name undithengele. Yifowuni entle, @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name. Ithatha iifoto ezintle!

SourceText: I don’t want to see that expensive thing! That boy is no good! How does he think you are going to repay him for this?!
text: Andifuni nokuyibona lonto inexabiso elibizayo! Lankwenkwe ayilunganga! ucinga ukuba uzakumbhatala njani ngalento?!

SourceText: That’s not how it works, @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name! That’s not fair!
text: Ayisebenzi njalo, @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name! Ayilunganga lonto!
note: The string @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name! should not be translated.

SourceText: I do not want to hear it!
text: Andifuni nokuyiva lonto!

SourceText: You are not even trying to listen to me! I do not know why I even try with you!
text: Awufuni nokuzama ukundimamela! Andiyazi nokuba kutheni ndizama nawe!

SourceText:
When you face a problem, take a few deep breaths to help you stay calm. 
Then, try to handle the problem using these four steps!
text:
Xa ujongene nengxaki, tsala umoya kancinci ukukunceda uhlale uzolile.
Emva koko, zama ukulungisa ingxaki usebenzisa lamanyathelo mane!

SourceText: KNOW IT
text: YAZI

SourceText: Identify the problem.
text: Fumanisa ingxaki.

SourceText: SOLVE IT
text: YISOMBULULE

SourceText: Think of possible solutions and what would happen if we used them.
text: Cinga ngezisombululo ezinokubakho nokuthi kungenzeka ntoni ukuba sinokuzisebenzisa.

SourceText: TRY IT
text: SIZAME

SourceText: Choose a solution and try it out.
text: Khetha isisombululo uze usizame.

SourceText: TEST IT
text: SIVAVANYE

SourceText: Did it work? Great! If it did not work, then try another solution.
text: Ngaba sisebenzile? Kulunge kakhulu! Ukuba asikhange sisebenze, khawuzame esinye isisombululo.

SourceText: @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name is coming home from work.
text: @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name ubuya emsebenzini.
note: The string @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name should not be translated.

SourceText: (🤔_thinking_) Ay my poor feet! I need to sit down for a moment and drink a cup of coffee before I start preparing food for everyone.
text: (🤔_ecinga_) Ay unyawana lam! Ndidinga ukuhlala phantsi umzuzwana ndiphunge phambi kokuba ndiqale ukulungiselela isidlo somntu wonke.

SourceText: @data.characters.f2_son_15.name! What are you doing? That bread is for dinner! Now there will not be enough for us all!
text: @data.characters.f2_son_15.name! Wenza ntoni? Eso sonka sesangokuhlwa! Ngoku asizokwanela kuthi sonke!
note: The string @data.characters.f2_son_15.name! should not be translated.

SourceText: Sorry, @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name, I was just hungry. I can explain, you see, there is this guy at school...
text: Uxolo, @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name, bendilambile, ndingakucacisela,uyabona, kukho lomfana eskolweni...
note: The string @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name, should not be translated.

SourceText: (🤔_thinking_) Take a pause… just breathe…
text: (🤔_ecinga_) Yima... tsala umoya…

SourceText: Just give me a moment. I am tired and now worried about having enough food for dinner.
text: Ndicela undiphe umzuzwana. ndidiniwe kwaye ndikhathazekile ngokuba nokutya okwaneleyo kwesidlo sangokuhlwa.

SourceText: I am sorry, @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name.
text: Ndiyaxolisa, @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name.
note: The string @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name. should not be translated.

SourceText: Now tell me, why are you so hungry? Did you not eat your lunch at school?
text: Ngoku ndixelele, kutheni ulambile? Khange usitye isidlo sakho sasemini eskolweni?

SourceText: That is the problem. There is a guy at school who bullies me. He says if I do not give my lunch to him every day, he and his friends will hurt me. He makes me so mad!
text: Yingxaki leyo. Kukho omnye umfana pha eskolweni ondintlontayo. Uthi ukuba andimniki isidlo sam sasemini imihla yonke, yena nabahlobo bakhe bazakundilimaza. Uyandiphambanisa!

SourceText: I am sorry to hear that but am glad that you told me, @data.characters.f2_son_15.name. It does not mean that you can eat everybody’s dinner. After we speak, you need to go to the shop to buy some more bread. But first, what do you think we should do about the bully problem?
text: @data.characters.f2_son_15.name Ndiyaxolisa ukuva oko kodwa ndiyavuya undixelele. Loo nto ayithethi ukuba kumele utye isidlo sangokuhlwa sabantu bonke. Emva kokuba sithethile, kufuneka uyokuthenga esinye isonka evenkileni. Kodwa kuqala, ucinga ukuba sifanele senze ntoni ngale ngxaki yokuntlontwa?
note: The string @data.characters.f2_son_15.name. should not be translated.

SourceText: Well… I want to just hit him or get him back.
text: Kulungile... Ndifuna ukumbetha okanye abuye umva.

SourceText: Hmmm… what do you think will happen to you if you do that?
text: Hmmm.. ucinga kuzakwenzeka ntoni kuwe xa wenze lonto?

SourceText: I don’t know. He is bigger than me so he will probably hurt me more. And I could get into trouble at school and get expelled.
text: Andiyazi, umkhulu kunam ngoko ke mhlawumbi angandenzakalisa kakhulu. kwaye ndingangena engxakini eskolweni kwaye ndigxothwe.

SourceText: Yes, that could happen. What could we do instead?
text: Ewe, ingenzeka lonto. Singenza ntoni endaweni yoko?

SourceText: I guess I could tell the teacher. But then the other kids will call me a snitch. Maybe you could talk to the teacher?
text: Ndicinga ukuba ndimxelele utitshala, kodwa abanye abantwana bazandibiza umngcatshi. Mhlawumbi ungathetha no titshala?

SourceText: That sounds like a better idea. I could also have a word with his parents if you want me to.
text: Ivakala njenge mbono engcono. Ndingaphinda ndithethe nabazali bakhe ukuba uyafuna.

SourceText: Sure. If you think that would help too. Thanks, @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name.
text: Ngokuqinisekileyo. Ukuba ucinga ingakunceda nayo. Enkosi, @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name.
note: The string @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name. should not be translated.

SourceText: Anything for you, my dear. I will do it first thing after dinner. And you know? If that does not work, we can always try something else together.
text: Nantoni na, sithandwa. Ndizokuqala ngayo emva kwesidlo sangokuhlwa. Kwaye uyayazi? Ukuba lonto ayisebenzi, sizakuphinda sizame enye intyo sobabini.

SourceText: Thanks, @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name.
text: Enkosi, @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name.
note: The string @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name. should not be translated.

SourceText: *A week later…*
text: *Emva kweveki...*

SourceText: How are things going at school now?
text: Zihamba njani izinto eskolweni ngoku?

SourceText: It is going better, the boy does not take my lunch anymore. But he is still being really mean to me.
text: Kuhamba ngcono, inkwenkwe ayisasithathi isidlo sam sasemini nakanye. Kodwa usaqhubeka nokuziphatha kakubi kum.

SourceText: I am sorry to hear that, @data.characters.f2_son_15.name. Shall I ask your uncle to go talk to his parents? If that does not work, we will try something else!
text: Ndiyaxolisa ukuva lonto, @data.characters.f2_son_15.name. Ndingamcela umalume wakho ukuba ahambe ayothetha nabazali bakhe? Ukuba oko akusebenzi, sizakuzama enye into!
note: The string @data.characters.f2_son_15.name. should not be translated.

SourceText: Yes, thank you, @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name. At least I know you are on my side.
text: Ewe, enkosi, @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name. Noko ndiyayazi usecaleni kwam.
note: The string @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name. should not be translated.

SourceText:
**Remember, you can use the 4 steps to solve problems:**

💭 Step 1: KNOW IT (identify problem)
📋 Step 2: SOLVE IT (identify solutions) 
⚒️ Step 3: TRY IT (try one) 
🎯 Step 4: TEST IT (try another solution if this one did not work)
text:
**Khumbula, ungasebenzisa izigaba eziyi 4 ukusombulula ingxaki**

💭 Inyathelo lokuqala: YAZI (chonga ingxaki)
📋 Inyathelo lesibini: YISOMBULULE (chonga isisombululo) 
⚒️ Inyathelo lesithathu: YIZAME (zama enye) 
🎯 Inyathelo lesine: YIVAVANYE (zama esinye isisombululo ukuba le ayisebenzi)

SourceText:
@data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name and @data.characters.f1_mother.name came up with three ideas together. 
Tap on each one to see if these solutions worked!
text:
U@data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name kunye no@data.characters.f1_mother.name beze nembono ezintathu kunye.
Cofa kwinto nganye ukubona ezizisombululo ukuba ziyasebenza na!

SourceText: Ground @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name for a month
text: Wohlwaye u@data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name kangangenyanga
note: The string @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name should not be translated.

SourceText: Return the phone and save up together to buy a new one
text: Buyisela ifowuni kwaye songe sobabini sizothenga entsha

SourceText: Talk to @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name about safe sex
text: Thetha no@data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name ngokhuseleko kwezesondo
note: The string @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name should not be translated.

SourceText: Look what happened - that didn’t work... Let's try something else.
text: Jonga kwenzeke ntoni - engakhange isebenze... Masizame enye into.

SourceText: You cannot go out for the next month
text: Awuzuphma kulenyanga izayo

SourceText: Uuugh… that’s so unfair, I did not do anything wrong!
text: Uuugh... ayilunganga lonto, Andenzanga nto embi!

SourceText: I am not trying to accuse your friend or be jealous. I am worried that when someone gives a gift it is hard to say 'no' when they ask something in return – like sex. If you want to have a phone, we will save up together so you can make your own decisions without owing him anything.
text: Andizami kutyhola umhlobo wakho okanye ukuba nomona. Ndikhathazwa kukuba xa umntu ekuphe isipho kunzima ukuthi ‘hayi’ xa efuna ukubhatalwa – njengokwabelana ngesondo. Ukuba ufuna ukuba nefowuni, siza konga sobabini ukuze ukwazi ukwenza izigqibo zakho ngaphandle kokumtyala into ethile.

SourceText: That makes sense, thank you, @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name.
text: Iyavakala, enkosi,@data.characters.f1_mother.role_name.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name. should not be translated.

SourceText:
This is a great option! 

Parenting teens is really hard. Often there are no simple and easy solutions, but now @data.characters.f1_mother.name learned she can talk to her daughter about these things.

Before, she worried alone, now they can come up with solutions together!
text:
Yindlela elungileyo!

Ukuba ngumzali ebantwaneni abafikisayo kunzima nyhani. Kusoloko kungekho ndlela ilula necacileyo yokusombulula, kodwa ngoku@data.characters.f1_mother.name ufunde ukuba angathetha nentombi yakhe ngezinto.

Ngaphambi kokuba akhathazeke eyedwa,ngoku banokuza nezisombululo bebobabini!

SourceText:
When something bad happens, we often get upset and blame. But what our teens really need is someone to help find solutions together. 

Listen to them, accept how they see and feel things, and thank them for trusting you.

Teaching your teen how to deal with problems will help them for the rest of their lives. What a gift!
text:
Xa kusenzeka into embi, siye sikhathazeke siphinde sisole. Kodwa okufunwa ngabantwana bethu abafikisayo ngumntu onokubanceda bafumane isisombululo bekunye.

Bamamele, wamnkele indlela ababonangayo nabaziva ngayo izinto, ubabulele ngokuba bekuthemba.

Ukufundisa abantwana bakho abafikisayo ngokuqubisana neengxaki kungabanceda ubomi babo bonke. Eso sipho!

SourceText:
**Here are some examples of problems other parents solved with their teens:**

- My teenager does not want to go to school
- I am worried my teenager will get pregnant or will get someone pregnant
- I am worried about what my teen does online
- My teenager is hanging out with bad friends
- My teenager is lazy
- My teenager is not doing their school work
- My teenager might be using drugs
text:
** Nantsi eminye imizekelo yeengxaki ezisonjululwa ngabanye abazali nabantwana babo abafikisayo:**

- Umntwana wam akafuni kuya esikolweni
- Ndinexhala lokuba umntwana wam angakhulelwa okanye akhulelise umntu
- Ndixhalabile ngezinto ezenziwa ngumntwana wam ofikisayo kwi-intanethi
- Umntwana wam ofikisayo uhlala nabahlobo abangalunganga
- Umntwana wam ofikisayo uyonqena
- Umntwana wam ofikisayo akawenzi umsebenzi wakhe wesikolo
-Umntwana wam ofikisayo kusenokwenzeka usebenzisa iziyobisi

SourceText: Your home activity this week is to teach your teenagers the steps for problem-solving and use them together when a problem comes up.
text: Umsebenzi wakho wasekhaya kuleveki kukufundisa umntwana wakho ofikisayo ngendlela zokusombulula ingxaki aphinde azisebenzise zonke xa ingxaki zifika.

SourceText:
**Remember to use the four steps of problem-solving:** 
💭 Step 1: KNOW IT (identify problem)
📋 Step 2: SOLVE IT (identify solutions) 
⚒️ Step 3: TRY IT (try one) 
🎯 Step 4: TEST IT (try another solution if this one did not work)
text:
**Khumbula ukusebenzisa amanyathelo amane ukusombulula ingxaki:**

💭 inyathelo 1: YAZI (chonga ingxaki)
📋 Inyathelo 2: YISOMBULULE (chonga isisombululo) 
⚒️ Inyathelo 3: YIZAME (zama enye) 
🎯 Inyathelo 4: YIVAVANYE (zama esinye isisombululo ukuba le ayisebenzi)

SourceText:
We all have problems, but they don’t define us! You can choose to address challenges and try different solutions together with your teen. 
This shows your teen that they are never alone and gives them a key skill to use at home, with friends, and for life!

SourceText:
When my father introduced the problem-solving steps to me, it helped me with my family, but it also helped me with my friends.

I told my friends about the steps, and now when we are arguing we sit down and everyone comes up with solutions. We then look for the negatives and positives of each solution, and we agree “okay let’s try this one.”

My friends even took it to their own homes, and it is helping with their families as well!

It is great when others listen to you and accept your ideas even though you are young. We can all bring that harmony with our friends and family.
text:
Xa utata wam wayendixelela ngamabakala okusombulula ingxaki, yandinceda nosapho lwam, kodwa indincedile nakwizihlobo zam.

Ndizixelele izihlobo zam ngalamanyathelo, ngoku sihlala phantsi xa siphikisana wonke umntu aze nezisombululo. Sijonge okuhle nokubi kwisisombululo ngasinye, sivumelane " kulungile masizame esi"

Izihlobo zam zizithathele nasemakhayeni azo, nasemakhayeni abo iye yancedisa!

 Kuhle xa abanye bekumamela bazamnkele izimvo zakho nokuba umncinci. Singayenza imvisiswano nezihlobo kunye nentsapho zethu.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about rules.

Rules help teens understand what is expected of them.

Teens are more likely to follow rules if you create the rules WITH your teen and praise them for it!
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje simalunga nemigaqo.

Imigaqo inceda abantwana abafikisayo baqonde oko kulindelekileyo kubo. 

Abantwana abafikisayo bavamisa ngakumbi ekulandeleni imigaqo xa imigaqo niyenza KUNYE nomntwana wakho ofikisayo uze umncome ngalonto!

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is rules.

Rules promote peace within the household and promote understanding amongst family members.

Rules promote responsibilities for each family member; therefore, it is important to have family rules.

A household with family rules lives in peace.
text:
Molweni, kuni nonke. 

Umxholo wanamhlanje yimigaqo. 

Imigaqo ikhuthaza uxolo ekhayeni ize ikhuthaze ukuqondana phakathi kwamalungu entsapho. 

Imigaqo ikhuthaza iimbopheleleko kwilungu ngalinye lentsapho, ngenxa yoko, kubalulekile ukuba nemigaqo yentsapho. 

Ikhaya elinemigaqo yosapho liphila ngoxolo.

SourceText: When we make rules together, it shows our teens that rules are there to keep everyone safe and respected - not just to control them. Setting rules as a family helps build trust and responsibility for both teens and parents.

SourceText:
My teenagers always just disappeared. I did not know where they were and I would get so worried and angry with them. I used to say, “This is my house, and these are my rules, if you do not want to follow them you can leave and stay in your own place.”

When we learnt in @global.app_name about rules, I learnt that there are rules for teens and for adults and for everyone. If we follow the rules as parents, our teens will follow our example.

I explained my worry and we all agreed: We all follow the rule and say where we are going when we leave the house. Coming up with rules together helped us a lot, as my teens do not see me anymore as that annoying parent that just makes up unnecessary rules.
text:
Abantwana bam abafikisayo basoloko benyamalala. Ndiye ndingabazi apho bakhoyo kwaye ndiyakhathazeka kakhulu kwaye ndibanomsindo kubo. Bendiqhqhele ukuthi, Yindlu yam lena, kwaye imigaqo yeyam, ukuba awufuni ukuyilandela ungahamba uyokuzihlalela kweyakho indawo.Xa besifunde ku@global.app_name malunga nemigaqo, Ndifunde intoyokuba kunemigaqo yabantwana abafikisayo kunye nabantu abadala kunye naye wonke umntu. Ukuba silandela imigaqo singabazali, Abantwana bethu abafikisayo bazakulandela umzekelo wethu.

Ndikucacisile ukuxhalaba kwam kwaye sonke sivumelene: Sonke silandela umgaqo kwaye sitsho ukuba siyaphi xasimka endlini.Ukuza nemigaqo sisonke kuncede kakhulu, njengabantwana bam abafikisayo sanukundibona njengomzali odikayo kwakhona owenza nje imigaqo engenamsebenzi.

Let’s look together online at how we can keep this fun for you but also safe.

**Remember to use your skills for rule setting:**

⚽ Team rules: When making the rule, work together like a team.
