SourceText: Yes
text: Ewe

SourceText: Fantastic! Setting a rule together helps your teen feel involved and respected. It is a big step toward building trust and cooperation.
text: Kwakuhle! Ukumisela umgaqo kunye kumnceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo azive ebandakanyekile kwaye ehloniphekile. Lelona nyathelo elikhulu ekwakheni ukuthembana nokusebenzisana.

SourceText: I think so
text: Ndicinga njalo

SourceText: You can do it! Even beginning the conversation shows your teen that their voice matters. Take it one step at a time.
text: Ungayenza! Kwaye nokuqala incoko ibonisa umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba ilizwi lakhe libalulekile. Thatha inyathelo libelinye ngexesha.

SourceText: No
text: Hayi

SourceText: That's okay. It can take time to agree on new rules. You could start by asking your teen what they think is important - small talks can lead to big changes.
text: Kulungile. Ingathatha ixesha ukuvumelana ngemigaqo emitsha. Ungaqala ngokubuza umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba ucinga yintoni ebalulekileyo - intetho ezincinci zingakhokhelela kutshintsho olukhulu.

SourceText: Clear, simple rules made together with your teen are not about control - they are about keeping them safe and building responsibility. When teens understand the reasons behind the rules, they are more likely to follow them.
text: Imigaqo ecacileyo nelula eniyenye kunye nomntwna wakho ofiisayo ayikho ngokulawula - Ingokubagcina bekhuselekile kunye nokwakha uxanduva. Xa abantwana abafikisayo beziqonda izizathu ezingaphaya kwemigaqo, bangakwazi ukuyilandela kakuhle.

SourceText: Can teens value rules too? Hear @data.characters.media_daughter_5.name's story
text: Ingaba abantwana abafikisayo bangayixabisa imigaqo nabo? Mamela ibali lika @data.characters.media_daughter_5.name
note: The string @data.characters.media_daughter_5.name's should not be translated.

SourceText:
I never liked rules and I used to forget rules a lot.

One day, I was playing with my friends. The rule at home was that we should be in the yard by 6pm, but I forgot again. By 6:30 it was getting dark and I was still outside and playing with my phone. Then a boy came, grabbed my phone and ran away.

I understood that rules can really help to keep us safe, so I changed my behaviour and I was in the yard by 5pm from then.
text:
Zange ndayithanda imigaqo kwaye bendihlala ndiyilibala imigaqo kakhulu.

Ngenye imini, ndandidlala nabahlobo bam. Umgaqo ekhaya yayikuba kufanele sibengaphakathi ekhayeni ngo6pm, kodwa ndalibala kwakhona. Malunga no 6:30 pm bekusiya kubamnyama kwaye bendisephandle ndidlala ngefowuni yam. Kuye kwathi gqi inkwenkwe, yaxutha ifowuni yam yabaleka nayo.

Ndiyayiqonda ukuba imigaqo ingasi nceda ngokwenene ukusigcina sikhuselekile, ndiye ndatshintsha indlela yokuziphatha kwaye bendisekhayeni malunga no5 ukusukela ngoko.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about teen safety.

Teens can spend a lot of time outside the house or online, where it is harder for us to keep them safe.

Talking together about safe and unsafe places, and how to prevent problems, really helps!
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje singokhuseleko lwabantwana abafikisayo.

Abantwana abafikisayo bangachitha ixesha elininzi bengekho sendlini okanye be on-line, apho kunzima ukuba sibagcine bekhuselekile. 

Ukuthetha kunye ngeendawo ezikhuselekileyo nezingakhuselekanga, nendlela yokuthintela iingxaki, kunceda ngokwenene!

SourceText: Why is teen safety important for you and your family?
text: Kutheni ukhuseleko lwabantwana bakho abafikisayo lubalulekile kuwe nosapho lwakho?

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today our topic is teen safety.

It is our responsibility as parents to keep our teens safe at all times. We need to ensure that our teenagers are safe in the communities that we live in. It is our responsibility that we make them aware of the safe and unsafe areas in the communities.

It is also our responsibility to ensure that they understand the dangers that they might be exposed to when they are online. That way our teenagers will be responsible and be able to make right decisions to keep themselves safe too.
text:
Molweni, kuni nonke. 

Namhlanje umxholo wethu umalunga nokhuseleko lwabantwana abafikisayo. 

Kulixanduva lethu njengabazali ukugcina abantwana bethu abafikisayo bekhuselekile ngamaxesha onke. Kufuneka siqinisekise ukuba abantwana bethu abafikisayo bakhuselekile kwiindawo esihlala kuzo. Kuluxanduva lwethu ukubenza bazi ngeendawo ezikhuselekileyo nezingakhuselekanga. 

Ikwaluxanduva lwethu ukuqinisekisa ukuba bayaziqonda iingozi abaziveza kuzo xa bekwi-intanethi. Ngalo ndlela abantwana bethu abafikisayo baya kukwazi uthatha uxanduva kwaye ibenze lonto bakwazi ukwenza izigqibo ezizizo ukuze bazigcine bekhuselekile nabo.

SourceText: Sometimes our teens know things about their environment that we might not realise - and by talking, we can learn how to support them better.
text: Ngamanye amaxesha abantwana bethu abafikisayo bazi izinto ngokubangqongileyo esingenakuziqonda thina - kwaye ngokuthetha, singafunda ukubaxhasa ngcono.

SourceText: A safety plan helped @data.characters.media_female_8.name protect her teen. Tap play to hear more
text: Isicwangciso sokhuseleko sisebenzile ku@data.characters.media_female_8.name ukukhusela umntwana wakhe ofikisayo. Cofa udlala umamele nangakumbi
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_8.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
I was so grateful to make the safety plan with my teen. I thought I knew which areas are safe for my teen and which are not. But when we made the safety plan together, I realised that my girl knew more areas that I was not aware of.

I also thought she was safe at school, but through this activity I realised she was being bullied and the teachers did not do anything about it.

The more we talked, the more I understood and got information from my teen. That really helped me to protect my teen and keep her safe.
text:
Ndibe nombulelo omkhulu ukwenza isicwangciso sokhuseleko nomntwana wam ofikisayo. Bendicinga ndiyazazi indawo ezikhuselekileyo zomntwana wam ofikisayo nezo zingezizo. Kodwa xa besisenza izicwangciso zokhuseleko kunye, ndiye ndaqonda ukuba intombi yam yazi indawo ezininzi kunoba ndisazi.

Bendisoloko ndicinga ukuba ukhuselekile esikolweni, kodwa ngalomsebenzi ndiye ndaqonda ukuba uyaxhatshazwa kwaye abafundisi ntsapho abenzinto ngalonto.

Ngokuya sithetha, ngokuya ndiqonda kwaye ndafumana inkcukacha kubantwana bam abafikisayo. Ngokwenene lonto indincedile ukukhusela umntwana wam ofikisayo kwaye ndimgcine ekhuselekile.

SourceText:
The most important way to help keep your teen safe is to make sure that they know they can talk to you about anything. 

You can also come up with a Safety Word - a simple word your teen can use to let you know they have a problem, without fear of you getting angry. 

Let's see how this worked for @data.characters.f1_mother.name and her daughter @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name:
text:
Eyona ndlela ibalulekileyo ukugcina umntwana wakho ofikisayo ekhuselekile kukuqinisekisa ukuba bayayazi bangatheha nantonina nawe.

Ungeza negama Elikhuselekileyo - igama elilula umntwana wakho ofikisayo anolisebenzisa ukwazisa ukuba unengxaki, ngaphandle kokoyikisela ukuba ube nomsindo.

Masibone ukuba ibasebenzele njani @data.characters.f1_mother.name nentombi yakhe @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name:

SourceText: Something happened when I was out with my friends @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name and @data.characters.friend_female_1.name!
text: Kukho into eyenzekileyo ngoku bendiphume kunye nezihlobo zam u @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name no @data.characters.friend_female_1.name!

SourceText: Tell me, @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name.
text: Ndixelele, @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name. should not be translated.

SourceText: Hey beautiful. I have been looking at you for a while. You are very beautiful, what is your name?
text: Molo nobuhle. Kudala ndikujongile. Umhle kakhulu, ungubani igama lakho?

SourceText: Her name is @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name.
text: Igama lakhe ngu @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name. should not be translated.

SourceText: @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name, would you like to come with me to have something to drink and chips? Come on, get in, you will be back in time, I promise…
text: @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name**: ungathanda ukuhamba nam sifumane into eselwayo kunye neetships? Yiza, ngena, uya kubuya kwangexesha, ndiyathembisa…
note: The string @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name, should not be translated.

SourceText: I am not sure if that is a good idea…
text: Andiqinisekanga ukuba ngumbono olungileyo lowo…

SourceText: You are lucky, my friend. I wish a man would ask ME out and buy me gifts. I am telling you, if you do not do this I’m going to tell everyone you are stupid!
text: Unethamsanqa, mhlobam. Akwaba indoda ibingacela ukukhupha MNA ize indithengele izipho. Ndiyakuxelela, ukuba awuyenzi lento ndizakuxelela wonke umntu ukuba usisibhanxa!

SourceText: @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name do not go! Be careful! Let’s go home. It is dangerous to go with people you do not know. Besides, he is too old for you and what he is doing is wrong.
text: @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name: sukuya! Lumka! Masigoduke. Kuyingozi ukuhamba nabantu ongabaziyo. Ngapha koko, mdala gqithi kunawe yaye ayilunganga le nto ayenzayo.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name should not be translated.

SourceText: I just do not know…
text: Andazi nje…

SourceText:
Pfff, I am so proud of you for not getting into the car. That was a dangerous situation, thank you for telling me!

You can always call me or talk to me when something like this happens. We can even use a Safety Word, so I know something is wrong - and I promise I will not be angry.
text:
Pfff, Ndiyazingca ngawe ngokungangeni omotweni. Ibiyimeko enobungozi, enkosi ngokundixelela!

Ungasoloko unditsalela umnxeba okanye uthethe nam xa into enje isenzeka. Singasebenzisa negama elikhuselekileyo, ukuze ndazi kukho into engalunganga - kwaye ndiyathembisa andizoba namsindo.

SourceText: Thank you, @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name! Our Safety Word could be ‘blue house’. I could call and say something like ‘I forgot my book at the blue house’ and you would know to come help me.
text: Enkosi, @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name! Igama lethu elikhuselekileyo linga 'yindlu eluhlaza'. Ndingakutsalela umnxeba ndithethe into enjengo ' ndilibele incwadi yam kwindlu eluhlaza' uyawukwazi ukuba mawuze uzokundinceda.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name! should not be translated.

SourceText: Let's think about what happened to @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name.
text: Masicinge ngokwenzekileyo ku @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name.

SourceText: What was risky about that situation?
text: Yintoni ebiyingozi ngala meko?

SourceText: Going with an older man puts @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name in a dangerous situation where she can get hurt or be forced to do things
text: Ukuhamba nendoda endala kubeka u @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name kwimeko eyingozi apho anokwenzakala okanye anyanzelwe ukuba enze izinto

SourceText: Many girls in our communities get pregnant or catch HIV from older men
text: Amantombazana amaninzi kwindawo esihlala kuyo ayakhulelwa okanye afumane i-HIV kumadoda amadala

SourceText: There were no other trusted adults to advise @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name
text: Bebengekho abanye abantu abadala abathembakeleyo abonokucebisa @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name
note: The string @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
All those things are true! 

@data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name could have gotten into a dangerous situation if she had gotten into the car.
text:
Zonke ezozinto ziyinyani!

@data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name ebenokuzifaka kwimeko enobungozi ukuba ebengenile emotweni.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name should not be translated.

SourceText: Let's look at another example of a dangerous situation together.
text: Makhe sijonge omnye umzekelo wemeko eyingozi sikunye.

SourceText: My friend has been talking with a guy our age online... She is going to send him photos of herself. Is that better because he is our age?
text: Umhlobo wam ebesoloko ethetha nomfana oyintanga yethu online... Uza kumthumelela imifanekiso yakhe. Ingaba lonto ingcono kuba elingana nathi?

SourceText:
You are a good friend for being worried about her. Sending sexy photos is a real risk too.

Sometimes people are not who they say they are online – he could say he is your age but be a 50-year-old man. Or when they break up, he could send those photos to everyone and your friend would feel awful.
text:
Ungumhlobo olungileyo ngokuba ubexhala ngaye. Ukuthumela imifanekiso enomtsalane yingozi yokwenene nayo.

Ngamanye amxesha abantu abayiyo lento bathi bayiyo online- angathi uyintanga yakho kodwa abe eyindoda eneminyaka eyi50. Okanye xa besohlukana, angayithumela lomifanekiso kumntu wonke kwaye umhlobo wakho azive kakubi.

SourceText: Things like that can happen to any teen, so  let's think about our teens' online safety.
text: Izinto ezinjalo zingenzeka nakomphi umntana ofikisayo, ngoku makhe sicinge ngokhuseleko labantwana bethu abafikisayo online.

SourceText: What do you think is the biggest online risk for teens these days?
text: Ucinga ukuba yeyiphi ingozi enkulu online kubantwana bethu abafikisayo kulemihla?

SourceText: Adults use social media, gaming and messaging apps and websites to meet teenagers and pressure them to do sexual things
text: Abantu abadala basebenzisa amakhasi onxibelelwano, imidlalo kunye nee apps zemiyalezo kunye neewebhusayithi ukudibana nabantwana abasafikisayo kwaye babafake uxinzelelo ukuba benze izinto zesondo

SourceText: Yes, this is a serious risk. Some adults may act friendly online but try to trick or pressure teens. Talking openly can help keep your teen safe.
text: Ewe, iyingozi enzulu. Abanye abantu abadala bangazenza izihlobo online kodwa bazame ukuqhatha okanye bafake uxinzelelo kubantwana abafikisayo. Ukuthetha ngokuphandle kunganceda ukugcina umntwana wakho ofikisayo ekhuselekile.

SourceText: People post things online to make us hurt other people - like making violence seem cool or spreading hate towards certain races or countries
text: Abantu baxhoma izinto online ukusenza sonzakalise abanye abantu – njengokwenza ubundlobongela bubonakale buyinto entle, okanye ukucaphukela abantu belinye ilizwe okanye uhlanga

SourceText: Yes, this is a real concern. Some people spread hate or make violence seem normal. Helping your teen think about what they see online can protect them.
text: Ewe, iyiknxalabo yokwenene. Abanye abantu basasaza intiyo okanye ubundlobongela bubonakale buyinto eqhelekileyo! Ukubanceda abantwana bakho abafikisayo bacinge ngezinto abazibona online zingabenza bakhuseleke.

SourceText: People put things online to convince teenagers to hurt themselves or take their own lives
text: Abantu babeka izinto online ukuqinisekisa abantwana abafikisayo ukuba bazonzakalise okanye bazibulale

SourceText: Yes, sadly this does happen. Some online spaces can make teens feel hopeless or alone. Checking in often can help keep your teen safe.
text: Ewe, Ngelishwa oku kuyenzeka. Ezinye izithuba za online zenza ukuba abantwanna abafikisayo bazive bengenathemba okanye benomva ndedwa. Ukubajonga rhoqo kunganceda abantwana bakho abafikisayo bekhuselekile.

SourceText: Teenagers share sexy photos, videos or information about themselves, and others use it to embarrass or threaten them
text: Abantwana abafikisayo babelana ngemifanekiso enomtsalane, ividiyo okanye ulwazi malunga nabo, kwaye abanye bazisebenzisa ukubenza babenentloni okanye boyikise abanye

SourceText: Yes, this is a real danger. Once something is shared, it can be spread or used to hurt them. Teaching your teen to pause and think before sharing can make a big difference.
text: Ewe, lento inobungozi obukhulu, Xa kwabelwana ngayo, ingasasazwa okanye isetyenziswe ekubonzakalisa. Ukufundisa umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukunqumama kwaye acinge phambi kokwabelana kungenza umehluko omkhulu.

SourceText: People can often be nasty to teenagers online - they feel like they can bully people safely
text: Abantu baba babi kubantwana abafikisayo kwi online-baziva ngathi bangaxhaphaza abantu ngokukhuselekileyo

SourceText: Yes, online bullying happens a lot because people feel braver behind a screen. Talking about kindness and bullying can help your teen feel supported and know what to do.
text: Ewe, ukuxhatshazwa online kwenzeka kakhulu kuba abantu baziva benesibindi emva kwesikrini. Ukuthetha ngobubele nokuxhatshazwa kunomnceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo azive exhasiwe kwaye ekwazi amakakwenze.

SourceText:
To keep our teens safe, we need to understand the dangerous situations they could get into! 

Let’s get practical now, and draw two maps of safe and unsafe places:
- 🗺️ A map of our community
- 🌐 A map of apps/websites we use online
text:
Ukugcina abantwana bethu abafikisayo bekhuselekile, kufuneka siqonde imeko eyingozi abanokungena kuyo!

Makhe senze kunye iimephu zeendawo ezikhuselekileyo neziyingozi:
- 🗺️ Imephu yendawo esihlala kuyo
- 🌐 Imephu yee-app/iiwebhsayithi esizisebenzisayo online

SourceText: Can you make these maps together with your family now?
text: Ungakwazi ukwenza ezi mephu kunye nosapho lwakho ngoku?

SourceText: Yes, my family can join in now
text: Ewe, usapho lwam lungazibandakanya ngoku

SourceText: Let me try it out by myself
text: Makhe ndiyizame ngoku ngokwam

SourceText:
Great! You will need a:

- 📄 Piece of paper (or old newspaper or a cardboard box) 
- 🖊️ Pen
text:
Kulungile! Uya kufuna i:

- 📄 Phetshana elincinci (okanye iphephandaba elidala okanye ibhokisi yekhalibhodi) 
- 🖊️ Usiba

SourceText: Step 1: Draw all the important places in your community.
text: Inyathelo lokuqala: Zoba zonke indawo ezibalulekileyo kwindawo ohlala kuyo.

SourceText: Draw a map of your teen’s community, with pictures of all the main places like streets, your house, school, shops, places your teen visits.
text: Zoba imephu yabantawana abafikisayo ekuhlaleni, nemifanekiso yazo zonke indawo eziphambili zestrato, njenge ndlu yakho, isikolo, ivenkile, indawo abantwana abafikisayo abazihambelayo.

SourceText: Step 2: Choose which places are safe and unsafe.
text: Inyathelo 2: Khetha indawo ezikhuselekileyo nezikngakhuselekanga.

SourceText:
- Which areas on your map are safe for teenagers? CIRCLE these
- Which areas on your map are unsafe for teenagers? CROSS those off
- What makes a place safe or unsafe?
- What could you and your teen do to keep your teen safer?
text:
- Zeziphi indawo kwi mephu ezikhuselekileyo kubantwana abafikisayo? Yenza IZANGQA kwezi
-Zeziphi indawo kwi mephu yakho ezingakhuselekileyo kubantwana abafikisayo? Yenza UMKRWELO kwezo 
-Yintoni eyenza indawo ikhuseleke okanye ingakhuseleki?
-Yinton onokuyenza nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ukugcina umntwana wakho ofikisayo ekhuselekile?

SourceText: Step 3: Identify where you can get support.
text: Inyathelo 3: Chonga apho ungafumana inkxaso.

SourceText:
Sometimes, we can find ourselves in trouble.

- Where can you and your teen get support when you face a crisis? MARK those areas with a little object like a stone or piece of paper.
text:
Maxa wambi, singazifumana sisengxakini.

-Wena nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ningayifumana phi inkxaso xa nijamelene nengxaki? 
 - PHAWULA ezo ndawo ngento encinci njengelitye okanye intwana yephepha.

SourceText: Step 4: Now recognise the risky places online and how you can make them safer.
text: Inyathelo 4: Ngoku qaphela indawo ezinobungozi online kwaye ungabenza njani bakhuseleke.

SourceText:
- Draw pictures of the apps and websites your teenagers use
- Recognise how good they are at using the web!
- Think about which ones might be unsafe. Why?
- What could you and your teen do to make using the internet safer for your teen and their friends?
text:
-Zoba imifanekiso yee apps kunye newebsites abantwana abafikisayo abazisebenzisayo
-Qaphela indlela abazisebenzisa ngayo iweb!
-Cinga ngokuba zeziphi ezingakhuselekanga. Njani?
-Yintoni ongayenza wena nomntwana wakho nisebenzisa internet ikhuseleke kumntwana wakho nezihlobo zakhe?

SourceText: Here are some skills to help you keep your teen safe!
text: Nazi ezinye izakhono ezingakunceda ukugcina umntwana wakho ofikisayo ekhuselekile!

SourceText: MAPS
text: IIMEPHU

SourceText: Make maps with your teen of safe and unsafe areas in your community and online. Talk about how to keep their information, photos and videos private online. Talk about how once something goes online, it stays there forever. They might know an example from their friends.
text: Yenza imephu kunye nomntwana ofikisayo yendawo ezikhuselekileyo nezingakhueslekanga kwindawo yakho na online. Thetha ngokuba bangalugcina njani ulwazi, imifanekiso neevidiyo zabucala online. Thetha malunga nokuba xa into ingenile online ihlala njani khona ngonaphakade. Basenokuwazi umzekelo kubahlobo babo.

SourceText: RULES
text: IMIGAQO

SourceText: Make rules with your teen about how they can stay safe in your community (especially in risky areas that cannot be avoided), and how they can safely use the apps and websites that they like.
text: Yenza imiqaqo nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ngendlela abanohlala ngayo bekhuselekile ekuhlaleni(ingakumbi kwindawo ezingakhuselekanga ongenakuzibaleka), nendlela ekhuselekileyo abangayisebenzisa ekusebenziseni i apps ne webhusayithi abazithandayo.

SourceText: Remember how @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name and her mother, @data.characters.f1_mother.name, made a rule together to help @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name have fun and stay safe online? It worked well because they made clear rules together in a calm and positive way!
text: Khumbula ukuba u @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name kunye nomama wakhe, @data.characters.f1_mother.name benze umgaqo onokubanceda @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name bonwabe kwaye bahlale bekhuselekile kumakhasi online? @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name Isebenze kakuhle kuba benze imigaqo ecacileyo kunye ngendlela ezolileyo nelungileyo!

SourceText: SAFETY WORD
text: IGAMA ELIKHUSELEKILEYO

SourceText: Agree on a Safety Word. If something happens that makes your teen upset, uncomfortable or scared, they can say the Safety Word and you will help them without getting angry or punishing them, even if they were doing something wrong.
text: Vumelanani Ngegama Elikhuselekileyo. Ukuba kungenzeka into ekhathaza umntwana wakho ofikisayo, angakhululeki okanye oyike, bangasebenzisa Igama Elikhuselekileyo kwaye ungabanceda ngaphandle kokuba ube nomsindo okanye ubohlwaye, nokuba bebesenza into engalunganga.

SourceText: More tips
text: Iingcebiso ezingakumbi

SourceText:
What Safety Word can you choose with your teen? Here are some ideas from other families:

🥑 A specific food
👵🏽 A specific family member
🐒 A specific animal
🤔 Something else
text:
Leliphi igama elikhuselekileyo onolikhetha kunye nomntana wakho ofikisayo? Nantsi eminye imibono esuka kwezinye intsapho.

🥑 Ukutya okuthile
👵🏽Ilungu losapho oluthile 
🐒 Isilwanyana esithile
🤔Into engenye

SourceText:
If you have not done it together yet, this week's home assignment is to make two maps with your teen of safe and unsafe places:

1) 🗺️ Map of your community
2) 🌐 Map of apps and websites your teen uses

Make sure you are both happy with the safety plan. What really matters is that you talk with your teen as you do this – often teens know much more than we do about where it is safe and unsafe!
text:
Ukuba anikasenzi kunye okwangoku, isabelo saleveki sasekhaya kukwenza imephu ezimbini kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ngendawo ezikhuselekileyo nezingakhuselekanga.
1) 🗺️ Imephu yendawo ohlala kuyo
2) 🌐 Imephu yee-app neewebhsayithi ezisetyenziswa ngumntwana wakho ofikisayo 

Qinisekisa ukuba nobabini nonwabile ngesicwangciso sokhuseleko. 

Eyona nto ibalulekileyo ngokwenene kukuba uthethe nomntwana wakho ofikisayo njengoko usenza lento – abantwana abafikisayo basoloko besazi kakhulu ngendawo ekhuselekileyo nengakhuselekanga!

SourceText: Can you make a safety map with your teen and talk about ways to stay safe online and in your community?
text: Ungenza imephu ekhuselekileyo nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kwaye nithethe ngeendlela zokuhlala nikhuselekile online nasekuhlaleni?

SourceText: Yes
text: Ewe

SourceText: That's great! Taking the time to map out safe and unsafe places together helps your teen feel more confident and supported.
text: Kulungile! Ukuthatha ixesha nisenza imephu zendawo ezikhuselekileyo nezingakhuselekanga kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kwenza azive ezithembile ngakumbi kwaye exhasekile.

SourceText: I think so
text: Ndicinga njalo

SourceText: You can do it! Even starting the conversation is a big step towards helping your teen stay safe.
text: Ungayenza! Nokuqala incoko linyathelo elikhulu ukunceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo ahlale ekhuselekile.

SourceText: No
text: Hayi

SourceText: That's okay. It can feel hard at first, but small talks about safety make a big difference. Try again when you feel ready.
text: Kulungile. Bekunzima ekuqaleni, kodwa lancoko incinci yenza umehluko. Zama kwakhona xa uziva ulungile.

SourceText: When teens know they can turn to us without fear, they are more likely to ask for help when something feels unsafe - both offline and online. Talking calmly and making safety plans together builds trust that lasts.
text: Xa abantwana abafikisayo besazi bangeza kuthi ngaphandle koloyiko, badla ngokucela uncedo xa besiva into engathi ayikhuselekanga-noba ku offline na online. Ukuthetha ngomoya ozolileyo nokwenza izicwangciso ezikhuselekileyo kunye kwakha ukuthembana okungapheliyo.

SourceText: Safety planning helped @data.characters.media_daughter_7.name open up. Hear her story
text: Ukucwangisa okukhuselekileyo kuncede u @data.characters.media_daughter_7.name ukuba akhululeke. Yiva ibali lakhe
note: The string @data.characters.media_daughter_7.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
When my friends or I got into trouble, I would always try to hide it from my mother because she would get so angry and shout at me.

When we made the map of safe and unsafe places, I learnt a lot – also why it is dangerous to share every picture online. My mother told me I can always ask her if there is a problem and she promised she would not get mad.

She kept her promise, so now if I have a problem or I do not feel safe I know we can always come up with a solution together. I can even talk to my mother about the things I do online now!
text:
Xa abahlobo bam okanye ndisengxakini, ndihlala ndiyifihla kumama wam kuba ingamcaphukisa andingxolise. Xa sisenza imephu ngendawo ezikhuselekileyo nezingakhuselekenga, ndifunde likhulu - kwakhona kutheni kunobungozi ukwabelana ngemifanekiso online. Umama usoloko endixelele ukuba ndingahlala ndimbuza xa kukho ingxaki kwaye undithembisile akazophambana.

Wasigcina isithembiso, ngoku xa ndinengxaki okanye andiziva ndikhuselekile ndiyayazi singeza nesisombululo kunye, Ndiyakwazi ukuthetha nomama wam wam ngezinto endizenza online!

SourceText:
Today's topic is about taking care of yourself.

We often don’t look after ourselves enough. But this is so important, especially as a parent!

Reducing our stress and treating ourselves well helps us AND our teenagers.
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje simalunga nokhathalela isiqu sakho.

Asisoloko sizijonga ngokwaneleyo iziqu zethu. Kodwa oku kubaluleke kakhulu, ingakumbi xa ungumzali! 

Ukunciphisa uxinzelelo lwethu nokuzikhathalela kungasinceda thina KUNYE nabantwana bethu abafikisayo.

SourceText: How will caring for yourself help you and your family? Listen to find out
text: Ukukhathalela isiqu sakho kungakunceda njani wena nosapho lwakho? Mamela ukuze wazi

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is self-care.

There are times when we experience challenges, face problems and do not know what to do. It is important to take care of ourselves to learn the techniques for keeping ourselves calm, in case problems, challenges or issues come up.

When we are calm we are in a good state to think positively and come up with positive solutions to any challenges we may be facing.
text:
Ndiyabulisa, nonke

Isihloko sanamhlanje kukuzikhathalela.

Akhona amaxesha apho siqubisana nemiceli mngeni, sijongene nengxaki kwaye singazi ukuba senze ntoni. Kubalulekile ukuba sikhathalele iziqu zethu kwaye sifunde ubuchule bokugcina umoya wethu uzolile, xa kunothi kuvele ingxaki, imiceli mngeni okanye imiba enokuthi ivele.

Xa sinomoya ozolileyo sikwisimo sokucinga kakuhle kwaye singeza neziphumo ezihle kuyo yonke imiceli mngeni esinokuthi sijongane nayo.

SourceText:
Why self-care?

We often don’t look after ourselves enough. But this is so important, especially as a parent!

Reducing our stress and treating ourselves well helps us AND our teenagers.
text:
Kutheni sizikhathalela?

Asisoloko sizikhathalela ngokwaneleyo iziqu zethu. Kodwa oku kubalulekile kakhulu, ingakumbi xa ungumzali!

Ukunciphisa uxinzelelo lwethu nokuzikhathalela kungasinceda thina KUNYE nabantwana bethu abafikisayo.

SourceText: Self care works! Hear @data.characters.media_male_1.name’s story
text: Ukuzikhathalela kuyasebenza! Yiva @data.characters.media_male_1.name ibali
note: The string @data.characters.media_male_1.name’s should not be translated.

SourceText:
For me as a parent, it was almost impossible to find time for myself. I was always busy taking care of everyone else. Through @global.app_name, I realised how important it is to take care of myself. It helps me AND my family!

Having a moment for myself helps me to breathe and notice how I feel. Even 5 minutes to have a cup of tea makes a big difference. Now I can deal with my stress better.
text:
Mna njengomzali, ndaphantse andalifumana ixesha lesiqu sam. Bendihlala ndixakekile ndikhathalela wonke umntu. Nge @global.app_name, Ndiye ndaqonda kubaluleke kanjani ukukhathalela isiqu sam. Indincedile mna KUNYE no sapho lwam!

Ukufumana umzuzwana nesiqu sam kundincedile ndaphefumla kwaye ndaqaphela uhlobo endiziva ngalo. Nokufumana nje nemizuzu emi5 ufumane ikomityi ye-ti ingawenza umehluko omkhulu. Ngoku ndingakwazi ukumelana noxinzelelo ngcono.
note: The string @global.app_name, should not be translated.

SourceText:
Appreciating ourselves is one way to care for ourselves. 

Let’s give it a try.
text:
Ukubulela iziqu zethu yindlela enye yokukhathela iziqu zethu. 

Makhe siyizameni.

SourceText:
Think of one thing YOU have done well recently.

"Well done to me for..."
text:
Cinga ngento ibenye WENA ubukhe wayenza kakuhle kutshanje.

''Ndiqhube kakuhle ngokwenza...''...

SourceText: Showing love to my children
text: Bonisa uthando ebantwaneni bam

SourceText: Getting up even though I felt tired
text: Ukuvuka nangona ndiziva ndidiniwe

SourceText: Smiling at someone
text: Ukuncumela umntu

SourceText: Making food to stay strong
text: Ukwenza ukutya okundigcina ndomelele

SourceText: Spending time with my children
text: Ukuchitha ixesha nabantwana bam

SourceText: Helping my children with schoolwork
text: Ukuncedisa abantwana bam kumsebenzi wesikolo

SourceText:
Say it aloud if you can.

Here is one thing you deserve praise for: Well done for using @global.app_name!
text:
Yitsho ngokuvakalayo ukuba unako.

Nantsi into enye ofanelwe kukunconywa ngayo: Uqhube kakuhle ngokusebenzisa i-@global.app_name!
note: The string @global.app_name! should not be translated.

SourceText:
Treating ourselves well is another way of looking after ourselves.

You can give yourself a small reward every day, and it does not have to cost a thing!
text:
Ukuziphatha kakuhle iziqu zethu yenye yendlela yokujongana neziqu zethu.

Ungasinika isiqu sakho imbuyekezo encinci mihla yonke, kwaye akunyanzelekanga ibe lixabiso lanto!

SourceText: What small thing makes you happy?
text: Yintoni encinci ekwenza wonwabe?

SourceText: Sleeping
text: Ulele

SourceText: Talking with a friend
text: Ukuthetha nomhlobo

SourceText: Reading something I enjoy
text: Ndifunde into endiyonwabelayo

SourceText: Going for a walk
text: Uhambahambe

SourceText: Having a nice cup of coffee, tea or hot chocolate
text: Ufumane ikomityi ye kofu, iti okanye itshokolethi eshushu

SourceText: Nice! Taking care of yourself is an important parenting skill!
text: Kuhle! Ukuzinyamekela sisakhono esibalulekileyo sokuba ngumzali!

SourceText: Here are some tips to help you take care of yourself.
text: Nazi ezinye ingcebiso ezinokunceda wena ukhathalele isiqu sakho.

SourceText: RELAX
text: PHOLA

SourceText: Do a 30 second quick relaxation activity.
text: Yenza umsebenzi oza kukupholisa okhawulezileyo wemizuzu engama-30.

SourceText:
Take a moment now to relax. Breathe in slowly as you count to three... and breathe out as you count to three. Feel your body relax with each breath. 

Try this whenever you are feeling stressed and need a break. A few calm breaths can make a big difference.
text:
Thatha imizuzwana ngoku uphole. Bizela umphefumlo ngokucotha ube ubala uyokutsho kwisithathu... phinda uphefumlele ngaphandle ube ubala uyokutsho kwisithathu. Yiva umzimba wakho upholile ngomphemfulo ngamnye.

Zama lento nanina uziva unoxinzelelo ube ufuna ukuphumla. Ukuphefumla ngokuzola kambalwa kungenza umehluko omkhulu.

SourceText: RECOGNISE
text: QAPHELA

SourceText:
It could be showing love to your children, helping them with schoolwork, or preparing a meal even when you felt tired. 

Every small effort you make matters, and you get to celebrate yourself.
text:
Ingabonisa uthando kuba ntwana bakho, ukubancedisa ngemisebenzi yesikolo, okanye ubalungiselele ukutya naxa uziva udiniwe.

Yonke imzamo emincinci yenza into kwaye ufumana ukuzibhiyozela.

SourceText: REWARD
text: UMVUZO

SourceText: Remember, you deserve your “me time” too! What makes you happy?
text: Khumbula, ufanelwe''lixesha lakho'' nawe! Yintoni ekwenza wonwabe?

SourceText: More tips
text: Iingcebiso ezingakumbi

SourceText:
It could be something small, like enjoying a cup of tea, taking a short nap, chatting with a friend, or listening to your favourite music.

Spending time with your teen can be fun for you too! It might even make you feel less stressed.
text:
Ingayinto encinci, njengo konwabela ikomityi ye-ti, ukungqengqa kancinci, uncokole nomhlobo, okanye umamele umculo owuthandayo.

Ukuchitha ixesha kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kungakonwabisa nawe! Ingakwenza uzive unoxinzelelo oluphantsi.

SourceText:
Remember: Small moments of self-care matter. This week, find time to relax, recognize your efforts, and reward yourself whenever you can.
 
Care for yourself every day. You deserve it!
text:
Khumbula: Imizuzwana embalwa yokuzikhathalela iyabala. Kuleveki, fumana ithuba lokuphola, qaphela imizamo yakho kwaye uzinike imbuyekezo kangangoko unako. 

Khathalela isiqu sakho ntsuku zonke. Ikufanele!

SourceText: Can you find moments this week to relax, recognise your efforts, and reward yourself?
text: Ungafumana imizuzwana kule veki uphole, qaphela imizamo yakho, kwaye uzinike imbuyekezo?

SourceText: Yes
text: Ewe

SourceText: That's great! Every small step you take to care for yourself makes a big difference for your family.
text: Kuhle kakhulu! Qho usenza inyathelo elincinci ngokukhathalela isiqu sakho wenza umehluko omkhulu kusapho lwakho.

SourceText: I think so
text: Ndicinga njalo

SourceText: That’s a good start! Look for small ways to relax, recognise your efforts, and reward yourself - even little moments of self-care can make a big difference.
text: Sisiqalo esilungileyo! Khangela indlela ezincinci zokuphola, qaphela imizamo yakho, kwaye uzibuyekeze- nemizuzwana nje embalwa yokuzikhathalela ingenza umehluko omkhulu.

SourceText: No
text: Hayi

SourceText: That's okay. Try choosing one small, simple action like taking a deep breath or sitting quietly for a moment. Every little bit counts!
text: Kulungile, Zama ukukhetha ibenye encinci, ukwenza nje into elula uphefumle nzulu okanye uhlale ngokuzola umzuzwana. Yonke into encinci iyabala!

SourceText:
Remember, taking small moments for self-care helps us stay calm, strong, and connected to our families. 

When we look after ourselves, we are better able to support our teens!
text:
Khumbula, ukuthatha imizuzwana emincinci ngesiqu sakho kuyasinceda sihlale sizolile, somelele kwaye siqhagamshelene nentsapho zethu.

Xa sizijonga iziqu zethu, singcono sinako ukuxhasa abantwana bethu abafikisayo!

SourceText: Remember @data.characters.media_male_1.name? Here’s what his son says about his father practising self care
text: Khumbula@data.characters.media_male_1.name? Nantsi into ethethwa ngunyana wakhe malunga ngo tata wakhe ngokulungiselela ukukhathalela isiqu sakhe
note: The string @data.characters.media_male_1.name? should not be translated.

SourceText:
My dad was always busy. He would come home from work and snap at us when we started asking him questions.

@global.app_name helped us a lot. We no longer fight. Now, when my dad comes home, he first sits down by himself for 5 minutes and then we do a relaxing activity from @global.app_name together, so we can all take a deep breath and relax. Then we can chat about our day, about anything good or bad that happened. Everyone is so much happier now.
text:
Utata wam wayehlala exakekile. Wayebuya emsebenzini asigangele phezulu xa siqala umbuza imibuzo.

@global.app_name yasinceda kakhulu. Asisalwi. Ngoku,utata xa efika endlini, uqala azihlalelele imizuzu eyi-5 emva koko senze umsebenzi wokuphumla kwi@global.app_name sisonke,siye siphefumle nzulu kwaye siphole. Emva koko sincokole ngosuku lwethu,malunga nezinto ezintle okanye ezimbi ezithe zenzeka. Wonke umntu wonwabile kakhulu ngoku.

SourceText: ⚠️ Sensitive Content Notice
text: ⚠️ Isaziso somxholo onobuzaza

SourceText:
This module includes content that may be sensitive. You can check it out by yourself first. This will prepare you well for sharing the content with your teen and others afterwards.

If you need support, see the “Support Contacts” section in your Library for help.
text:
Esi sifundo siquka umxholo onoba nobuzaza. Ungazikhangelela ngokunokwakho kuqala. Lonto ingakulungiselela kakuhle ukwabelana nomxholo nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kunye nabanye emva koko.

Ukuba udinga inkxaso, jonga kwicandelo la" Bafowunelwa Benkxaso" kwithala leencwadi ukuze uncedakale.

SourceText:
Today’s topic is body changes and intimate relationships.

Teens go through many changes in their bodies and feelings. Talking to them helps them handle it better.

Let your teen know you’re there to listen and support them. You don’t need all the answers—just being there helps them feel safe and make good choices.
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje lutshintsho kumzimba kunye nobudlelwana obusondeleyo.

Abantwana abafikisayo badlula kwiinguqu ezininzi kwimizimba yabo kwakunye nemizwa yabo. Ukuthetha nabo kubanceda bayiphathe ngcono.

Makayazi umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukhona ukubamamela nokubaxhasa. Awudingi iimpendulo zonke - ukuba khona kwakho kubanceda bazive bekhuselekile kwaye benze ukhetho olulungileyo.

SourceText:
**Think back to your own teenage years:**

- Did you face any challenges with body changes or relationships?
- What support or advice do you wish you had?
- Do you think your teen might be going through something similar?
text:
**Cinga emva kwiminyaka yokufikisa kwakho:**

-Wawukhe wahlangabezana nawo nawuphi na umceli mngeni kutshintsho lomzimba okanye ubudlelwana?
-Yeyiphi inkxaso okanye ingcebiso onqwenela ukuba ngewawuyifumene?
-Ucinga ukuba umntwana wakho ofikisayo ingaba udlula kwinto ebufana?

SourceText: Why talk with your teen about body changes and relationships? Tap play to find out
text: Kutheni uthetha nomntwana wakho ofikisayo malunga notshintsho loumzimba kwakunye nobudlelwana? Cofa udlala ukufumanisa

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is body changes and intimate relationships.

Discussing body and intimate relationships with your child can be difficult. However, it is important to have these discussions in order for your teen to understand that this stage of life is normal. This will help them to acknowledge the changes in their bodies and be able to make positive decisions regarding intimate relationships.
text:
Molweni, nonke.

Isihloko sanamhlanje singotshintsho kumzimba kunye nobudlelwana obusondeleneyo.

Ukuxoxa ngomzimba kunye nobudlelwana obusondeleneyo nomntwana wakho kunganzima. Nangona kunjalo, kubalulekile ukuxoxa ngazo ukuze umntwana wakho ofikisayo ayiqonde ukuba esisigaba sobomi siqhelekile. Oku kuzabanceda baluvume utshintsho kwimizimba yabo kwaye bakwazi ukuthatha izigqibo ezilungileyo ngokuphathelelene kubudlelwane obusondeleneyo.

SourceText: Even if these conversations feel uncomfortable at first, starting small can build trust. You might be surprised by how much your teen wants to share once they know you are ready to listen without judgment.
text: Nokuba ezincoko zivakala zingakhululekanga kuqala, ukuqala kancinci kungakha ithemba. Usenokumangala yindlela umntwana wakho ofikisayo afuna ngayo ukwabelana xa besazi ukulungele ukumamela ngaphandle kokugweba.

SourceText: Hear how @global.app_name helped @data.characters.media_female_10.name talk to her son about relationships
text: Mamela indlela u@global.app_name ancede ngayo u@data.characters.media_female_10.name ukuthetha nonyana wakhe malunga nobudlelwana

SourceText:
Thanks to the app, I can now talk to my son about all these changes that he is going through with his body and emotions and relationships. We were both not comfortable bringing it up before, but the practical examples in the app made it possible for us to start talking. And I was really surprised by how many questions and experiences my son already has, even though he is only 14!

Now he can come to me if there is something happening at school or if he is not sure how to handle something. The other day he even told me that some of his friends were making fun of him because he does not have a girlfriend yet, so we talked about it and I could explain to him that it is important to focus on school first and that it is never okay for someone to pressure him to have a relationship.
text:
Ndiyabulela kule app, ngoku ndiyakwazi ukuthetha nonyana wam ngalo lonke utshintsho lomzimba ajongene nalo kunye nemvakalelo kunye nobudlelwane. Sobabini besingakhululekanga ukuyivusa ngaphambili, kodwa imizekele eseyi sayenza ekwi app yenze kwalula ukuqala incoko. Kwaye ndiye ndothuka yimibuzo kunye namava unyana wam senayo, nangona ena 14!

Ngoku angakawazi ukuza kum ukuba kukho into eyenzekileyo esikolweni okanye akaqinisekanga noku sombulula into. Ngenye imini ebendixelela ukuba ontanga bakhe bahlekisa ngaye ngoba engenamantombazana okwangoku, sithethile ke ndamaxelela ngalonto ndamcacisela ukuba kubalulekile ukuba aqiniseke esikolweni kuqala kwaye ayilunganga into yokuba umntu anyanzelwe ukuba abenamantombi.

SourceText:
Teens often learn different things about sex from school, friends, family, or social media - but this information isn’t always correct or right for their age.

Talking about sex can feel uncomfortable. Parents and teens may even argue, especially if parents don’t agree with what their teen is doing.

Let’s see how @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and her granddaughter, @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name, handled this.
text:
Umntwana ofikisayo ufunda izinto ezahlukeneyo ngezesondo esikolweni,kwizihlobo,kusapho, okanye kumakhasi onxibelelwano-kodwa ezinkcukacha azisoloko zichanekile okanye zilungile ngokweminyaka yabo.

 Ukuthetha ngokwabelana kwesondo ungaziva ungakhululekanga. Abazali kunye nabantwana abafikisayo bangaxoxisana, ngakumbi ukuba abazali abavumelani nento eyenziwa ngumntwana ofikisayo.

Masibone u @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name kunye nomzukwalana, @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name, bajongene njani nalento.

SourceText: @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name is on her way to leave the house looking very pretty.
text: @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name use ndleleni ephuma kokwabo ebukeka emhle kakhulu.
note: The string @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name should not be translated.

SourceText: Where are you going looking like that?
text: Uyaphi unjena nje?

SourceText: I am going out with some of my friends.
text: Ndiyaphuma kunye nabanye abahlobo bam.

SourceText: @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name accidentally drops her bag, and a packet of condoms falls out.
text: @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name ngempazamo wawisa ibegi yakhe, kwapuma ipakethi yezikhuseli ngaphandle.
note: The string @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name should not be translated.

SourceText: What is that @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name? Condoms? Why are you carrying those in your bag? Where did you get them?!
text: Yintoni le @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name? Izikhuseli? Kutheni uphethe ezonto ebegini yakho? Uzifumanaphi?!
note: The string @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name? should not be translated.

SourceText: I got it from one of the girls at school today. We were talking about safe sex and she said she uses birth control so that she does not get pregnant.
text: Ndizifumana komnye wamantombazana esikolweni namhlanje. Besithetha ngokhuseleko ekwabelaneni ngosondo kwaye wathi usebenzisa ukunqanda ukukhulelwa ukuze angakhulelwa.

SourceText: What is this talk of sex in my house! You are too young…

@data.characters.f1_mother.name did well by finding solutions together with @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name. But this can be hard to do.

Many parents want to help their teens but find it difficult to talk about sensitive topics, like body changes and relationships.
text:
@data.characters.f1_mother.name wenze kakuhle ukufumana isisombululo nikunye @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name. kodwa ingaba yinto enzima ukuyenza.

Abazali abaninzi bafuna ukunceda abantwana babo abafikisayo kodwa bafumana iyinto enzima ukuthetha ngezihloko ezibuthathaka, ezifana nokutshintsha komzimba kunye nobudlelwane.

SourceText: Here are some questions from other parents to help you begin.
text: Nantsi imibuzo esuka kwabanye abazali unceda wena uqale.

Who should start the conversation about body changes and intimate relationships? 
Try selecting each option for more tips!
text:
Ngubani ekufuneka aqale incoko malunga notshintsho lomzimba kunye nobudlelwane obusondeleleneyo?
Zama ukukhetha ukhetho ngalunye nengcebiso ezingakumbi!

Remember, friends can sometimes mislead or have wrong information themselves.

Lento ayilunganga ncam

Khumbula, abahlobo bangalahlekisa ngamanye amaxesha okanye babene nkcukhaca ezingalunganga bona kuqala.

SourceText:
This is not quite right. 

Your teen might feel uncomfortable or scared to start that conversation with you.
text:
Lento ayilunganga ncam.

Umntana wakho ofikisayo usenokuziva engakhululekanga okanye esoyika ukuqala loncoko kunye nawe.

SourceText:
Yes, you may need to start the conversation - and it’s okay to feel shy. Be open and use the right words for any body parts you discuss (like breasts, penis, or vagina).

You can practise with a friend and ask a health worker or social worker for more information. The more you know, the better you can help your teen.

And remember, it’s also okay not to know everything. You can say, “I’m not sure - let me find out and tell you later.”
text:
Ewe, kungadingeka uyiqale incoko - kwaye kulungile ukuziva unentloni. Thetha ngokungafihlisiyo kwaye usebenzise amagama afanelekileyo nakwawaphi na amalungu omzimba enixoxa ngawo (njenga mabele, ilungu lobudoda , okanye ilungu lobufazi).

Ungaziqhelanisa kunye nomhlobo kwaye ubuze umsebenzi weziko lezempilo okanye unontlalontle ngenkcukhacha ezithe vetshe, okukhona usazi, okungcono ukunceda umntana wakho ofikisayo.

Kwaye khumbula, kukwalungile ukungazi yonke into. Ungathi, '' Andiqinisekanga - mandike ndifumanise ndikuxelele mva.''

SourceText: Other parents also wonder:
text: Abanye abazali iyabothusa nabo:

SourceText:
When is the right time to start talking about body changes and intimate relationships?
Try selecting each option for more tips!
text:
Linini ixesha elilungileyo lokuqala ukuthetha malunga notshintsho lomzimba nobudlelwane obusondeleleneyo?
Zama ukhetha into nganye  ngezinye iingcebiso ezingakumbi!

SourceText: When you find out they have a boyfriend or girlfriend
text: Xa ufumanisa baneqabane okanye iqabanekazi

text: Xa bena 10

SourceText: Before they turn 10

text: Xa ufumana ithuba

SourceText:
That’s not quite right.

Teens need to learn about body changes and relationships early, so they are prepared and can make good choices.

If you find out your teen is having sex, try to stay calm and share your worries gently. Getting angry can make it harder for your teen to talk to you.
text:
Ayilunganga ncam lonto 

Abantwana abafikisayo badinga ukufunda malunga notshintsho lomzimba kunye nobudlelwane kwangethuba, kwenzele balungele kwaye benze ukhetho olulungileyo.

Xa ufumanisa uba umntana wakho ofikisayo wabelana ngesondo, zama ukuzola kwaye wabelane ngenkxalabo zakho ngoku thambileyo. Ukuba nomsindo kungakwenza nzima ukuba umntana wakho ofikisayo athethe nawe.

SourceText:
Age 10 is when a lot of children start to enter puberty, so they need to already understand how their bodies and feelings may change.

This will also help them cope better with sexual feelings safely.
text:
Iminyaka eyi 10 kulapho abantwana abaninzi beqala ukufikisa, ke ngoko kudingeka babe sebeqonda ukuba imizimba neemvakelelo zabo zisenokutshintsha njani. 

Oku kungabanceda bamelane ngcono nemizwa yesondo ngokuphephileyo.

SourceText:
That's right! 

Age 10 is when a lot of children start to enter puberty, so they need to already understand how their bodies and feelings may change.

This will also help them cope better with sexual feelings safely.
text:
Ilungile lonto!

Iminyaka eyi 10 kulapho abantwana abaninzi beqala ukufikisa, ke ngoko kudingeka babe sebeqonda ukuba imizimba neemvakalelo zabo zisenokutshintsha njani.

SourceText:
It’s good to start talking about body changes and relationships early - by gently answering your child’s questions.

You don’t need to explain everything. Just give simple, honest answers that match their age and understanding.
text:
Kulungile ukuqala ukuthetha malunga notshintsho lomzimba kunye nobudlelwane kwange thuba - ngokuphendula imibuzo yomntana wakho ngokuthambileyo.

Akukho sidingo sokucacisa yonke into. Nika nje iimpendulo ezilula, eziyinyani ezingqamene neminyaka nokuqonda kwabo.

SourceText: Many parents also ask:
text: Abazali abaninzi bayabuza nabo:

SourceText:
How can I best keep my teen safe?
Try selecting each option for more tips!
text:
Ndinga mgcina njani umntana wam ofikisayo ekhuselekile ngokungcono?
Zama ukukhetha into nganye ngengcebiso ezingakumbi!

SourceText: I determine what my teen can and cannot do
text: Ndiyamisela into umntana wam ofikisayo anokuyenza nenokungayenzi

SourceText: I keep information or bad influences away from them
text: Ndigcina iinkcukhaca okanye imithelela emibi kude kubo

SourceText: I build a healthy trusting relationship with my teen
text: Ndikha ubudlelwane obusempilweni obuthembekileyo nomntana wam ofikisayo

SourceText: I discuss consequences and solutions with my teen
text: Ndiyayixoxa imiphumela kunye nezisombululo nomntana wam ofikisayo

SourceText: I emphasize that pressure is never okay
text: Ndiyayigxininisa ukuba uxinizelelo alulunganga

SourceText:
This may not work.

When we try to control too much, teens may do the opposite of what we want.

But when we guide them and give them space to make choices, they often act more responsibly.
text:
Lento isenokungasebenzi. 

Xa sizama ukuba lawula kakhulu, abantwana abafikisayo bangenza okuchaseneyo kwinto esiyifunayo.

Kodwa xa sibakhokhela kwaye sibanika umtyhi ukwenza ukhetho, bavame uthatha uxanduva nangakumbi.

SourceText:
This may not work. 

Teens get pressure and information from many places we can’t control.

As parents, we can guide and prepare them to know what is right or wrong—and help them feel confident to make good decisions.
text:
Lena isenongasebenzi.

Abantwana abafikisayo bafumana uxinizelelo nolwazi kwiindawo ezininzi esingenakuzilawula.

Njengabazali, singaba khokela kwaye sibalungiselela ukuyazi into elungileyo nengalunganga - kwaye sibancedise bazive bezithemba ukwenza izigqibo ezilungileyo.

SourceText:
That’s right.

When your teen feels trusted, they are more likely to trust you and come to you for advice or help.

Praise and thank them when they share. Avoid judging, so they feel safe to talk to you again.
text:
Ilungile lonto.

Xa umntana wakho ofikisayo eziva ethenjiwe, bavame ukukuthemba nangakumbi kwaye baze kuwe ngengcebiso okanye uncedo.

Bancome kwaye ubabulele xa besabelana. Phepha ukugweba, kwenzele bazive bephephile ukuthetha nawe kwakhona.

SourceText:
That’s right.

Good decisions come from thinking through the consequences. Talk openly with your teen when there’s a problem. Listen to each other and find solutions together.

Each challenge is an opportunity to teach your teen that actions have consequences—and you can handle them as a team.

Remember to praise each other for working through tough situations together.
text:
Kulungile.

Iziqgibo ezilungileyo zifumaneka ekucingisiseni kakuhle kwiziphumo. Thetha ngoku phandle nomntana wakho ofikisayo xa kukho ingxaki. Mamelanani nikhangele isisombululo kunye.

Umngeni ngamnye lithuba lokufundisa umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba zonke izenzo zinezi phumo kwaye funeka nijongane nazo nobabini.

Khumbula ukuncomana nomnye ngokusebenzisana kwimeko eezinobu ndzima.

SourceText:
That’s right.

To stay safe, your teen needs to know the difference between respectful behaviours and relationships, and unhealthy ones..

Respectful relationships feel caring, safe, and fair. Unhealthy ones involve pressure, discomfort, or feeling unsafe.

No one should be forced to do something they’re not okay with. You can learn more about this in the Staying Safe module.
text:
Kuhle.

Ukuhlala uphephile, umntana wakho ofikisayo funeka amazi umahluko phakathi kokuziphatha okuhloniphekileyo kunye nobudlelwane, kunye nezingalunganga.

Ubudlelwane obuhloniphekileyo uzivha ukhathala, uphephile kwaye kulinganwe. Ezingalunganga kubakho ucinezeleko, uhlupho, uzive ungakhuselekanga.

Akhomntu funeka enyanzelisiwe ukuba enze into angayifuniyo. Ungafunda lukhulu koku kula modyuli Yokuhlala Ukhuselekile.

SourceText: Another common question among parents:
text: Omnye umbuzo oqhelekileyo phakathi kwabazali:

SourceText:
How can I help prevent my teen from having sex too young?
Try selecting each option for more tips!
text:
Ndingam ncedaa njan ukumthintele umntwana wam ofikisayo ekwenzeni izimanga.
Zama ukukhetha kwezinye zezincebiso ukuze fumene incebiso ezithe vetshe!

SourceText: Keep any information about sex away from them
text: Gcina naluphi na ulwazi ngezimanga kude kubo

SourceText: Forbid them to have a boyfriend or girlfriend
text: Sukubavumela ukuba abenenkwenkwe okanye intombazana

SourceText: Have an open discussion on how and why they could wait to have sex
text: Iba nengxoxo evulekileyo nabo ekubeni ba mabangenzi izimanga balinde

SourceText:
That’s not quite right.

Teens hear many things about sex—from school, friends, or social media. Some of it is wrong.

Knowing about sex doesn’t mean they are having sex. Good information helps them stay safe and understand why waiting to have sex can be a good choice.

Without this knowledge, they may face problems, like not knowing how pregnancy happens or the risks of sex.
text:
Akulunganga.

Abantwana abafikisayo bava izinto ezininze ngezimanga-eskolweni, kubahlobo okanye kumakhasi ongxibelelwano. Ezinye zazo azilunganga.

Ukwazi ngezimanga lonto ayithi bayazenza. Ulwazi oluthe vetshe luyanceda ukuba bahlale bephephile kwaye bayiqondisise kakuhle ukuba kutheni kufuneka belindile ekwenzeni izimanga kusisqibo esehle.

Ukungabi nolulwazi, kungabangela bajamelane nengxaki, nje ngongazi ngokukhulelwa okanye ubungozi bezimanga.

SourceText:
That’s not quite right.

Your teen might have a boyfriend or girlfriend and not tell you.

If you make them hide it, they may not come to you with questions or problems—and this can lead to risky situations.
text:
Akulunganga.

Umntwana wakho ofikisayo anganayo inkwenkwe okanye intomazana anagakuxeleli.

Ukuba ubenza bakufihlele, bangangazi kuwe ngemibuzo okanye ingxaki-kwaye lonto ingakhokelela kwizimo ezinobungozi.

SourceText:
That’s right.

Teens are figuring out who they are. They look to friends and media for answers, and may feel pressure to do things they’re not ready for.

Talk calmly with your teen about waiting to have sex until they feel ready, are in a safe relationship, and understand the consequences. Focus on guiding them calmly to make healthy choices.
text:
Kulungile.

Abantwana abafikisayo bayzibonela ukuba ngobani. Bajonga ebahlobeni nakwi midiya ukufumana mpendulo, kwaye ungava ucinezelelo ukuba enze into engekakulungeli ukuyenza.

Thetha pholileyo nomntana wakho ofikisayo malunga nokulinda ekwenzeni izimanga de abe ukulungele, abe kubudlelwanwe ubukhuselekileyo kwaye aziqondisise kakhuhle iziphumo. Jolisa ekukhokheleni pholileyo ekwenzeni eziqibo ezilungileyo.

SourceText:
Discussing body changes and intimate relationships can be uncomfortable, but it is so important in order to keep your teen happy, healthy and safe. 

Here are some skills to help you get started.
text:
Ukuthetha ngotshintsho lomzimba kunye nobudlelwane obusondeleleneyo kungangabi lula, kodwa ke kubalulekile ekugcineni umntwana wakho ofikisayo onwabile, esempilweni, ekuselekile.

Nazi ezinye zezakhona ezinekunceda uqale.

SourceText: BUILD
text: YAKHA

SourceText:
Build a strong relationship with your teen by spending time with them and showing them you trust them. Create a safe, encouraging space, and avoid judging them.

That will make your teen share their questions and worries with you, when they need advice or are in a potentially dangerous situation.
text:
Yakha ubudlelwane obuliqilimanomntana wakho ofikisayo ukucitha ixhesha nabo ubabonise ukuba themba. Yakha indawo ekhuselekileyo, ekhuthazayo, kwaye ukuphephe ukubagxeka.

Lonto izakwenza bakwazi ukwabelana nawe ngemibuzo kunye namaxhala abo,xa bedinga incebiso okanye kwisimo esinoxinezelelo.

SourceText: START
text: QALA

SourceText:
Your teen may feel shy or scared, so parents need to start the talk about body changes and intimate relationships.

Begin early by answering questions simply and honestly. This builds confidence for you and your child.

It’s okay to feel uncomfortable. Be open, use the correct words, and get help if you don’t know all the answers.
text:
Umntana wakho ofikisayo angazi engakhululekanga okanye enoloyiko, kengoku abazali funeka baqalise ukuthetha ngotshintsho lomzimba kunye nobudlelwane obusondeleyo.

Qala kwangethuba ukuphendula imibuzo elula kwaye unyaniseke. Oku kwakha ukuzithemba kuwe kunye nomntana wakho.

Kulungile ukuziva ungakhululekanga. Thetha ngokuphandle, usebenzise amagama afanelekileyo, kwaye ufumane uncedo ukuba awunazo zonke impendulo.

SourceText: GUIDE
text: KHOKHELA

SourceText:
Your teen will hear about sex from many places. If they feel safe with you, you can help them find good information and make smart choices.

Help them think about consequences without shame or blame. Make sure they know they should never feel pressure (or pressure others) into sex or a relationship.

You can also ask other adults or health workers for help and information.
text:
Umntana wakho uzakuva ngokwabelana ngesondo kwi ezininzi. Ukuba baziva bekhuselekile nawe, ungaba nceda bafumane ulwazi kwaye benze izigqibo ezilungileyo.

Bancede bacinge ngeziphumo ngaphendle kukubasizela okanye ubasole. Qiniseka ukuba bayayazi soze bazive benocinezelelo (okanye bacinezele abanye) ekwabelaneni ngesondo okanye ukuhambisana.

Ungabuza nakubantu abadala okanye kubasebenzi abangonompilo ufune uncedo kunye nolwazi.

SourceText:
This week’s home activity is to read and talk about this module’s stories with your teen. Use them to start a conversation about body changes and relationships.

You can talk about what happened with @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name or @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name and their parents.

These stories can make it easier to talk about tricky topics and share ideas about healthy, respectful relationships.
text:
Imisebenzi yasekhaya yaleveki kuku funda nokuthetha ngamabali alemodyuli nomntana wakho ofikisayo. Zisebenzise ukuqala incoko ngotshintsho lomzimba kunye nobudlelwane.

Ungathetha ngento eyenze ku@data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name okanye @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name kunye nabazali.

Lamabali angakwenzela lula ukuthetha ngumba onobunzima kwaye nabelane ngembono eziphilileyo, ubuhlobo obuhloniphekileyo.

SourceText: Can you read the stories with your teen and use them to start an open talk about body changes and relationships?
text: Ungakwazi ukufunda lamabali nomntana wakho ofikisayo uzisebenzise ukuqala uvula incoko ngotshintsho lomzimba kunye nobudlelwane?

SourceText: Yes
text: Ewe

SourceText: Perfect! Talking about these topics openly helps your teen feel safe, supported, and able to make healthy decisions.
text: Iqibelele! Ukuthetha ngalemiba kunceda umntana wakho ofikisayo azive ekhuselekile, exhasiwe kwaye ibenza bakwazi ukuthatha iziqibo eziphilileyo.

SourceText: I think so
text: Ndicinga njalo

SourceText: You are doing so well! Even starting a small conversation makes a big difference. Keep going - your teen will appreciate your support.
text: Uqhuba kakuhle kakhulu! Nokuqala incoko encinci yenza umahluko omkhulu. Qhubeka - umntana wakho ofikisayo uzakuyivuyela inxaso yakho.

SourceText: No
text: Hayi

SourceText: That's okay. It is normal for these talks to feel a little uncomfortable at first. Try again another time - every small step counts.
text: Kulungile. Kuqhelekile ukuba incoko ezinje uzive ungakhululekanga xa uqala. Zama kwakhona ngelinye ixesha - amanyathelo amancinci ayabala.

SourceText:
Talking openly with your teen about body changes and relationships helps them feel safe, supported, and better able to make healthy choices. 

No matter your teen’s age, now is the best time to build trust and guide them with care.
text:
Ukuthetha ngoku khululekileyo kunye nomntana wakho ngokutshintsh komzimba kunye nobudlelwane kumnceda azive ekhululekile, exhasiwe kwaye imenze athathe iziqgibo eziphilileyo.

Noba ingathini iminyaka yomntana wakho ofikisayo, ngoku lelena xesha lifanelekileyo lokwakha uthembana kunye noba khokhela ngenkathalo.

SourceText: @data.characters.media_daughter_8.name learned a lot from honest talks with her mother. Tap play to hear their story
text: @data.characters.media_daughter_8.name funde lukhulu kwincoko ebenayo kunye nomama wakhe. Cofa udlala umamela amabali wabo.
note: The string @data.characters.media_daughter_8.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
As teens, we hear all these things about sex from others at school and on the internet. I thought all those things were true, and I was doing a lot of things secretly, because my friends were pushing me and I was afraid of what my mother would say.

When I did this app together with my mother, I realised that so many things I learnt were not true. I learnt I can get better information and I learnt others should never push me to do things I do not want to do. My mother and I can talk about these things now. I wish we could have done that when I was younger, because it would have helped me a lot, but I am still glad we can talk today. Whenever I have a question or problem now, I know I can ask my mother and she will help me think of answers and solutions together.
text:
Nje ngabantwana abafikisayo, siva ngazo ngokwabelana ngokwe sondo kwabanye eskolweni nakwi intanethi. Ndandicinga zonke ezizinto ziyinyani, kwaye ndandisenza ezizinto ngokusemfihlweni, ngoba abahlobo bam babendinyanzela kwaye ndandisoyika ukuba umama wam uzakuthini.

Emvakokuba ndenze le app kunye nomama wam, ndifumanise ukuba into ezininzi endizifundileyo aziyonyani. Ndifunde ukuba ndingafumana incukaca ezithe vetshe kwaye ndifunde ukuba ndingaze ndinyanzelwe ngabanye ukuba ndenze into endingafuni ukuyenza. Mna kunye nomama wam singathetha ngezizinto ngok. ndinqwenelwa ukuba sasithethe ngezizinto ndisemncinci, ngoba ibinindinceda kakhulu, kodwa ndiyavuya kuba sikwazi ukuthetha namhlanje. Nanini na ndinombuzo okanye ingxaki, ndiyayazi ukuba ndingabuza kumama wam kwaye uzakundinceda ukucinga impendulo kwaye sizisombulule sobabini.

SourceText: ⚠️ Sensitive Content
text: ⚠️Umxholo obuthathaka

SourceText:
This module includes content that may be sensitive. You can check it out by yourself first. This will prepare you well for sharing the content with your teen and others afterwards.

If you need support, see the “Support Contacts” section in your Library for help.
text: Le modyuli ibandakanya umxholo onoba buthathaka. Ungayijonga ngokwakho kuqala. Lento izakulungiselela kakuhle ukwabelana ngalomxholo kunye nomntana wakho ofikisayo kunye nabanye emva koko.

SourceText:
Our topic today is staying safe.

To keep our teens safe, we need to understand their reality and the potential risky situations they can find themselves in.

We can help our teens know how to use their thoughts, voice, AND body in dangerous situations. It makes a big difference!
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje kukuhlala ukhuselekile.

Ukugcina abantwana bethu abafikisayo bekhuselekile, kufuneka siqonde nobunyani bazo kunye neemeko ezinokuthi zibe yingozi abanokuzifumana bekuzo.

Singabancedisa abantwana bethu abafikisayo bayazi indlela yokusebenzisa ingcinga zabo, ilizwi, KWAYE nomzimba kwimeko ezinobungozi. Yenza umehluko omkhulu!

SourceText: Why is discussing safety with your teen important? Click play to find out
text: Kutheni ukuxoxa ngokhuseleko nomntana wakho ofikisayo kubalulekile? Cofa udlala ukufumanisa

SourceText:
Greetings everyone.

Our topic is staying safe.

As parents it is important to ensure that our teens are safe at all times. Our safety and our children’s safety is important. We may need to have discussions with our children about their safety, and how they can keep themselves safe always.
text:
Molweni nonke.

Isihloko sethu kukuhlala ukhuselekile.

Njengomzali kubalulekile ukuqinisekisa ukuba abantwana bethu abafikisayo bakhuselekile ngamaxesha onke. Ukhuseleko lwethu kunye nokhuseleko lwabantwana bethu lubalulekile. Kungadingeka ukuba sibe nengxoxo nabantwana bethu ngokhuseleko lwabo, nangokuba bangazigcina njani bekhuselekile ngamaxesha onke.

SourceText: Practising how to recognise warning signs and how to respond can help teens feel confident to protect themselves when it matters most.
text: Ukulungiselela uba uziqaphela njani impawu zesilumkiso kwaye nendlela yophendula ingabanceda abantwana abafikisayo bazive benokuzithemba ekuzikhuseleni xa kukho imfuneko kakhulu.

SourceText: Hear how learning warning signs kept @data.characters.media_female_11.name's teen safe
text: Yiva uba iimpawu zesilumkiso zamgcina njani ekhuselekile umntana ofikisayo ka @data.characters.media_female_11.name
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_11.name's should not be translated.

SourceText:
Learning how to stay safe really helped us. The other day, my daughter got invited to a party by an older boy, and he said he would pay for her transport. Before, she would just go secretly, but now she came to me to talk about it.

We reminded each other that it is important to see the warning signs and stay safe, and she decided to say ‘no’. I am so proud of her. Even me, I now know that others should not pressure or convince me to do something. I can give the right example to my children.
text:
Ukufunda uba uzigcina njani ukhuselekile zasinceda nyani. Ngenye imini, intombi yam yayimenyiwe ethekweni yinkwenkwe endala, kwaye wathi uzakumbhatalela imali yokukhwela. Ngaphambili, ebevele ahambe ngokufihlakeleyo, kodwa ngoku uze kum wazokuthetha ngayo. 

Sikhumbuzene kunye ukuba kubalulekile ukubona iimpawu zesilumkiso kwaye sihlale sikhuselekile, kwaye ugqibe kwelokuba athi 'hayi' ndiyazidla ngaye. Nditsho nam, ndiyayazi ngoku ukuba abanye akufuneki bandifake phantsi koxinzelelo okanye baqinisekise ukuba ndenze into. Ndinganika umzekelo olungileyo ebantwaneni bam.

SourceText:
People can make us feel safe and happy—but sometimes they pressure us or make us uncomfortable. This can happen to both teens and adults.

Knowing the warning signs helps us stay safe.

Let’s look at some examples.
text:
Abantu bangasenza sizive sikhuselekile kwaye sonwabile-kodwa ngamanye amaxesha bayasifaka phantsi koxinzelelo okanye basenze singakhululeki. Lento ingenzeka kubo bobabini abantwana abafikisayo nabantu abadala.

Ukwazi iimpawu zesilumkiso zisinceda sihlale sikhuselekile.

Masijonge eminye imizekelo.

text: Hayi wethu... Sisilungele isigaba esilandelayo. Siyabonana kunye lonke ixesha kwaye asizange senze enye into... Uyayazi ndiyakuthanda, nheee!

SourceText:
Yes, these are clear warning signs.

No one should push or convince you to do something you don’t want to do or feel unsure about. Even if you did it once, you can always change your mind—anytime, even during an intimate moment.

A partner who really loves and respects you will ask if you’re okay, listen to you, and stop if you say no.
text:
Ewe, ezi ziimpawu zesilumkiso ezicacileyo.

Akekho umntu ekufuneka akutyhale okanye akukholise uba wenze into ongafuni ukuyenza okanye ongaqinisekanga ngayo. Nokuba uyenze kanye, ungakwazi ukutshintsha ingqondo yakho -nanini na, naphakathi kumzuzu wokusondelelana.

Umlingani okuthanda akuhloniphe manyani uyakubuza uba kulungile na, akumamele, kwaye ayeke xa usithi hayi.

If you have a friend in @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name’s situation, try to help them see that jealous, possessive or controlling behaviour is not healthy or loving.

If @data.characters.f1_son_18.name stays quiet, his friend may keep doing it. He can help his friend understand that this behaviour is not okay and can make girls feel scared, angry, or sad.

Ukuba u @data.characters.f1_son_18.name uhlala ethule, umhlobo wakhe uzakuqhubeka eyenza. Angamnceda umhlobo wakhe aqonde ukuba lendlela yokuziphatha ayilunganga kwaye ingenza amantombazane azive esoyika, enomsindo, okanye edakumbile.

Abahlobo bakho, kunye nabanye, mabaku hloniphe ukukhetha kwakho..
