SourceText:
Yes, all of these are warning signs! Your ‘no’ should always be respected.

Also remember, if people at home or outside use alcohol and other drugs this can be a warning sign, as those can make people angry, aggressive, and even violent.
text: Ewe, zonke eziimpawu zezilumkiso! U 'hayi' wakho makasoloko ehloniphekile.

SourceText:
We’ve looked at warning signs. Now let’s think—what can we do if we don’t feel safe?

If you feel unsafe, you can say or do anything to stay safe. The goal is to get away!

Think about the moment when @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name was pressured into a car.

How could she use her voice to get away?
text:
Sizi jongile impawu zezilumnkiso. Ngoku masicinge-yintoni esinokuyenza xa singaziva sikhuselekile.

Ukuba uziva ungakhuselekanga, ungatsho okanye ungenza nantoni na ukuze ukhuseleke. injongo kukuphuma.

Cing ngomzuzu xa@data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name wayexinzezekile ukungena emotweni.

Angalisebenzisa njan ilizwi lakhe ukuze aphume?
note: The string @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
**Find a chair and pretend it is the attacker. Practise saying/doing these responses:**

- 🔈 Yell: "No!" 
- 🆘 Call for help: "Someone help me!" 
- ⚠️ Warn of consequences: "I will call the police if you touch me again."
- ⛔ Name the behaviour: "Do not touch my bum.” or “Do not yell at me.”
- 😳 Act crazy: "Make a crazy scream or act like a gorilla!"
- 🚶🏾‍♀️ Pretend to go along to buy time: “I will do anything you want, just please don’t hurt me.”
- 🤡 Use humour: “No lift for me, thanks. Last time I got a lift I threw up EVERYWHERE!”
- 📱 Give something to get what you want: “I will give you my phone if you let me go.”
text:
Khangela isitulo wenze ingathi ngumhlaseli. Lungiselela/usenza ezimpendulo:

- 🔈 Khwaza: "Hayi!"
- 🆘Khwaza uncedo: "Ndicela uncedo"
- ⚠️Izilumnkiso zezi phumo: "Ndizakubiza amapolisa ba ukhe wandibamba."
- ⛔Caza indlela yokuziphatha: "Sukundiphatha ezimpundwini." okanye "sukundi khwaza."
- 😳Ziphambanise: Yenza isikhalokazi okanyi uzenze igorila!"
- 🚶🏾‍♀️Yenza ingathi ukwenzela uzinike ixesha: "Ndizakwenza yonke into oyifunayo, ndiyakucela ongandonzakalisi."
- 🤡Sebenzisa ubuntu: " Sukundi khwelisa, enkosi. Ukuqibela kwam uku khweliswa ndagabha NDAWOYONKE!"
- 📱Ndinike into ukuze nawe ufumane lento uyifunayo: Ndizaku nika ifoni yami ukuba uyandiyeka ndihambe.".

SourceText: Let’s think back to @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name’s dangerous situation.
text: Masicinge emva @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name kwimeko eziyingozi.
note: The string @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name’s should not be translated.

SourceText: Could this situation happen to a boy?
text: Imeka enje ingenzeka enkwenkweni?

SourceText: It’s true. Both boys and girls can find themselves in dangerous situations.
text: Kunjalo. Bobabini amakhwenkwe kunye namantombi bangazifumana bekwimeko zobungozi.

SourceText: That’s not quite right. Both boys and girls can find themselves in dangerous situations.
text: Aku njalo ncam. Bobabini amaKhwenkwe kunye namantombazana bangazibona be kwimeko ezinobungozi.

SourceText: Could a boy use his voice to get away?
text: Ikhwekwe ingasebenzisa ilizwi lwayo ukuze iphuncuke?

SourceText: Boys and girls can both find themselves in dangerous situations. Both boys and girls are allowed to do, say, and believe anything that will help them stay safe.
text: Amakhwenkwe kunye namantombazane bobabini bangazibona be kwi meko ezinobungozi. Bobabini amakhwenkwe kunye namantombazane bavumelekile ukwenza, ithi, kwaye bathembe yonke into enokuba nceda ukuze bahlale bekhuselekile.

SourceText: When our voice does not stop the situation, we can use our bodies to defend ourselves.
text: Xa amazwi ethu engenokwazi uku nqanda imeko, singasebenzisa imizimba yethu ukuzikhusela.

SourceText:
**EYES**
- Use your fingers as claws and scratch the attacker’s face as hard as possible.

- Push your thumbs into the eye sockets of your attacker and then outward towards the sides of their head.

**THROAT**
- Push your finger into the hole at the bottom of the attacker’s throat.

- Punch the throat with your fist or the back of your elbow.

**GROIN**
- Kick the attacker’s groin with your knee, or punch it with your fist or elbow.

- Grab, squeeze, twist and pull the attacker’s testicles with your hand.

**KNEES**
- Kick against your attacker's knee with your foot.
text:
**AMEHLO**
Sebenzisa inzipho zeminwe yakho kwaye ukrwempe ubuso bomhlaseli kangangoko unokwenza.

Sebenzisa oobhontsi bakho ubafake emehlweni omhlaseli wakho kwaye ngaphandle ukuya emacaleni entloko yakhe.

**UMQALA**
Hlohla iminwe emqaleni uyotsho ekuqibeleni komqala womhlaseli wakho.

Mhlohle inqindi emqaleni okanye umhlohle umva wengqiniba.

**ISIHLUNU**
Khaba umhlaseli esihlunwini ngedolo, okanye mfake inqindi okanye ingqiniba.

Mbambe, umfincisele, umjije kwaye umtsale amasende ngesandla.

SourceText: Take a look at the image and these examples to see how you can use the weak spots or targets on your attacker’s body.
text: Jonga kulemifanekisa kunye nalemizekelo ujonge ukuba ungayisebenzisa njani kwimpawu ezilula ojolise kuzo emzimbeni womhlaseli.

SourceText: Learn how to protect yourself by knowing weak spots on an attacker’s body:
text: Funda ukuzikhusela ngokwazi indawo ezibuthathaka kumzimba womhlaseli:

SourceText:
**TEMPLES**
- Punch the attacker’s temples with your fist or the back of your elbow.
**NOSE** 
- Punch the attacker’s nose with your fist or the back of your elbow.
**EARS**
- With flat hands, smack the attacker’s ears from both sides as hard as possible. You can also pull or twist them.
**RIBS**
- Punch the attacker in the ribs with your fist or the back of your elbow.
**FINGERS**
- Pull the attacker's pinky or little finger away from the other fingers hard and fast (it breaks easily).
**SHINS**
- Kick against the attacker’s shins as hard as you can.
**TOP OF FEET**
- Lift your foot and stomp your heel on the top of your attacker’s foot.
text:
**ITEMPILE**
Hlohla inqindi etempileni yomhlaseli okanye umva wengqiniba.

**IMPUMLO**
Hlohla inqindi empumlweni yomhlaseli okanye umva wenqiniba.

**INDLEBE**
Qhwaba ngempama indlebe zomhlaseli macala omabini ngamandla. Ungakwazi nokuzitsala okanye uzijije.

**RIBS**
Hlohla inqindi ezimbanjeni zomhlaseli okanye umva wengqiniba.

**IMINWE**
Tsala uPinky okanye ucikicane kakhulu kwaye ngokungxamisekileyo (wophuka msinyane)

**IZIQHITSI**
Khaba umhlaseli kangangoko unako ngamandla
** UMPHEZULU WENYAWO**
Phakamisa unyawo lakho kwaye unyathele ngesithende unyawo lomhlaseli wakho.

SourceText: Here is an additional image to show you more examples of how you can use the weak spots or targets on your attacker’s body.
text: Nanku umfanekiso owongezelekileyo ukubonisa indlela yokusebenzisa eminye imizekelo kwi mpawu ezilula okanye ojolise kuzo emzimbeni womhlaseli wakho.

SourceText: Here are some skills to help you and your teen stay safe!
text: Nazi ezinye izakhono ezinokuninceda kunye nomntana wakho ofikisayo nihlale nikhuselekile!

SourceText: KNOW IT
text: YAZI

SourceText:
Know the difference between healthy and unhealthy relationships. If someone hurts you, it is never your fault.

You are allowed to say and do what is needed to stay safe and get away—don’t worry about what others think.

You are worth defending. You are strong and powerful.
text:
Wazi umehluko phakathi kobudlelwane ubusempilweni nobongekho mpilweni. Ukuba umntu uyakonzakalisa, ayompazamo yakho tuu.

Uvumelekile ukutsho kwayo wenze nantona enyanzelekilyo ukuze uzingcine ukhuselekile kwaye ukhululeke-sukuba naxhala ngento ecingwa ngabanye.

Ukufanele ukukhuselwa. Uqinile kwaye unamandla.

SourceText: SEE IT
text: YIBONE

SourceText:
If someone says or does something that makes you feel uncomfortable, it’s not okay. We all have the right to feel safe, especially at home.

See the warning signs and trust your feelings. If you feel unsafe, the goal is to get away.
text: Ukuba umntu uthi okanye wenza into ekwenza uzive ungakhululekanga, ayilunganga lonto. Sonke sine lungelo lukuziva sikhuselekile, ngakumbi emakhaya.

SourceText: SAY IT
text: YITHETHE

SourceText:
Your voice can help stop an attack. Yell, call for help, warn, act, or use humour to stay safe.

Be clear, confident, and direct—use your words, body, and eyes.
text:
Ilizwi lakho linganceda linqade uhlaselo. Khwaza, ukubiza uncedo, lumnkisa, yenza, okanye usebenzise ubuntu ukuze uhlale ukhuselekile.

Cacisa, uzithembe, kwaye usebenzise amagama akho nqoo, umzimba, kunye namehlo.

SourceText: DO IT
text: YENZE

SourceText:
If your voice doesn’t help, use your body.

Know the strong parts of your body you can use, and where on the attacker’s body you can hit to stop them. Use what you can to protect yourself and get away.
text:
Ukuba ilizwi alikuncedi, sebenzisa umzimba wakho.

Zazi indawo iziqinileyo emzimbeni wakho onokuzisebenzisa, kwaye nase mzimbeni womhlaseli ukumnqanda. Sebenzisa into onokwazi ukuyisebenzisa ukuzikhusela nase kubalekeni.

SourceText: More tips
text: Ezinye ingcebiso

SourceText:
In danger, it’s normal to freeze or feel unsure. These tools can help you and your teen stay safe.

If you or your teen are hurt, it is never your fault. Talk to someone you trust.

As a parent, let your teen know they can always tell you anything, and you’ll find a solution together.
text:
Engozini, kuqhelekile ukuba wothuke okanye uzive ubhidekile. Ezi zizixhobho zingakunceda kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo nihlale nikhuselekile.

Ukuba wena nomntana wakho ofikisayo nonzakele, ayompazamo yakho. Thetha nomntu omthembileyo.

Nje ngomzali, yazisa umntana wakho ofikisayo ayazi ukuba angakuxelela nantoni na, kwaye nizofukumana isisombululo kunye.

SourceText:
This week’s home activity is to talk with your teen about this Staying Safe module.

Try the activities on warning signs and using voice and body together.

These conversations can be hard at first, but they give your teen important skills for staying safe. You can do it!
text:
Umsebenzi wasekhaya waleveki kukuthetha nomntwana wakho ofikisayo nge modyuli yokuhlala ekhuselekile.

Zama imisebenzi kwimpawu ezilumkisayo kwaye usebenzise ilizwi kunye nomzimba ngexesha elinye.

Ezi ncoko zinganzima ekuqaleni, kodwa zimnika umntwana wakho ofikisayo izakhono ezibalulekileyo zokuhlala ekhuselekile. Ungayenza!

SourceText:
**Remember to:**

⚠️ Spot warning signs: Talk with your teen about places, people, or situations that may not be safe. Remind them to trust their feelings.
📣 Use your voice: Practise saying “no” or asking for help.
🙅🏽‍♀️ Use your body: Make a plan together for how to leave or protect yourself.
text:
**Khumbula oku**

⚠️ Qwalasela imiqathango yezilumkiso: Thetha nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ngendawo, abantu, okanye imeko ezingakhuselekanga. Bakhumbuze ukuthemba imvakalelo.
📣Sebenzisa ilizwi lakho: Ziqhelise ukuthi "hayi" okanye ucele uncedo.
🙅🏽‍♀️Sebenzisa umzimba wakho: Yenzani icebo nobabini ukuba ungaphila njani okanye uzikhusele njani.

SourceText: Can you discuss the Staying Safe module with your teen this week?
text: Ungaxoxa ngemodyuli Ukuhlala ukhuselekile nomtana wakho ofikisayo kule veki?

SourceText: Yes
text: Ewe

SourceText: Fantastic! Going through this module’s skills makes it more likely your teen will act quickly and protect themselves when it matters most.
text: Kwakuhle! Ukudlula kwizakhono zalemodyuli kwenza kubekuhle ukuba umntwana wakho ofikisayo akwazi ukwenza izinto ngokukhawuleza kwaye bazikhusele apho kuyimfuneko khona.

SourceText: I think so
text: Ndicinga njalo

SourceText: That is a good start! Every time you talk about safety, you make it easier for your teen to trust their instincts and speak up. Keep going!
text: Sisiqalo esihle esi! Ngalo lonke ixesha uthetha ngokhuseleko, wenza kubelula emntwaneni wakho ofikisayo ukuba azithembe ingcinga zakhe kwaye athethe. Qhubekeka!

SourceText: No
text: Hayi

SourceText: That's okay. Safety talks can feel hard, but even one conversation can prepare your teen for real situations. You can try again when you are ready.
text: Kulungile. Intetho ezikhuselekileyo zingavakala zinzima, kodwa ngencoko nje enye ingalungiselela umntwana wakho ofikisayo kwimeko zokwenene. Ungazama kwakhona xa ukulungele.

SourceText:
Helping your teen learn to notice danger, speak up, and protect themselves builds real confidence.

Practising together makes it more likely they will act when something feels wrong.
text:
Unkuncedisa umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba afunde ukuqwalasela ingozi, ukuthetha phandle, nokuzikhusela kwakha ukuzithemba kwenene.

Yenza ukuba kube lula ukuba bathathe amanyathelo xa kukho into engalunganga.

SourceText: Hear how @data.characters.media_daughter_9.name used her voice to stay safe
text: Yiva indlela u @data.characters.media_daughter_9.name asebenzise ngayo ilizwi lakhe ukuhlala ephephile
note: The string @data.characters.media_daughter_9.name should not be translated.

SourceText: It helped me a lot that I learnt I can use my voice to stay safe. A while ago, I was walking home alone and some man began to follow me and I felt scared. My father taught me that the most important thing is to be safe, so I turned around and said loud and clear ‘Why are you following me, I don’t want that’. It really surprised the man and even some other people looked at us, so the man walked away. I felt so relieved and even told my father. He said I did well and I felt really good. Before, I would have been too scared, also what other people think, but now I feel confident.
text: Indincedile kakhulu into yokuba ndifunde ukusebenzisa ilizwi lam ukuhlala ndikhuselekile. Kudala, ndandisendleleni egodukayo ndedwa kwaye kwabakho umntu oyindoda ondilandelayo ndaziva ndisoyika. Utata wam wandixelela ukuba eyonanto ibalulekileyo kukukhuseleka, ndaye ndakuquka ndatsho ngokukhwaza nangokucacileyo ' undilandelela ntoni, andiyifuni lonto'. Yayothusa le ndoda lento kwaye nabanye abantu bajonga kuthi, lendoda yahambela kude. Ndaziva ndikhululekile kwaye ndaxelela utata wam. Wathi ndenze kakuhle kwaye ndaziva kamnandi. Ngaphambili, bendisoyika kakhulu kwaye ndicinga ukuba bazakuthini abanye abantu, kodwa ngoku ndiziva ndizithemba.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about managing stress.

We know how stressful it is to bring up teenagers in these times. Learning to manage your stress helps you – and your family.
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje simalunga nokulawula uxinzelelo

Siyayazi kunzima kangakanani na ukukhulisa abantwana abafikisayo kulamaxesha. Ukufunda ukulawula uxinzelelo lwakho kunceda wena - nosapho lwakho.

SourceText: Can managing stress help you and your family? Tap play to find out
text: Ingaba ukulawula uxinzelelo kungakunceda wena nosapho lwakho? Cofa udlala ukufumanisa

SourceText:
Greetings everyone.

Today's topic is managing stress.

It is important to know how to manage our stress. At times our children can behave in ways that make us feel stressed and us as parents can make our children feel stressed too.

So, it is important to notice when we feel stressed and take a pause and breathe. That will help you manage your stress.
text:
Molweni nonke. 

Umxholo wanamhlanje ungokulawula uxinzelelo. 

Kubalulekile ukwazi indlela yokulawula uxinzelelo lwethu. Ngamanye amaxesha abantwana bethu bangaziphatha ngeendlela ezinokusenza sizive sinoxinzelelo yaye nathi bazali sinokwenza abantwana bethu bazive benonxinzelelo nabo. 

Ngoko, kubalulekile ukuqaphela xa siziva sinoxinzelelo kwaye sime sitsale umoya. Loo nto iya kunceda ulawule uxinzelelo.

SourceText:
With a few small changes, you can feel more peaceful in your normal day-to-day life.

When you are peaceful, your family members will get calmer too!
text:
Kutshintsho oluncinci, ungaziva unoxolo ngakumbi kubomi bakho besiqhelo bemihla ngemihla.

Xa unoxolo, nosapho lwakho luyazola!

SourceText: Pause, take a breath. Now hear how taking a simple pause helped @data.characters.media_female_4.name and her teens
text: Yima, tsala umoya. Ngoku mamela ukuba ukuma ithutyana kunceda njani u@data.characters.media_female_4.name kunye nabantwana bakhe abafikisayo
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_4.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Life is tough sometimes. Before I joined @global.app_name, I used to be grumpy at all times. I would take out my anger on everyone at home, not only my teens but even my husband as well. They would run away when I came home because they knew I would start yelling at them.

Learning to take a pause and breathe was difficult at first. But every time I tried it, it helped me to calm down. Now my teens are no longer running away when I come home and they actually listen better than when I used to shout at them!
text:
Ubomi bunzima ngamanye amaxesha. Phambi kokuba ndibeyinxalenye @global.app_name, bendihlala ndinomsindo ngalo lonke ixesha. Bendikhuphela umsindo wam kumntu wonke osekhayeni, ibingengobantwana bam bodwa kodwa nomyeni wam. Babebalekela kude xa ndifika ekhayeni kuba babeyazi ndizakubangxolisa.

Ukufunda ukuma kwaye nditsale umoya bekunzima ekuqaleni. Kodwa ngalo lonke ixesha ndizama, yandinceda ndehlisa umoya. Ngoku abantwana bam abasabalekeli kude xa ndifika ekhayeni kwaye bamamela ngcono kunangexesha bendithethela phezulu nabo!
note: The string @global.app_name, should not be translated.

SourceText: Let’s look at an example of how stress can sometimes just get too much, for all of us:
text: Makhe sijonge indlela uxinezeleko olunokuthi maxa wambi lube ngaphaya kwamandla, kuthi sonke:

SourceText: @data.characters.f1_father.name lost his job. He was sitting at home feeling frustrated and stressed when @data.characters.f1_son_18.name entered the room.
text: u@data.characters.f1_father.name uphelelwe ngumsebenzi. Ebehleli endlini eziva ekhathazekile kwaye enoxinzelelo xa u@data.characters.f1_son_18.name engena egumbini.

SourceText: Leave me alone and mind your own business!
text: Yohlukana nam kwaye hoya umsebenzi wakho!

SourceText: What did I do? You never listen!
text: Ndenze ntoni? Awumameli!

SourceText: I said leave me alone or you will get a beating!

SourceText: Look! I have made a house!
text: Jonga! Ndenze indlu!

SourceText: Who cares about your stupid house!
text: Ngubani oyikhathaleleyo londlu yobudenge yakho!

SourceText: Let's think about what happened in this story.
text: Makhe sicinge ngoko kwenzekileyo kweli bali.

SourceText: Yes, when we recognise we feel stressed, we can take a deep breath and respond with calm and understanding. That way we can find solutions together that work.

SourceText: Yes, when we recognise we feel stressed, we can take a deep breath and respond with calm and understanding. That way we can find solutions together that make everyone feel better.
text: Ewe, xa siqaphela siziva sinoxinzeleo, singatsala umoya kwaye siphendule zolileyo nokuqonda. Ngalondlela singafumana izisombululo ezinokusisebenzela sonke.

SourceText: Thank you for thinking along! Let’s go back in time and see what @data.characters.f1_father.name does now:
text: Enkosi ngokucinga kunye! Masibuyele emva ngexesha kwaye sibone ukuba u@data.characters.f1_father.name wenzani ngoku:

SourceText: @data.characters.f1_father.name lost his job. He was sitting at home feeling frustrated and stressed, when his son @data.characters.f1_son_18.name entered the room.
text: u@data.characters.f1_father.name uphelelwe ngumsebenzi. Ebehleli endlini eziva ekhathazekile kwaye enoxinzelelo, xa unyana wakhe u@data.characters.f1_son_18.name engena egumbini.

SourceText: Can I have money to buy some airtime?
text: Ndingayifumana imali yokuthenga airtime?

SourceText: *(taking a breath)* I’m sorry son. I had a difficult day today. The boss fired me.
text: *(etsala umoya)* Uxolo nyana. Bendinemini enzima namhlanje. Umphathi wam undigxothile.

SourceText: Oh no! I need a new school uniform.
text: Oh hayi! Ndidinga impahla entsha yesikolo.

SourceText: I’ll try, son, and your @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name's job will help us get by while I look for another job.
text: Ndizakuzama, nyana, kwaye U@data.characters.f1_mother.role_name umsebenzi wakhe uzokusinceda ngethuba ndisakhangela omnye umsebenzi.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name's should not be translated.

SourceText: Should I also help you look for work, @data.characters.f1_father.role_name?
text: Ndingakunceda nam ukukhangela umsebenzi, @data.characters.f1_father.role_name?
note: The string @data.characters.f1_father.role_name? should not be translated.

SourceText: No it’s okay, @data.characters.f1_son_18.name. I appreciate your offer. The most important thing is that you work hard at school. Thanks for listening to me.
text: Hayi kulungile, @data.characters.f1_son_18.name. Ndiyakwamkela ukuzinikela kwakho. Eyonanto ibalulekileyo kukuba usebenze nzima esikolweni. Enkosi ngokundimamela.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_son_18.name. should not be translated.

SourceText: Let’s play some soccer together. It will help me get this stress off my mind for a bit.
text: Masidlale ibhola ekhatywayo sobabini. Izakundinceda ndikhuphe uxinzelelo olusengqondweni yam oko mzuzwana.

SourceText: Okay, @data.characters.f1_father.role_name!
text: Kulungile, @data.characters.f1_father.role_name!
note: The string @data.characters.f1_father.role_name! should not be translated.

SourceText:
Now let's look at an example where something simple, like a Safety Word, can help manage stress and keep your teen safe. 

First, think back to when you were a teenager. Was there ever a time when you were in danger but you could not tell your family because they would have been angry?

This ALMOST happened to @data.characters.f1_son_18.name and @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name! Let’s have a look:
text:
Ngoku masijonge kumzekelo apho kukho into elula, njengegama elikhuselekileyo, linganceda ukulawula uxinzelelo kwaye ligcine umntwana wakho ofikisayo akhuseleke.

Kuqala, cinga emva ngexesha apho wawusengumntwana ofikisayo. Lalikhe lakhona ixesha apho wawusengozini kodwa wawungakwazi ukuxelela usapho lwakho kuba babezakuba nomsindo?

Lento YAPHANTSE ukwenzeka ku@data.characters.f1_son_18.name kunye no@data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name! makhe sijonge:

SourceText: Don’t tell the adults, but I am going to a bar with my friends tonight.
text: Ungabaxeleli abantu abadala, kodwa ndiya emzini othengisa utywala nabahlobo bam ebusuku.

SourceText: Have fun! I told them I am staying with my girlfriend, but I am actually going to a cool party.
text: Wonwabe! Ndibaxelele ukuba ndihlala nesinqanda mathe sam, kodwa apho ndiya khona ndiya esiyungumeni.

SourceText: I think they are dealing drugs. We could all get arrested. But I can’t tell my parents – they will be so angry!
text: Ndicinga ukuba basebenzisa iziyobisi. Singabanjwa sonke. Kodwa andinakubaxelela abazali bam – baya kuba nomsindo kakhulu!

SourceText: I am scared. Everyone is too drunk to drive me home. This guy says he will take me, but he wants us to go to his house first. I can’t tell my parents – I lied about coming to this party.
text: : “Ndiyoyika. Wonke umntu unxile kakhulu ukuba angandigodusa. Lo mfana uthi angandigodusa kodwa ufuna siqale kwakhe. Andinakubaxelela abazali bam - ndibaxokisile ngokuza kule pati.”

SourceText: These are dangerous situations! Thankfully, @data.characters.f1_son_18.name and @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name then remembered what their father told them:
text: Ezi zimeko ezinobungozi! Kungumbulelo,u@data.characters.f1_son_18.name kunye no@data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name baye bakhumbula into utata wabo ewayebaxelele yona:

SourceText:
I care about your safety more than anything. If you are ever upset, or scared, you can always call me for help, or tell me about it.

Shall we use an imaginary ‘Aunty Cecilia’ as our Safety Word? Just say something about Aunty Cecilia, I promise that I will try my best to help and I will not be angry – even if you are doing something you shouldn't be doing.
text:
Ndiyakhathala ngokhuseleko lwakho ngaphezu kwayo nayiphi into. Ukuba uye wakhathazeka, okanye usoyika, ungandifowunela rhoqo malunga noncedo, okanye undixelele ngalonto. 

Singasebenzisa umfanekiso ongengowenyani ka 'kaAunty Cecilia' njengegama lokhuseleko? Itsho nje into malunga noAunt Cecilia, Ndiyathembisa into yokuba ndizakuzama kangangoko ndinako ukunceda kwaye andizukhathazeka -- noba wenza into ongamelanga ukuba uyayenza.

SourceText: Hey father, how is Aunty Cecilia doing now?
text: Hey tata, unjani uAunty Cecilia ngoku?

SourceText: *(on the other side of the phone)* Not well. We need you at home. I will come pick you up right away. Where are you?
text: *(Kwelinye icala le phone) * Akukho nto intle. Sidinga wena ekhaya. Ndizazokulanda njengangoku. Uphi?

SourceText: (🤔_thinking_) I think my friends are in trouble. I don’t want to stop being their friend, but I’m worried. Maybe @data.characters.f1_father.role_name knows what to do.
text: (🤔_ ecinga_) Ndicinga abahlobo bam basengxakini. Andifuni ukuyeka ukuba ngumhlobo wabo, kodwa ndikhathazekile. Mhlawumbi u@data.characters.f1_father.role_name uyayazi into amakayenze.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_father.role_name should not be translated.

SourceText: @data.characters.f1_father.role_name, I just remembered, Aunty Cecilia said she will come visit tomorrow.
text: @data.characters.f1_father.role_name, Ndiye ndakhumbula, Aunty Cecilia wathi uzakuza azokusindwendwela ngomso.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_father.role_name, should not be translated.

SourceText: *(on the other side of the phone)* Okay, I need you at home to help get things ready. I will come pick you up now. Where are you?
text: *(kwelinye icala le fowuni)* Okay, Ndiyakudinga ekhayeni uzokunceda ukulungisa izinto. Ndizazokulanda ngoku. Uphi?

SourceText:
Having a Safety Word can help your teen stay safe too. You can choose any word as a Safety Word. Only your family knows it means ‘help’.

Your teen can say this word to let you know they are in trouble without you getting angry or punishing them, so you can help them.
text:
Ukuba negama elikhuselekileyo kunganceda umntana wakho ofikisayo ahlale ekhuselekile naye. Ungakhetha naliphi igama njengegama elikhuselekileyo. Lusapho lwakho kuphela oluyaziyo ukuba kuthetha 'uncedo'. 

Umntana wakho ofikisayo angalibiza eligama ukwazisa ukuba basengxakini ngaphandle kokuba nomsindo okanye ubohlwaye, ke ungakwazi ukubanceda'.

SourceText:
**What Safety Word can you choose with your teen? Here are some ideas from other families:**

🥑 A specific food
👵🏽 A specific family member
🐒 A specific animal
🤔 Something else
text:
** Leliphi igama elikhuselekileyo onolikhetha kunye nomntana wakho ofikisayo? Nazi imbono ezisuka kwezinye intsapho.**

🥑 Ukutya okuthile
👵🏽Ilungu losapho oluthile 
🐒 Isilwanyana esithile
🤔Into engenye

SourceText: Here are a few skills to help you manage stress that you can use with your teens!
text: Nazi izakhono ezimbalwa ongazisebenzisa ukunceda wena ukwazi ukumelana nonxinzelelo kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo!

SourceText: BREATHE
text: PHEFUMLA

SourceText:
Breathe slowly. Pause.

Before you say anything, slowly breathe in and out five times. It will calm you, and give you a chance to think.
text:
Tsala umoya ngokucothayo. Yima.

Ngaphambi kokuba uthethe nantoni na, ngokucothayo tsala umoya uphinde uwukhuphe izihlandlo ezintlanu. Loo nto iya kukwenza uzole, ize ikunike ithuba lokucinga.

SourceText: SHARE
text: YABELANANI

SourceText:
Share how you feel.

This is hard. Many of us were told not to cry, or show our feelings to our children. But take a deep breath and calmly tell them how you feel. They will understand better, and also learn from you how to deal with stress.
text:
Yabelana ngendlela ovakalelwa ngayo.

Lento inzima. Uninzi lwethu lwaxelelwa ukuba lungakhali, okanye lubonise abantwana indlela esivakalelwa ngayo. Kodwa thatha umoya kwaye ngokuzolileyo ubachazele indlela ovakalelwa ngayo. Baya kuqonda ngcono, baze bafunde kuwe indlela yokuhlangabezana noxinzelelo.

SourceText: SHOW
text: BONISA

SourceText:
Show them you care.

This is also hard! Stress makes us focus on ourselves. But our teens need our support. Ask them how they feel. Listen to them and comfort them. Try a hug or say "I understand". It can change everything.
text:
Babonise uyakhathala

Nale inzima! Uxinzelelo lubangela ukuba sinikele ingqalelo kwiziqu zethu. Kodwa abantwana bethu abafikisayo bayayidinga inkxaso yethu. Babuze indlela abaziva ngayo. Mamela kubo kwaye ubathuthuzele. Zama ubanga okanye uthi ‘Ndiyaqonda’. Ingatshintsha yonke into.

SourceText: SEEK
text: FUNA

SourceText:
Seek the positive.

Can you and your teen think about ideas that might help? Can you do something positive together to take your mind off the stress?
text:
Funa okulungileyo

Ingaba wena nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ningacinga ngezinto ezinokuba luncedo? Ingaba nobabini ningenza into elungileyo ukususa iingqondo zenu kuxinzelelo?

SourceText:
There are two home activities for this week:

1) Whenever you are feeling stressed or upset with your teen, take five breaths in and out before you react.
And when you're both calm, share with each other how you feel. 

2) Choose a "Safety Word" with your teen, and think of a situation together when you could use this.
text:
Kunemisebenzi emibini yasekhaya kule veki:

1) Naninina uziva unoxinzelelo okanye ucatshukiswe ngumntwana wakho osafikisayo, tsala umoya kahlanu ngaphakathi nangaphandle phambi kokuba uphendule.
Kwaye xa nobabini nizolile, yabelanani kunye ngendlela eniziva ngayo.

2) Khetha igama "elikhuselekileyo" kunye nomtana wakho ofikisayo, kwaye nicinge ngesimo kunye apho ninokwazi usebenzisa lento.

SourceText:
**Remember to:** 

😮‍💨 BREATHE: take five breaths in and out before you react
🤝🏾 SHARE: when you're both calm, share with your teen how you feel
💙 SHOW: ask them how they feel to show you care
🔍 SEEK: find something positive in this situation together
text:
**Khumbula uku:**

😮‍💨TSALA UMOYA: tsala umoya kahlanu ngaphakathi nangaphandle phambi kokuba uphendule
🤝🏾YABELANA: xa nobabini nizolile, yabelanani wena nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ngohlobo oziva ngalo
💙 BONISA: babuze baziva njani ukubonisa ukuba uyakhathala
🔍FUNA: fumanani into elungileyo kwesisimo nobabini

SourceText: Can you respond calmly and choose a “Safety Word” with your teen this week?
text: Ungakwazi uphendula ngokuzolileyo kwaye ukhethe "Igama Elikhuselekileyo" kunye nomntana wakho ofikisayo kuleveki?

SourceText: Yes
text: Ewe

SourceText: Great! Staying calm and having a “Safety Word” will help you and your family.
text: Kulungile! Ukuhlala uzolile kwaye "unegama elikhuselekileyo" izakunceda wena kunye nosapho lwakho.

SourceText: I think so
text: Ndicinga njalo

SourceText: That’s a good start. When you are stressed, remember to take a few deep breaths, it will make it easier to respond calmly.
text: Eso sisiqalo esilungileyo. Xa unoxinzelelo, khumbula ukutsala umoya kancinci, lonto izakwenza kubelula ukuphendula ngokuzolileyo.

SourceText: No
text: Hayi

SourceText: I understand, sometimes we just don’t have capacity. Try to keep spending time with your teen - whenever you are ready you can practise responding calmly and find a Safety Word together.
text: Ndiyayiqonda, ngamanye amaxesha asinawo umthamo. Zama uqhubeke uchitha ixesha nomntana wakho ofikisayo - naninina ulungele ungazilungiselela uphendula ngokuzolileyo kwaye ufumane igama elikhuselekileyo nobabini.

SourceText: Hear how @data.characters.media_son_1.name learned to stay calm from his father
text: Mamela indlela u@data.characters.media_son_1.name afunde ngayo ukuhlala ezolile kutata wakhe
note: The string @data.characters.media_son_1.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Whenever I would do something wrong, my father would get so angry at me and beat me. He would not even listen to me and I would get so angry as well at him and everyone else.

Now, when he gets angry, he first takes a few deep breaths before he responds. It makes everyone calm down instead of causing a big fight.

It really helped me at home and at school, because even me I am no longer slashing everyone and I am no longer this moody person. When I feel really angry or stressed, I also take deep breaths like my father does. I am a different person.
text:
Naninina ndisenza into engalunganga, utata wam uye abenomsindo kakhulu kum kwaye andibethe. Akamameli nomamela kum kwaye ndiye ndibenomsindo kakhulu kuye nakwabanye abantu.

Ngoku, Xa enomsindo utsala umoya kuqala kancinci phambi kokuba aphendule. Lonto yenza wonke umntu abenomoya ozolileyo ndaweni yokubangela umlo omkhulu.

Iyandinceda nyani lonto ekhaya kunye nasesikolweni, kuba andisaphoxi wonke umntu kwaye andise ngomntu onengcwangu. Xa ndiziva ndinomsindo nyani kwaye ndinoxinzelelo, Nam nditsala umoya ngohlobo enza ngalo tata wam. Ndingumntu owohlukileyo.

SourceText: Think about today

SourceText:
Close your eyes. 

Take a minute to think about the day.

Think about one positive or fun thing you did.
Praise yourself for one thing you did well today. 
Think of one thing you can do differently tomorrow.  
Think of one thing that you are grateful for.
text:
Vala amehlo akho. 

Thatha umzuzu ucinge ngosuku lwakho.

Cinga ngento ekhuthazayo okanye emnandi oye wayenza.
Zincome ngokwenza into enye kakuhle namhlanje. 
Cinga ngento enye onokuyenza ngendlela eyahlukileyo ngomso.  
Cinga ngento enye onombulelo ngayo.

SourceText: Counting sounds
text: Ukubala izandi

SourceText:
Sit down and close your eyes.
How many sounds can you hear?  
Listen to the sounds inside and outside the room. Count them on your fingers. 
After ten seconds, how many fingers do you have up? What sounds did you hear? 

Try again for another ten seconds.  
Did you hear any new sounds? Did you hear any sounds inside your own body? 
Notice how you feel now.
text:
Hlala phantsi uze uvale amehlo akho.
Zingaphi izandi ozivayo?  
Mamela izandi ezingaphakathi nangaphandle kwegumbi. Zibale usebenzisa iminwe yakho. 
Emva kwemizuzwana elishumi, mingaphi iminwe oyibambileyo? Uve izandi ezingaphi? 

Zama kwakhona kangangemizuzwana elishumi.  
Ngaba uve izandi ezintsha? Zikhona izandi ozivileyo ngaphakathi komzimba wakho? 
Phawula indlela ovakalelwa ngayo ngoku.

SourceText: Praise yourself
text: Zincome

SourceText:
Self-praise can be really helpful, especially when we have difficult days. 

Think of your week and finish the following phrase: “This week, I am proud of myself for …” It can be anything, not just things about being a parent!

Think of one thing you did well today. Now wrap your arms around yourself and give yourself a big HUG!
text:
Ukuzincoma kungaluncedo kakhulu, ingakumbi ngeentsuku ekunzima ngazo. 

Cinga ngeveki yakho uze ugqibezele esi sivakalisi: “Kule veki, ndiyazingca ngokuba...” Ingayiyo nantoni na emalunga nokuba ngumzali!

Cinga ngento enye oyenze kakuhle namhlanje. Ngoku, thatha iingalo zakho uze UZANGE!

SourceText: Connect
text: Qhagamshela

SourceText: When you take care of yourself, you take care of your children. We all need to connect. Try to talk to friends, family, and other support networks every day. If it has been a while since you reached out to someone, do it now!
text: Xa uzikhathalele, uhoye abantwana bakho. Sonke kufuneka sidibane. Zama ukuthetha nabahlobo, usapho, kunye nolunye uthungelwano lwenkxaso yonke imihla. Ukuba sekulithuba ugqibele ukufowunela umntu, kwenze ngoku oko!
